name: Haunticulture
description:
Creepstone Manor is empty again, the last ‘guest’ running screaming into the night as Tinker, Creak, Giggle and Boo celebrate their victory.

But Spookie won’t let them rest on their laurels! The house is secure, so it’s time to turn your attention further afield and sort the gardens of Creepstone Manor.

Unfortunately, being a ghost has certain disadvantages. For one, handling a spade is tricky when your hand keeps passing straight through it! But help is on hand. The resurrected gardeners from the Manor’s heyday have returned to lend their rotted expertise to you. Use your crew of Zombies, Skeletons and Ghouls to grab plants and ornaments for your part of the garden; hire new crew members such as werewolves and vampires to boost your work and get those extra flowers planted before the night is over. But beware! Only those ghosts who show the greatest aesthetic eye will impress Spookie and be the best undead Haunticulturist.

During their turn, players will bid for plant and ornament tiles using the monster cards they have in hand. Each monster has a gardening skill number (the higher the better) and up to two special abilities. During bidding, players will need to consider both the row and column their monsters are in when trying to grab those tokens. On top of this, if a player can play the third in a row of a particular monster type (say zombie or skeleton) they'll be rewarded with a boosted special ability on that card.

Players also can earn gold in the game, either through clearing 'junk' from their player board or various monster abilities. These can be used to hire 'special monsters' that have enhanced skills and abilities which the player keeps from round to round, replacing the basic monsters the player starts with.

After bidding, each player will place any plant tokens onto their personal flower bed (even the bad ones that score negative points!). How these are placed will affect the players' scores at the end of the game. How each plant will score can be varied by the players, changing the challenge from game to game.

Players can also use the gold earned earlier to build any ornament tiles earned during bidding. Do you fill up on gnomes to get the highest score, or shoot for the all-or-nothing fountain?

Finally, players can earn points for a secret objective card selected at the beginning of the game. These feature a way to score that is unique to that player, and can be the difference between winning and losing.

The game ends after four rounds, at which point each player tallies up their score for plants, ornaments and secret objectives with the highest score being crowned Head Haunticulturist!

Haunticulture also includes rules for solo play

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Nightwatch: Terror and Treasure in the Dark Corners of the World
description:
NIGHTWATCH is a game about killing monsters. All kinds, anywhere, any time.

You and your friends are members of the NIGHTWATCH: an ancient order of warriors, trackers, wizards, and alchemists dedicated to hunting down and destroying the malevolent creatures that terrorize humanity.

Over the course of the game, your characters will rise through the ranks of their chosen Guild, gaining experience and unlocking new skills as they fight ever more dangerous enemies on the blood-soaked path to confront their ultimate quarry.

Miniatures agnostic and adaptable to nearly any fantasy setting from Ancients to Black Powder, NIGHTWATCH is easy to learn and quick to play, with straightforward dice mechanics and minimal book keeping.

Made for Cooperative or Solo gaming, you can read the book in an afternoon and gather your friends, your dice, terrain, and miniatures that evening for your first hunt.

These rules are a framework for you to build your own tales of heart-stopping bravery, foul treachery, cringe-worthy cowardice, and most of all, epic victories against overwhelming odds.

So sharpen your sword, check the flints on your pistols, and grab a healing potion; it’s time to give the monsters something to fear.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kurr√ºf: Roll & Write
description:
HISTORY: We are nature lovers and we are trying to photograph the Great Kurruf, the Huemul of the Chilean national reserve Huilo Huilo. We put our camps on one of the banks of the biological reserve and we explore camera in hand trying to photograph as much of the flora and fauna as possible: Trees, shrubs, butterflies, birds, lizards and cats in southern Chile.
GOAL

Explore the biological reserve Huilo Huilo watching its biodiversity, for this we will get parts of your map by means of the given dice. The species are divided according to their level on the trophic scale between 1 producers, 2 herbivores 3 predators, 4 decomposers.

Roll the dice, draw the figures and record an animal in the observation book, then record the number of the die in the exploration zone trying a trio or a scale. Finally, register the dice not chosen in the trash, be careful with the registered numbers, you can cause micro dumps or fires.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building

name: Rebellion
description:
Rebellion is a social deduction party game set in the late Soviet era. It pits those looking to overthrow the government against those seeking to infiltrate and sabotage the resistance.

For setup, players are given unique roles such as Doctor or Hacker (each with a special ability) and then split into two secret teams: Rebels and Spies.

Each player's turn has three steps: Draw, Check, and Recruit. First, a player draws an event card and follows the instructions on it. These cards may do things such as kill other players, change loyalties, or provide valuable information. Then players check to see if enough players are recruited. If there aren't, players end their turn by recruiting another player, who goes next.

When there are enough recruited players, The Rebellion starts: loyalties are revealed and counted. Whichever team got more players recruited wins.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Events, Hidden Roles, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 1942 Flip Roll & Write
description:
During the Pacific War of World War II our fighter will have to destroy the Japanese air fleet located in one of Japan's most important cities, but during the trip we will encounter enemy aircraft that will try to thwart our mission.

1942 is a flip & write where you must defeat different enemies that come out of a deck of cards.

With a few scroll mechanisms, new cards will appear and disappear at the same time.

Your mission is to make the maximum number of points by defeating planes, ships and other enemies, until you reach the enemy base and destroy it.

During the game, bonuses may appear on the cards that will give you combos or new weapons.

The final objective is to reach Tokyo with the highest possible score.

The game can be played in solo or 2-player mode.

The game is available in Print & Play.

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Video Game Theme, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mole King
description:
Mole king has a story that finds the greatest mole king.

The ‘mole kings’ of each country that govern peaceful mole kingdoms. One day, they heard a rumor about a land full of gold and silver, and they went on a journey to find the land of gold. As if they had made such a promise, the ‘mole kings’ of each country have gathered on the land of gold. You become a ‘mole king’ to drive out other kingdoms and occupy the land of gold. Who will take over the land of gold and become the best ‘mole king’!

Cute artwork with components and easy tile placement is the strength of this game.

Components are 61 Cards, 20 Gold&Silver tokens, 4 Makers, and 4 Quick reference Cards.

Game Setup, each player takes their color's cards(15), 1 gold token, and 1 reference card. All players flip the reference card to the other side then see the brown border that player has become the start player.
All players draw 4 cards from the deck and place the starting card in the middle of the table.

Gameplay action has only 6 steps.

Return: Take the maker that the player placed in the previous round back to the player's hand.



Placement: Select a card from hand and placed it. Do not place it diagonally.



Acquisition: If the player overlapped card, then gain a silver token per each section overlapped.



Payment: Each Player can get an extra turn by paying 1 gold or 4 silver. After the payment, each player can do step2, and 3 one more time.



Preoccupancy: This last action of the turn. Players can place their maker on the card that the latest place. It doesn't have to be placed on top of your own mole.



Replenishment: After finish, all actions, draw cards from the player's hand to replenish the player's hand back to four.


End of the Game, When a player uses all of their cards, the other players can no longer cover up the sections occupied by any moles as they play their cards, and the game will be continued to play until the last player takes a turn(like a Splender). The player who succeeded in securing the most mole of their player color becomes the winner.
mechanics: Advantage Token, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Kill Steal, Map Addition, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: The Tank Museum
description:
The Tank Museum brings history to life, with the world's best collection of tanks and explosive live displays. Our exhibitions tell the story of armoured warfare spanning over 100 years of history. Exploring seven powerful exhibitions, you will come face to face with almost 300 armoured vehicles. This unique collection is regarded as the finest in the world.

Take your pick from 6 exclusive tokens: Tiger I, Tog II, Mark IV, Army Boot, Wrench or Beret and race around board purchasing historic tanks and building tank sheds to drive the competition off the battlefield.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: BattleCON: Dolores Solo Fighter
description:
Dolores’s wide-reaching attacks combine with the frightful power of the Wings of Malephaise, which allow her to move quickly around the board. Though her ranges are limited, her superior mobility and disruptive potential allow her to create deadly situations for her opponents.

Confound and corner your opponents to strike them down!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Eastern Front: Operational Battles
description:
Eastern Front Operational Battles Quad features four standalone games on the Eastern Front in WWII at an operational level. "Pincers" and "Operation Fredericus" (1942), and "Orel Salient" and "Operation Rumiantsev" (1943).

In May of 1942, portions of the Red Army were to attack the German 6th Army, as mandated by Stalin. This was to be a pincers type attack, enveloping Kharkov. The Germans coincidentally were planning an assault in May against the salient which formed the southern base of the Soviet May offensive. The Red Army struck first, and five days later the German attack commenced. These double offensives are what are covered in “Pincers” and “Operation Fredericus”. As the German Zitadelle offensive of 1943 was winding down, the Soviets launched a major attack of their own on the northern part of the Kursk area. Then on August 3 the Soviets attacked the southern part of the Kursk area. “Orel Salient” and “Operation Rumiantsev” cover these actions.

Eastern Front Operational Battles use the same basic rule set in all four games as one would expect in a quad game. The rules are accessible and straight forward for playability, and at the same time, all aspects, such as movement rates, combat outcomes, and so on, are based on historical analysis. All of the games play at the operational level. Units are mostly regiments/brigades and divisions in the 1942 games, and divisions and corps in the 1943 games.

Product Information:
Complexity: Low/Medium
Time Scale: 1 day per turn for 1942 games, 2 days per turn for 1943 games
Map Scale: 4 miles or 6.4 km/hex for 1942 games, 6 miles per hex for 1943 games
Unit Scale: mostly regiments and divisions for 1942 games, mostly divisions and corps for 1943 games
Players: 1 or 2 (best with 2)
Solitaire: High
Playing Time: 2 hours

Game Components:
4 Maps (17x22" each)
2.5 Countersheets
4 Player Aid Cards
1 Rulebook
1 Playbook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The StoryMaster's Tales "Deeper into the Woods" Hybrid RPG
description:
This expansion contains:
Four new classes:
The Bard: Can avoid fight three time a day by rolling his magic or under.
The Wise Woman: Her fortune never goes below 2.
Lost Childrens: Play as two characters, or two players play one of each. The Brother is more proficient at fighting than her sister, who is more adept in magic.
The Gentleman: Starts with 100 gold, and can get 100 more by rolling a one at The Gates of Threatlore Town three time a day.

Four new quests:
Legend of the Hunt: Chosen One of the prophecy, you must face Odin's Wild Hunt.
A Fistful of Gold: You were drafted to do some voluntary militia works. Your mission: Kill the Bandit Lord.
The Eyes of the Past: After a vision of pestilence coming from an ancient Celtic barrow, the druid Mug Ruith confirms your vision, and instruct you with the task to bring back the Golden Skull to the tomb, where it belongs.
Path of the Forgotten: After what seemed a perfect day start, you find a sword that hold a message from his prior owner. He begs you to avenge him, for he was hanged without trials and is sure he was framed.

15 new story cards, with some of these connecting to The StoryMaster's Tales "Dracodeep Dungeon" Hybrid RPG.

10 new reward cards.

Seven alternative rules, including a rule for critical hit and critical failure, a rule for items with added damage, to add realism, a rule for dual wielding, and a rule to use the same character for multiple quests.

Two D6 dice (for the advanced combat rule).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry ‚Äì Agents of Chaos
description:
The warriors who pledge themselves to the Dark Gods flock to the Eightpoints like their own promised land. Here, they seek to prove themselves – to conquer, raise their foul offerings, and revel in slaughter. Myriad howling beasts and bloodthirsty Daemons are never far behind, eager to catch the eye of the gods and earn infernal glory.

Agents of Chaos is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Chaos in games of Warcry. Nineteen warbands are detailed in full, from festering Maggotkin of Nurgle to vicious skaven. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Chaos in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


Full rules for the following warbands: Beasts of Chaos, Blades of Khorne: Daemons, Blades of Khorne: Bloodbound, Disciples of Tzeentch: Daemons, Disciples of Tzeentch: Arcanites, Maggotkin of Nurgle: Daemons, Maggotkin of Nurgle: Rotbringers, Hedonites of Slaanesh: Daemons, Hedonites of Slaanesh: Sybarites, Skaven, Slaves to Darkness, Iron Golem, Untamed Beasts, Corvus Cabal, Cypher Lords, The Unmade, Splintered Fang, Scions of the Flame, and Spire Tyrants.
Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Chaos ranges.
Rules for three Chaos Allies: Fomoroid Crushers, Ogroid Myrmidons, and Mindstealer Sphiranxes.
New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
4 Chaos Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
6 Chaos Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you desire nothing more than bloodshed in the name of Chaos, this 112-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight: The Battle For the Sittang Bridge February 21-22, 1942
description:
“We arrived at Mokpalin, from the south…There were masses of troops but no staffs… We were at the south of the railway station but west of the line, and throughout the day the Japs were attacking on the other side of the line… After a bit the Kawkareik Brigadier turned up… and really did get things organized. We were very glad to see him. We were to form a box round Mokpalin, we being in the S.W. corner.” –Officer of the 8th Burma Rifles about the battle for the Sittang Bridge.

The situation for the Allies in Burma was increasingly desperate following the Japanese invasion that began in December 1941. After nearly a month of fighting the British Dominion forces were in full retreat, hoping to meet with reinforcements being rushed to the theater and to regroup behind the Sittang River. Key to this goal was the successful withdrawal of the Indian 17th Division. That division had been engaged in a running fight with the Japanese 33rd (214th and 215th Regiments) and 55th (143rd Regiment) Divisions from the outset of the invasion. Both sides converged on the only major bridge over the Sittang river north of Rangoon, a railway span near the town of Sittang. An Allied success here could potentially thwart the Japanese offensive and save Rangoon. Another victory for the Japanese could lead to the capture of that major port and even more conquests by the sons from the land of the Rising Sun.

Each copy of An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
One sheet of 70 double-sided, unmounted counters
8 pages of rules

Infantry units are battalions, all other units are companies. A hex is approximately 800 yards across. Each turn represents six hours of time. Players will need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards is also available.

An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Gazelle Mini Ship Pack
description:
The Gazelle Close Escort was originally designed as an anti-piracy and customs enforcement vessel, with hundreds still in service with the Imperial and Planetary navies. The ship is also popular with small mercenary and private security companies, prized for its robust construction and durability.

This mini ship pack includes 11 cards:

1x Gazelle Close Escort Ship Card

2x Red Team Adventure Card

2x Weapons Testing Adventure Card

3x Drop Capsules Upgrade Card

3x RVD Superdense Armor Upgrade Card

The Gazelle Close Escort mini ship deck is not a standalone product, additional cards are required to play Traveller.

The Traveller Customizable Card Game is a licensed adaptation of Marc Miller's classic science-fiction role-playing game of commerce, exploration and adventure in the Far Future.
mechanics: Events

name: ATS Small Unit Actions I: The Capture of Balta
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System takes you to the village of Balta, 120 miles northwest of Odessa not far from the border of Ukraine and Romania. It was there in 1941 that a joint assault on the village by German and Romanian units was interrupted by a pre-emptive Soviet attack, kicked off by a wave fighter-bombers and followed by stiff, combined-arms resistance from within the town itself. This module marks the debut of Romanian troops and equipment in the ATS milieu.

Contents:
12 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
11 new scenarios
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product, as well as Romanian personnel, Romanian Weapons/Vehicles and Soviet Early-war vehicles countersheets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Misty Waters: At the Edge of World
description:
A historical fiction game set in the "age of sail." As the captain of a small sailing ship, you sail into uncharted waters where strange things happen from time to time.

- The game board shows a map of the archipelago with marked sea lanes, which players will use to move their ship between islands. At the top is a large weather panel, with a Beaufort scale, as the wind strongly affects ships and possible actions. Thanks to the mechanics of uncovering weather tiles, players have an accurate forecast for the next two days.

- In their turns, players can move their ships, fight with cannons or boarding, and perform a number of other actions, such as building facilities, buying or repairing ships, selling goods and valuables found on islands or at sea, and hiring captains, officers and sailors. Moving ships around the board is extremely simple, but good planning and the use of maximum speed can determine the outcome of the game, as sometimes, especially close to the finale, it is very important to get our ship in the right place at the right time.

- Immediately after landing on an island, the player discovers the exploration cards there, which describe adventures, encounters, events or objects. You can find both good things on them (such as pirate treasures) and not-so-good things (plagues, dark forces, strange creatures...). So it's better not to approach this task without having a full crew and with the right action cards in hand.

- Although the Misty Waters are unexplored, the archipelago is nevertheless full of native life forms. Some of them are humans... Players will face all threats, but also other players.

- There are two trading posts with taverns on the islands. Here you can make profitable deals, gamble (inviting other players too!), meet "interesting" people, arrange risky tasks or missions for which you will need cargo holds, passenger cabins or.... cannons.

Each player builds a deck of Action Cards, which in fact is a set of useful tools, such as weapons, additional sails, maps, tactics or experts that can help in difficult situations, significantly affecting the chances of victory. Since the number of Action Cards is limited - you need to choose them wisely, according to your preferred strategy.

- Since the game is designed for 1-4 players, and each player can command up to two ships (6 different types), spectacular sea battles are not uncommon on Misty Waters. (Especially when the Galleass of the conquistadors sails out of the harbor, fully loaded with gold and jewels, and everyone wants to get it.)

- In addition to the players' ships, there are quite a few "AI" tokens on the board, such as pirate and conquistador ships, sea monsters, cannon batteries, rafts, and trapped chests in the sea vortex. You can also come across unique units, such as the Flying Dutchman.

- To win the game you must become the governor of the Misty Waters. You can achieve this either by: winning an election, conquering a certain number of islands, acquiring the legendary Conquistador Treasure. Often the fate of the game is weighed until the last minute.

- Players can choose team play against other teams, solo play or solo mode.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Drafting, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Income, Investment, Moving Multiple Units, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: 22Mars
description:
22Mars is a very loosely connected sequel to 21Moon and gameplay wise a more complex bigger brother to 18Svea.

100 years after 21Moon, the year is 2217 and the space race has moved from the Moon to Mars. Earth is suffering from climate crisis and over population. The players, space entrepreneurs, are building train tracks and colonies, creating a new bright future on the red planet while the risk for a revolt grows connected to how greedy the players becomes during the game.

22Mars is an dystopian 18xx game set on Mars with variable map based on four interconnected megahexes and building track between variable value colonies depending on how many colonists are there.

The story so far – deportation of convicts, mining and space tourism on Mars

The year is 2217. Due to climate changes, the habitable parts of Earth are now heavily overpopulated. As one of several drastic measures to handle the population density, convicts on Earth are sent to colonies on Mars to work alongside androids and robots to build infrastructure for an alternative place to live. Ground-breaking technical leaps thanks to new hyper effective power source found on the moon have paved the way for time and cost-effective space travel, which in turn has made it possible to establish colonies on Mars. A number of corporations are contracted by the governments on Earth to build infrastructure necessary for building and supporting colonies on Mars. The first phase of Mars project focus on deportation of convicts from Earth, mining activities and space tourism for the privileged.
mechanics: Connections, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Los Payasos
description: The goal for each player is to be the first one to get their clowns ready for the show. Players take turn to roll a special die, and can flip over two cards with the shown symbol. A player who has all their four clowns face up at the same time, wins a point. When five points have been won, the player with most points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Warfighter: Modern Expansion #61 ‚Äì Epic & Legendary Middle East Insurgent Hostiles
description:
Warfighter: Modern Expansion #61 – Epic & Legendary Middle East Insurgent Hostiles adds 50 cards and rulesheet to your Warfighter Modern Missions! This expansion gives you Epic and Legendary versions of Middle East Insurgent Hostiles for your Warfighter Modern game! You can play with these new hostiles at varying levels of difficulty that will be described in a rulesheet which comes in the expansion.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: Modern Expansion #62 ‚Äì Epic & Legendary Middle East Military Hostiles
description:
Warfighter: Modern Expansion #62 – Epic & Legendary Middle-East Military Hostiles adds 50 cards and rulesheey to your Warfighter Modern Missions! This expansion gives you Epic and Legendary versions of Middle East Military Hostiles for your Warfighter Modern game! You can play with these new hostiles at varying levels of difficulty that will be described in a rulesheet which comes in the expansion.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Crimson Hand Dark Acolytes Enemy Pack
description:
The Order of the Crimson Hand has a long and rich history of seeking out ancient relics and sinister offerings to unlock forbidden lore and the power of dark gods. These Acolytes of occult knowledge have devoted their souls to unlocking the secrets of these twisted and dark magiks. Carrying scrolls writ in tainted blood and runic amulets imbued with chaotic potential, the Dark Acolytes of the Crimson Hand set up wicked altars and lead depraved rituals aimed to summon demonic creatures and unleash this raw power for their own nefarious goals.

The Dark Acolytes bring another facet of the sinister Order of the Crimson Hand into the game. Tasked with preparing the occult rituals and dark altars of the Order, these Acolytes are steeped in forbidden knowledge and use scrolls and amulets to gain Runic Protection and to unleash spells on the Heroes. Arcane Magik is a new Spell Deck that allows the Dark Acolytes to summon Demons or Undead to the Fight, launch bolts of Arcane Energy, or even allow one of them to ignite their hand ablaze with a crimson fire to attack, a burning effigy of the ancient Master of the Order, Shi-Hai Da'kal. Though not as tough as their more numerous cultist brethren, Dark Acolytes are every bit as zealous, using arcane lore and forbidden knowledge to attack the Heroes.

6x Enemies, Cards, Rules, and Mission

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 02
description:
BLASTER – the independent wargaming anthology – returns! Five of wargaming’s most prolific indie designers bring you exclusive expansions for their awesome games as well as entirely new tabletop gaming experiences.

BLASTER: Volume 2 contains:

Mystic Skies - Mike Hutchinson and Sean Sutter - Imagine yourself as a powerful sorcerer, soaring above the desert on a magic carpet. Combining the nail-biting movement of Gaslands with brutal magic and combat systems, Mystic Skies is a complete and standalone wargame of high-speed magical duels, tower defence and monster hunting.

This Is Not A Test: Masters of the Wild (Part 2) - Joey McGuire - Following from our first installment of this expansion for This Is Not A Test, we now examine the lesser powers of the wild who can join your warband. From the the nefarious beast controller who psychically dominates creatures into subservience to the beast friend, a natural animal empath. We also include lesser versions of the tribal wildcaller of chimeric wildshaper. Finally, animal skills are introduced, which are really fun and thematic and give your warbands an animal appeal.

Shadowgrave, Part I – Joseph A. McCullough - What happens when the creatures of the Mythos invade Frostgrave, Ghost Archipelago, and Rangers of Shadow Deep? Rules for sanity, madness, and permanent mental damage! Includes a new scenario for each of the three games, plus a host of nefandous creatures!

Last Days: Evolutions – Ash Barker - Last Days: Evolutions brings new threats to your Post Apocalypse. You can totally re-theme your games of Last Days to include new types of the Undead or shift gears entirely to try to survive an unshackled AI collapsing civilization!

—description from the publisher

This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for several miniatures games, noted above.
—user summary
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Aventuria: Kreuz der Auslese Promo
description:
An Aventuria adventure for four heroes.

Description of publisher:
Aventuria-Szenario für vier Helden.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Aventuria: Promo-Pack 1
description:
Promo Pack #1 consists of the cards:
Schwarzes Auge
Verlockender Köder
Orkfamilie
Schwitzkasten

The cards are shrinkwrapped together with a cover card on top.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Skytear: Silent Ambassador
description:
Silent Ambassadors are attracted by sorrow and violence, these creatures haunt the battlefields in search of victims to wreak their deadly needs against, often assuming humanoid features by using the debris around them in a grotesque caricature of the ones who created them.

The expansion contains:

1 Silent Ambassador preassembled and unpainted miniature (38mm).
7 Outsider Cards, one for each of these languages: English, Italian, Portuguese, French, German, Spanish, Polish.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Chrome Hammer Ascension: A Cyber Fantasy Solo Skirmish Campaign Game
description:
Sometimes you just want an elf and a ghoul to go shoot at each other in the cyberized back alleys of neo-berlin.

Welcome to Chrome Hammer Ascension.

In this solo campaign game your gang of punks will attempt to take on the mega-corporations of the ascended world. Dragon CEOs run pharmaceutical companies while flame demons prowl the back alleys and kobold zealots trade shots with an elf hacker.

CHA features a full campaign game where your punks gain experience, find new cool gear and hopefully don't end up face down in a rainy alley when a security guard finally frags them.

Random events, extensive lists of gear and abilities and a huge array of creatures are present in the book, allowing for you to really immerse yourself in the world of cyber fantasy.

The combat system is based on Squad Hammer and Chrome Hammer allowing fast, colorful combat without being bogged down by complex rules, letting you focus on the scenario you are playing and the enemies you are facing down.

Intended from the ground up as a solo game, all you need is a handful of miniatures to get started doing battle on the blood-slick streets, in VR space or the astral plane! Each campaign sees you fighting the mega-corps leading to an epic showdown against their monster CEO.

All of this is supported by included random tables to add flavor to the game experience.

This is a fantastic opportunity to use some figures you have not had a chance to use yet, plan some wild new paint jobs or conversions or bring some beloved old favorites back.


The core mechanics use a 2D6, pick highest roll to determine how many characters can activate each turn with characters being able to perform an array of actions.
Ranged combat is resolved with a 2D6 roll trying to exceed a target number, with enemies in close range being permitted to return fire.
Physical injury, squad casualties and morale is all merged into a single damage score, which can be reduced through the use of certain actions. This allows a fast-playing but tactical feeling experience.
Mechanics are included for stealth missions, spells and more.



The rules are intended for solo play and are stand-alone. You do not need a copy of Chrome Hammer or Squad Hammer to play.
The intended play space is roughly 3 x 3 feet though smaller tables are manageable.
Game scale is agnostic but will play fine in both 15mm and 28mm+.
Record sheets are included.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arrethtrae
description:
The Kingdom Series Board Game follows the books of The Kingdom Series and The Knights of Arrethtrae very closely. A familiarity with the books will lead to a quick understanding of how the game is played.

The Kingdom of Arrethtrae is divided into thirty territories. At the beginning of the game, each territory is occupied and controlled by the Dark Knight and his Shadow Warriors. The mission is to retake as many of the territories for the Prince as possible before He returns on His ship as He journeys from the Kingdom Across the Sea. It will take Him ten rounds of play to reach the city of Chessington. Once the Prince reaches the docks at Chessington, the game is over. Every knight has the opportunity to retake one territory on each turn by battling against Shadow Warriors and possibly creatures. If a knight is able to retake a territory on his turn, he will acquire a precious resource or weapon to help fight future battles. A knight will usually not know the scope of the battle until he or she enters the territory and draws a battle card. The knight may face a single Shadow Warrior, multiple Shadow Warriors, creatures, and even a Stronghold. Weapons and resources will be necessary to retake a territory with creatures or Strongholds.

One to six players can play the game, but there will always be six knights represented on the board. For example, if there is only one player, he will control all six of the knights. If there are three players, each player will control two knights. For four or five players, one or two of the players must control two knights or those knights can be controlled by all players jointly. All six knights are encouraged to work together and strategize on how to recover as many territories as possible. Only through teamwork and keen strategy is a team of knights successful. Victory occurs in varying degrees, for each territory and its people are precious to the Prince. Ultimate victory occurs when all thirty territories are recovered before the Prince arrives.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling

name: MadMobz
description:
MadMobz is a card game that revolves around the idea of rival mobz. Every player commands a different mob, each with their own house, business and car. Everyone has action cards (such as an attack, defend, swat, etc.) with different characteristics and have to properly use them in order to win. The players have to deal with ripdeals, snitches, SWAT teams, gold diggers, hustlers as well as other possible obstacles. In order to win, each participant has to manage resources and eliminate the rival mobz.

How do you play MadMobz?


Choose your infamous gang! Who are you? The Chicago Boss, The Sicilian Family, The Mexican Cartel, The NY Connection, The Cuban Stars, The Colombian King, or The Black Widow.
Put your gang members in the right place and take out all other gangs!
Make sure to attack their car, business and home to take out the Gangleader!


The game has 88 playing cards and 40 team cards.

Playing Cards:
In the game, there are attack cards with which you have to take out the other gangs, which can be defended with defence cards such as 'defend'.

With the action cards, you can bully the gangs by, for example, placing the 'Alliance' card between 2 gangs (their fate is now the same). Block these nasty plague cards with the 'Get the F *ck out' card!

The game also has 'super cards' such as 'Earthquake' to destroy all houses or Frankenstein to bring a defeated gang member back to life.

If you want to take out the gangs with a good blow, start a GangWar.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Kill Steal, Take That

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry ‚Äì Bringers of Death
description:
Death stalks the Bloodwind Spoil. Nagash’s gaze turns towards this nightmare realm of slaughter and butchery, and he sends his midnight armies to claim the souls that he believes are rightfully his. Perhaps smaller warbands will succeed where his invasion has failed. Even now they chip away at the domains of the living with the cold patience of the grave, taking what land they can and replacing the madness with the unmoving, unchanging, unfeeling calm of the dead – in the name of the Great Necromancer.

Bringers of Death is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Death in games of Warcry. Four large warbands are detailed in full, from the ethereal Nighthaunt to the disciplined Ossiarch Bonereapers. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Death in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


Full rules for the following warbands: Flesh-eater Courts, Legions of Nagash, Nighthaunt, and Ossiarch Bonereapers.
Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Death ranges.
Rules for two Monsters of Death: Terrorgheists and Zombie Dragons.
Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
4 Death Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
6 Death Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you feel compelled to collect the souls of the Eightpoints in the name of Nagash, this 64-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Impro the Board Game
description:
Impro the Board Game is a twisted party game. The game combines insightful questions and the pitch-black humor of the therapy world.

The game is prepared by setting up the game board on the table. The hourglass along with the Psychiatric Hospital-card are placed next to the board. The category cards are placed on separate decks on the table. The five different categories: Emotion, Creativity, Mental Health, Self-knowledge and Task.

The youngest player starts and the game proceeds clockwise. The players move their pawns on the board according to the die and depending on which category they land, they pick a card and read it out loud. The category depicts how the player will execute the card: verbally, artistically, using their body language, facial expressions, or their wild imagination.

Depending on the correct guesses and/or successful execution of the card, the player and the co-players can move forward on the game board. The die is used in the beginning of one's turn until the homestretch, the rest of the way is moved forward only by completing the categories or guessing right. The player who reaches the finish square first is the winner. If two or more players get to the finish square in the same round, the game ends in a tie.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Line Drawing

name: Der Fluch des Waldes (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary. Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.

A boy arrived at the secret camp crying with a rabbit in his arms and searched for Robin Hood, screaming loudly. "Help! Rooobinnnn!” he yelled! "You have to help me! My rabbit suddenly lay down motionless on the forest floor!” he sobbed. The child cried, yes he wanted to say something in a hurry: "Oh, but... but it's not just my rabbit so bad. The animals, plants and people feel bad. The animals are lying around, the plants cannot grow and the people suffer Headaches and are powerless." Robin immediately picked up his bow, rounded up his friends and them decided to look around the forest and ask the people involved what happened.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry ‚Äì Sentinels of Order
description:
Chaos corrupts all, but it does not go unopposed. The forces of Order fight to reclaim what’s been taken, including the Allpoints, as the lands of the Varanspire were once known. Small forces are even now testing the defences of their infernal foes, infiltrating those blasted lands through stealth and guile. Every champion of the Ruinous Powers slain is a victory to be celebrated, every ancient relic liberated a gift for civilisation. Now it’s up to you – resist and reclaim!

Sentinels of Order is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Order in games of Warcry. 12 warbands are detailed in full, from the noble Chambers of the Stormcast Eternals to mysterious aelves and sturdy duardin. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Order in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


Full rules for the following warbands: Cities of Sigmar, Daughters of Khaine, Idonenth Deepkin, Khainite Shadowstalkers, Kharadron Overlords, Lumineth Realm-lords, Fyreslayers, Seraphon, Sylvaneth, Stormcast Eternals Sacrosanct Chamber, Stormcast Eternals Warrior Chamber, and Stormcast Eternals Vanguard Auxiliary Chamber.
Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Order ranges.
Rules for two Monsters of Order: War Hydra and Kharibdyss.
Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
4 Order Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
6 Order Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.
Blank roster sheets to copy and fill.


If you yearn to take the fight to the eternal enemy of Order, this 112-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Piratas!: Mares Agitados
description:
Piratas! - Mares Agitados ("Rough Seas") is the first expansion for the game Piratas! 3rd edition.

It comes with a lot of new things that make the game more interactive, fun and strategic. New Treasure cards, instant card and Crew cards bring the game to a whole new level.

Alongside it, there a brand new type of card, the events. Those events activate whenever a event card comes out of the deck and those effects are applied to each and every player.

The Kraken is the first card of this type and its effect is:
"Each player chooses: Deals 1 damage to that player ship OR discard a crew card from that player."

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Hand Management, Take That

name: Fighters of the Pacific: Battle of the Coral Sea
description: One month before the Battle of Midway, the first ever naval air battle took place. It is remembered as the Battle of the Coral Sea. Relive this battle with this expansion pack that provides 3 new Japanese aircraft carriers, the Shokaku, Zuikaku and Shoho, the USS Lexington forces and 4 exciting scenarios. Decide the fate of the Shoho and the USS Lexington!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Action Dice Hockey
description:
Instant excitement. Easy-to-play pocket size. Lightning-quick, hockey action in a fast-paced dice game based on America's #1 hockey league!

Action Dice Hockey is a dice solitaire game.

This dice strategy game can take you down the ice for slap shots, wrist shots, penalties and more! Watch out for checks, penalty's, goals and more. It's fast, easy to learn and you call the plays. Perfect for tailgating at games, at the home or in your office, or while traveling on airplanes -- play it anywhere! Any result in the NHL can happen in this game. Call your play, roll the dice and instantly see the results!

This game can be single or two players. To play the game simply choose one of the offensive plays and roll the dice to see the result. Each team gets a chance to move the puck into a scoring range. If you like the range then you can choose to shoot or pass again to increase your range for a better chance to score!

Keeping track of time in this hockey game is easy. Provided are score sheets. Each time a play is finished the user will record a play by checking off a circle on the score sheet. After 30 plays are completed, it will show the final score for that quarter of play. The team with the most goals wins the game. If the score is tied then an overtime quarter will begin.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Catch Me If You Can: The Collector ‚Äì Part 2
description:
The Collector has returned to finish the grisly business that began last year, and the stakes are higher than ever. The Collector has abducted someone very close to you and has given you a deadline of 24 hours to find them. Failure is not an option. It's time to put an end to The Collector's reign of terror.

Difficulty Rating – 9/10


This box was never a part of the DMS monthly subscription service.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Temerity
description:
2 player strategy game with the objective to deal the highest attack before the cards run out. Players use cards either face up or face down to achieve their goal.

Players play 1 or more cards from their hand and can optionally reveal a face down card placed on a previous turn.

When the cards in the deck runs out, the game ends and the player who performed the highest attack during the game is the winner.
mechanics: Move Through Deck

name: Are You More Like
description:
Are You More Like is a hilarious party game that lets you see just how well your friends and family know you! (It is also a fantastic get to know you game for a first date)

First the Active Player is selected. Then, all other players look at their cards in hand and choose a number of cards to play face down in the middle based on the Quick Start Chart. Then if needed, add cards from the deck until there are at least 5 cards in the middle (again see the Quick Start Chart).

After all cards are submitted, the Active Player mixes the cards up and turns them over face up and puts them in a row. The Active Player will then secretly choose from the options which one they personally are “Most Like” AND which one they are “Least Like” and write it down. (Note: This is NOT which one do you like the most? It is which one are you most like?) At the same time all other players are secretly writing down what they predict the active player will choose for Most and Least about themselves.

Once all players have made their decisions, all non-active players reveal their choices at the same time by placing their (Most Token) and (Least Token) below each of the respectively chosen cards. The Active Player will then place their (Most Token) and (Least Token) above each respectively chosen card.

Scoring Points:
One point is awarded to each person who:
Correctly guessed the Active Player’s “Most Like” choice,
Correct guessed the Active Player’s “Least Like” choice,
Submitted the card that the active player selected as “Most Like”
Submitted the card that the active player selected as “Least Like”

After points are awarded, discard the cards from the middle, everyone restocks their hand to five cards and the next player become the Active Player.

The points needed to win varies on based on number of players.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Judge, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Bunny Brawl
description:
Bunny Brawl is a card game where players compete to create their own Kill Squad.

Players draw and play cards to summon a bunny or play a card that will slow down his opponent.

The game ends by someone winning when a player completes their Kill Squad this means having 4 Bunnies of 4 Different colors makes you the winner of the game and the game ends.
mechanics: Take That

name: The Kaiser's High Seas Fleet: The Great War at Sea 1914-18
description: Utilizing the basic system created by John Edwards for his "War at Sea". The game takes us back to World War I prior to the invention of Radar and no air power.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Mapping the World
description:
As explorers bring back more and more detailed knowledge about other parts of the world from their travels, cartographers use that knowledge to create intricate maps of the world. As the new trade gains influence in science and at royal courts, new methods and tools are invented — modern cartography is born!

In Mapping the World, you are a cartographer striving to become the best-known master of your trade by creating a map of the world. You'll send out explorers to discover new territories, develop new tools, and manage your riches and influence at the royal court. Will you become the most prolific cartographer and win the game, or will one of your colleagues take the prize?

On your turn, either pick up cards from a common market (which will also change the rest of that market for the following players), or play cards from your hand to perform various actions, like moving your explorer's ship or upgrading your equipment. The central action consists of mapping different parts of the globe, which will net you victory points as well as fulfill different objectives that change from one game to another. After a player has fulfilled a certain number of objectives, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Contracts, Events, Hand Management, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Crumbs: Foul Waterfowl
description: A game of scuffles, revenge, and feeding on the fear of your enemies NOW GETS WETTER with the Foul Waterfowl expansion. Foul Waterfowl introduces TWO ADDITIONAL playable armies, secret objectives, brand new Daily Buzz cards (including RAMPANT cards) and four additional maps to play on with new terrain-based mechanics. The most fan-requested park animals will now join the fray: the Geese and the Swans.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Castle Break
description:
Castle Break is a Medieval adventure strategy board game with card drafting, trading, scenario/quest completion, and more.

Warriors (the players) have been chosen to represent their Kingdom in this year’s Castle Break Games. Players' task is to complete Quests by collecting Trade Goods, using Tools & Weapons, and harnessing their Magical Powers.

For each Quest completed, players are rewarded in coin. Earn 6 Coins, forge them into keys, and unlock the gates to DRAGON’S TOWER. There a player will free the dragon and achieve the title of this year’s CHAMPION.

Opponents can barter, steal, and outwit you using various powers and opportunities at every turn to achieve their aims.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading

name: Paris Connection: Hiawatha Connection
description:
A new map for SNCF, Hiawatha Connection was designed by Anthony Fryer for Mainline magazine (Volume 1, Issue 1). It was included in the Collector's Edition of the magazine available through Kickstarter.

It features mountain hexes and rivers, both of which upon building into end the active player's turn. The game uses only five companies, each of which do not start on the map at the beginning of the game. The rules impose building restrictions that help to prevent wasted track builds by uninvested players.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Robot Rising
description:
The AI takeover is upon us. It's as bad as we feared.

Robot Rising is a solo deck-building game where you must program the bots (cards) in your hand to quell the AI takeover. Each turn, new bots may join the uprising, making it more difficult to regain control. Use Config Settings to maintain your bot population, keep your Code clean to avoid compromising CPUs, and Install USBs with data patches to regain control of mutinous bots. Can you find a way to keep the robots from rising to power? Humankind depends on it...

Your objective is to regain control of all the bot cards in the Uprising deck to quell the rebellion before the bots compromise ten CPU chips and take control of the world.

Each bot card in Robot Rising has a helpful ability when you control the bot, and a separately harmful effect when the bot instead joins the uprising. The game is played in rounds until you've either defeated all bots in the uprising or the bots have hacked all your CPU control.

Each round, you start by rolling a die - the Bot Roll - any card in the population with a matching value will join the uprising, and is another bot you will have to regain control of in order to win. Next, the active bots in the uprising take actions based on the bottom of the card. After the uprising bots have finished their turn, you may use the bots in your control to fight back. You can Code lines (improve your health), Install patches in uprising bots (each bot requires a certain amount of USBs before falling), gain Configuration Settings (the game's currency), and lots more! At the conclusion of each turn, you may acquire bots from the population if you have adequate Config to do so.

Robot Rising was designed for the 2021 54-Card Game Design Contest on BGG
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game ‚Äì  Bonus Box #2
description:
A small expansion to the Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game that includes a new playable character.

Contains:


1 General Venjix character card
General Venjix signature item & master cards
3 Serpentera cards
Alternate art health tracker dials
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #69 ‚Äì Long Range Desert Group
description:
The Long Range Desert Group was a special forces troop which specialist in desert combat, waging unconventional warfare against Axis forces across the vast deserts of North Africa, executing highly mobile operations covering vast distances. The harsh, unyielding climate was itself as treacherous as the enemy.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new UK Soldiers and Squad Vehicles, German Anti-Vehicle Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Gear, Skills and Driving cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 Player Soldiers
3 Non-Player Soldiers
2 Squad Soldiers
3 Squad Vehicles
3 Gear
2 Driving
2 Skills
3 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
17 Anti-Vehicle Hostiles
2 Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bear Trap: The Soviet-Afghan War, 1979-1989
description:
Bear Trap: The Soviet-Afghan War is a quick-playing, low-complexity game simulating the Soviet-Afghan War (1979-1989). Bear Trap adapts the game system from Sekigahara to this new setting.

One player takes command of the ruling Democratic Republic of Afghanistan and its forces, supported by the Soviet 40th Army. The other player takes command of the local tribal rebels (the Lashkar) and Mujahideen guerrilla fighters. The Soviet player seeks to prop up the sympathetic local government and “solve the Russian Ice-lock Problem” while the Insurgent player seeks to expel the foreign invaders and secularist government.

Gameplay consists of alternating turns playing cards to replenish, activate, and move units on an area-based map of Afghanistan, with battles occurring whenever units from both sides end up in the same space. Bear Trap adapts the core mechanics from GMT Games' classic Sekigahara, allowing for the possibility of betrayal and defections, but also adds several new aspects, such as hidden unit stances, powerful strategy cards, and a unique card-assisted solo mode for either side.

Bear Trap is first and foremost a 2-player game, but it also includes rules for solo play (which utilizes a card-assisted flowchart bot).

Time Scale: 16-20 months per Reshuffle
Unit Scale: 1 Block = 500 - 8,000 soldiers
Number of Players: 1 to 2
Play Time: 2 to 3 hours
Complexity: Low (3/9 on GMT's scale)
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat #1
description:
Bring Car Wars Sixth Edition to life with this 36" x 36" custom playmat depicting an asphalt combat arena!

Also includes:

Rule sheet
30 new cards (hazard, structure, accessory, & upgrade)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: The Captain Is Dead: The Problem with Priggles
description:
Nobody knows what Priggles are or where they came from. What is known is that they don’t like the aliens. Or maybe it’s the aliens that don’t like them? Either way, who cares? The important thing is that they can be used against the aliens, and that makes them really handy. Unfortunately, they’re clingy little things, and once they get their cute little hooks in you, it can be really hard to shake them off...

This microexpansion for The Captain is Dead adds Priggles! Shuffle these little critters into the skill deck. You may draw one, and you can't get rid of it. But when you have three of them, you can discard all three to get rid of aliens on the ship!
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dicefest 2021 Goodybox
description:
This Expansion was sold during the Flying Frog Production's Dicefest 2021 weekend.

It contained some maptiles, cards and the Master Samurai miniature.

The Map tiles are for inserting small passages to avoid overlaying of maptiles and there are also a new mine and a new blasted wastes room.

The cards are
P329 - Gear "Keg of Dynamite"
P338 - Mine Artifact "Masterclass Revolver"
P339 - Darkness "Infinite Darkness"
P497 - Gear "Rusty Shovel"
P914 - Mine Map "Grave Robber's Den"
P915 - Mine Encounter "Corpse Cart"
P916 - Blasted Wastes Map "Untouched Wreckage"
P917 - Blasted Wastes Encounter "Fresh Salvage"

Note: Flying Frog DiceFest 2021 Goody Box also contained two cards for Dark Gothic but this entry represents just all the Shadows Of Brimstone goodies.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Last Day of Rose: A Malign Age
description:
The Last Day of Rose: A Malign Age is a cooperative card game for 3-5 players. Players will take on the roles of friends and relatives of Rose, a girl with severe depression and suicidal thoughts. Players will need to work together to the best of their abilities to accompany and care for Rose through multiple scenarios, each with their own unique challenges.

On a player’s turn, he or she must play a card from his/her hand which he/she has drawn from his/her character’s unique deck. All the cards have two kinds of effects to choose: a positive one might let player help with Rose’s wellbeing or add a more powerful card to their decks etc. A negative one will harm Rose’s mental state or add a harmful card to a player’s deck etc. All cards from the players’ hands must be played (or discarded) in order to complete a round, yet each player can only resolve a limited number of positive effects depending on the efforts they can spend.

The game is won if Rose's life is saved.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dead or Alive Game Supplement
description:
Travelling the desert roads and canyon trails is always a risky proposition with outlaws on the prowl. Whether bitter with mutation, risen from a shallow grave, or just looking to make an easy score, the highwaymen around Brimstone are ruthless in their greed for Dark Stone and gold.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Canyons Encounters and Canyons Artifacts for The Canyons World (found in the Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds ‚Äì Blasted Wastes), as well as new Darkness cards. These cards are themed for finding items and encounters with lawless outlaws and highwaymen travelling the canyon valleys of the Southwest.

CARD LIST

Outlaw Treasure Map ×2
Highwayman's Holster
Highwayman's Shotgun
Gulch Rifle
Bandit's Duster
Life on the Run x2
Nothing Personal
Dark Stone Rage
Stampede!
"Not Yer Business"
Outlaw Camp
"Help! Help!"
Shallow Graves
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Star Wars: Legion ‚Äì DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid Unit Expansion
description:
Expand your droid forces with the DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Favored by the Commerce Guild for the rugged durability and ease of manufacture, these four-legged, dome-shaped mechanical arachnids feature powerful, centrally mounted armaments capable of fulfilling a wide variety of battlefield roles.

Within this expansion, you’ll find everything you need to add a DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid to your Separatist armies as a support unit. This droids versatile nature is captured in the finely detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature that can be customized with a nose-mounted laser cannon, flamethrower, or ion blaster. These physical modifications have a practical application in eight upgrade cards that invite you to outfit your DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid with a variety of weapons and battle protocols.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Frostgrave: Second Edition ‚Äì Blood Legacy
description:
In the days of ancient Felstad, vampires kept to the shadows, their small numbers no match for the power of the city's wizards. But when the cataclysm struck, the wizards were destroyed, while the deathless vampires went into a frozen hibernation. Now, as the city thaws, so to do its undead inhabitants. The masters of the night are rising again: reoccupying their hidden strongholds, reforming their old cabals, and finding new victims to serve as their thralls. The destruction of the old city has brought one other boon to the vampires - giant's blood. While giants used to live out of reach to the far north, in the intervening millennium, they have descended on the city in large numbers. Their blood is like an elixir to the vampires, filling them with strength and magical power. A new war is forming between these two ancient races, and once again, the wizards of Frostgrave are caught in the middle.

This supplement for Frostgrave: Fantasy Wargames in the Frozen City presents greatly expanded information about the vampires and the giants that occupy the frozen ruins, including rules for vampiric magic and a breakdown of the different tribes of giants. Also included are rules for a new type of soldier, the giant-blooded. These huge men and women have the blood of giants running through their veins, granting them great strength unseen in normal men. Finally, the book contains a section on playing Frostgrave with high-level wizards and includes two mini-campaigns to challenge these experienced spellcasters.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction ‚Äì Saber Athena
description:
The hyper-agile Mark-6 Jaeger Saber Athena leaps into action! Equipped with mechrobatic J-Tech upgrades and fusing Twin Plasma Swords, Saber Athena takes the fight to the enemy.

Contents:
1 Saber Athena Jaeger model
1 Saber Athena Conn-Pod
6 x Saber Athena Action Cards
3 x Jaeger Pilot Cards
3 x Jager Upgrade Cards
1 Charge Counter
1 Ammo Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: In the Palm of your Hand: Life of Mei
description:
Expansion for the game In the Palm of your Hand: try to make your teammate guess the right card by miming it using the objects in the box in the palm of their hand as their eyes remain closed.
Discover beautiful illustrations showing the life of Mei, wife of the first hero of the game, Leon.

In this expansion, discover «The Life of Mei» from her childhood to the encounter with Leon. See the story of the core game through the eyes of this new character! Adds a nice replay value to the core game with 50 new cards and 2 new objects.

Mix the 50 cards of this expansion with the 100 cards of the core game. Add the 2 new objects to the ones from the core game. Play as usual and discover the life of the characters from another angle. Find new ways to mime the cards of the base game thanks to the new objects, as well as new ways to use the objects of the base game thanks to the 50 new cards. The cards also bring new possibilities to interfere with the memories!

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Architecten van het Westelijk Koninkrijk: Promodeck
description:
Promo deck which contains:

Architects of the West Kingdom: Garphill Games 5-Year Anniversary Promo Cards)
Architects of the West Kingdom: Promo Paradise Card Set
Architects of the West Kingdom: Racketeer
Architects of the West Kingdom: King's Table Top


12 cards + 1 card with rules
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game ‚Äì Blacktyde Chosen
description:
When people along the coast see the banner of the Kraken, they pray that the Blacktyde Chosen aren’t the ones coming ashore. Not your average raider, the Blacktyde Chosen are kitted out in more sturdy armor, large round shields, and armed with master crafted axes. Their extensive training means they can take charge of a situation, no matter what it is.

The Blacktyde Chosen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players a robust unit for their armies. The unit’s extensive training with their master crafted axes means they can cut apart enemy forces with ease. And their resiliency can see them coming back time and again, even if an opponent once counted them out. Plus, they care nothing for the spoils of war, letting other Greyjoy units collect the loot.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Yummy Yummy Pancake: Promo Pancake Tokens
description:
Three all new varieties of pancake tokens to add to your Yummy Yummy Pancake game! Play with the normal rules, OR enjoy some NEW rules variations to make the game a little more difficult or to mix it up a little!

The new pancake flavors are:

Caramel Apple Pecan
Ice Cream & Chocolate Sauce
Wild Berry
The tokens come with ONE new set of rules.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Set Collection

name: New World Order Game
description:
New World Order - the game of future - is an fast paced game with easy set-up and game-play mechanics, but has plenty of strategy and players need to make good choices to win. You take the role of a globalist billionaire and your purpose is to collect different corporations and institutions (society has already collapsed) and by collecting them gain Achievements that are high-tech inventions or some other global development.
When you collect 3 Achievements with the same color you will reach Big Goal which will change our future considerably here on Earth or Space.

In this boardgame/cardgame hybrid players are collecting Corporation cards from the table and adding them together to maximize their points. For those points they can buy Achievement tiles which are placed on the table like a pyramid. Achievements give Victory points.

When you collect a three Achievements that match (they have same color on them) then a Great Goal is achieved and player gains extra 500 points Victory Points for it, which is pretty good.

Every player has 3 actions from which they have to choose 1 on their turn. Game moves clock-wise of course. The first action is to choose same corporation card or cards from the table, second - buy an Achievement for the Corp cards points and third - player can throw away a card or a set to make room for other Corp cards. That is sometimes necessary since the slots for Corp cards are limited (7 slots for 2-3 player game and 5 slots for 4-5 player game).

These actions go quickly most of the time, but there are moments where player needs to take a look at his cards and tiles he/she has and think what direction he wants go. He could go for high Corp card points (by collecting more cards) to get the expensive Achievement or forgetting about the full set and take a cheaper Achievement tile from the pyramid with a suitable color to get the Bonus points.

Making things more interesting is that player can´t take any tile you want. He can only take a tile that is free which means it don´t have any other tile on top of it ( not even a on a corner). So there needs to be some tactics how to get to that tile that is unavailable at the moment. It helps if a player got "another action" card, then he can use it to take the two tiles in a row!

The good thing about the game is players can influence each other games by simple ruining other's plans and taking the cards (or tiles) he/she really needs.
Looking at other players despaired face is always fun! Don´t forget you are a ruthless globalist billionaire :)

The game ends when all corporation cards are played out and Achievement VP-s ja Great Goals are counted.Who has most VP-s will be the most powerful elite!

This game is great for people who don´t play games much and are afraid of extensive rules. Gameplay is easily learned in the first 15 minutes.
For experts it could feel a bit of a filler game, but in my opinion it has too many tactical options to be that and the game goes on a bit longer for a filler (60-75 minutes for 3 players).

Also the game has deep theme and makes you think a bit where are we heading as a society. It is a great conversation starter and very fun to enjoy with a couple of beers! :)

For more information check out the game site www.newworldordergame.com
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Advantage Token, End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Eldritch
description: Eldrich is the Master Mage of Freedom City. An adventuring archaeologist of the 1930s, he is the reincarnation of the Atlantean mage who imprisoned Malador the Mystic millennia ago. He defends Earth-Prime from mystical threats and is an ally of the Freedom League.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Squendo
description:
Squendo is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players that you can take everywhere in a unique, recycled, handmade bag from Australia.

The aim of the game is to have the highest amount of scoring tiles on the board at the end of the game. Do this by stacking to earn double points, or making a square (Squendo) to score 10 points.

The game shines when a triple stack is formed. This is your opportunity to throw out either one or two of your oppositions tiles and watch them squirm.

From minute five, you will be strategising and once you finish, you will want to play again.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Arkwright: The Card Game ‚Äì Game Brewer Promo Pack
description:
3 cards part of a Promo Pack Game Brewer created to help cover the rising cost of ocean freight.

Description from the publisher:

Adds 3 event cards. 2 of which will come into play in any one game, 1 each at the end of the first and second decade.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Loans, Market, Stock Holding

name: RagnaRok Star: The MoshPet Show
description:
Odin has decided to spice up the game!
He sends you his fabulous animals, the Mascøts, to set your pit on fire!
"Are you ready for the show? Are you ready for The MoshPet Show?"

Choose your Mascøt from the 8 available and increase the power of one of your actions (soliciting, navigation, theft, etc.) tenfold. Make it go up to Level 3 to reach its ultimate evolution and earn more and more Glory Points!

+ REPLAYABILITY

+ ASYMMETRY

+ CONTRACTS

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Contracts, Network and Route Building, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Alpha Pack
description:
Slobbery, floppy canines are running amok! These furry mongrels are busy chasing cats, chewing on bones and digging holes. Will a dog whistle cause your Maltese to run away? Is there enough food for your set of Dalmatians? Do you have enough resources to give these pups a happy home? Your next turn might just make you the leader of Alpha Pack!

Players will take turns selecting cards (dogs, food/housing resources, or special cards) using an open drafting mechanism. Points are gained by competing for pack cards that have various requirements in order to collect said cards. During gameplay, events will occur that will affect the cards players hold. Once the pack cards have been claimed, players tally their collected pack cards and other points gained throughout the game. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Star Wars: Legion ‚Äì Essentials Kit
description: Help your players dive into the battles of Star Wars: Legion with this helpful kit! The Essentials Kit gathers together all the necessary cards, dice, tokens, and other tools players need to play the game in one convenient package, letting them get started quickly and easily. Additionally, this kit also collects the 12 battle cards for the 500-point Skirmish mode in a product for the first time, inviting new and veteran players alike to explore this alternate way to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion ‚Äì Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers Unit Expansion
description: Players can hire additional soldiers to protect their interests throughout the galaxy with this pack for Star Wars: Legion! Adding a corps unit of six Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers that can join Rebel, Imperial, Republic, or Separatist armies or band together with their fellow mercenaries in the Shadow Collective, this expansion gives players even more versatile options for building their forces.
