Furthermore, they’ll also find a Pyke Syndicate Capo who can lead a single unit or an entire mercenary army as a commander along with three command cards, opening up even more strategic choices. Finally, eight upgrade cards give players the freedom to kit out their units with heavy weapons, additional gear, and more!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Big Shuffle: The Red Light Expansion
description:
Expansion of Gambling and Vice
Array of new cards that change up the game
Includes new characters, locations and situations
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 18Namibia
description:
18Namibia is a railway construction and share game for 3 to 4 players. Historical specifications have been taken into account as far as possible. In other places, history should and must be rewritten. Its based on 1895-Namibia from Adam Romoth and Helmut Ohley which was 2004 published.
Players invest in railway companies. The companies create a railway network with track tiles on the game board and run these routes with their trains and generate income. The player with the most shares in a railway company is its director. He decide whether these incomes will be distributed to the shareholders as a dividend or whether it will be added to the companies' treasury for future investments. The progress of time and technical development is shown with 9 train types/devices from 2 to 16.
As with many games in this series, there are similarities within the rules, but many feature slight differences, and it is these that give each individual 18xx game its character.
18Namibia features an interesting array of differences described above.
These include obligations, mines are corporations, quick train rush, 9 H-Train types and other things.

When developing 18Namibia, attention was paid to a short playing time. A game lasts about 180 minutes. A "short variant" (90 minutes) is already finished and only needs to be prepared!

Helmut Ohley
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Canga√ßo: Compadecida promo card
description:
Promo card for Canga√ßo.

The power of the Compadecida card is completely linked to the movie O Alto da Compadecida, and makes the round in which it is played a little more dynamic, allowing the whole table to recover a discarded card and play it performing its effect normally.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Federico da Montefeltro: il Duca
description:
Idea and goal of the game

Players shall compete by developing the duchy of Federico in a fun game for 2-5 players.
Your goal is building districts, combining the most significant works that history has left us, in order to earn points. During the game, you will also leverage the skills of prominent historical dignitaries for opportunities, and events to hinder your opponents.
mechanics: Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Forbidden Psalm: In the Footsteps of the Mad Wizard
description:
A campaign setting for the core book, Forbidden Psalm, a 28mm miniatures agnostic game where you can use suitable miniatures you already own or build custom minis for solo and Coop play.
In the Footsteps of the Mad Wizard picks up the narrative where the core book leaves off. In this campaign expansion your warband of 5 greedy souls will face new trials, find new treasures, recruit pets and die in horrible ways.

This book adds new weapon tables, new spells, new equipment, new feats, flaws and a 15 session long campaign that can be used for both the MÖRK BORG ttrpg and Forbidden Psalm miniatures game.

Including:


A new Campaign system, featuring richer opportunities for progression and injury
15 new scenarios
Pets! Pets! Pets!
More weapons, relics, and treasures
10+ New monsters
Randomness Intensifies: dozens of new tables for that sweet sweet emergent narrative


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Battlefield Support Deck
description:
Bring the Rain!

BattleMechs are the kings of the battlefield. But expert use of support elements - artillery, minefields, and aerospace fighter runs - can tip the balance of battle toward victory!

This 55 card deck makes using the sleek Battlefield Support rules from the BattleMech Manual even easier. Choose the size of your conflict, select cards to represent the support you'll bring to the battlefield, and you're ready for a game. Unleash your cards at a critical moment to help your 'Mechs defeat your opponent!

This deck is for use by one side in a scenario.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Shibuya Night Out (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
In this expansion map for Age of Steam, the players take on the role of dispatchers for taxi companies in the Shibuya area, taking music lovers to the trendy clubs. The colors of the cubes and clubs indicate the genre of music they prefer.

Each turn of the game, one genre of music will be the current trend, and delivering cubes of that color on that turn will earn a player extra income.

The map is hexless and does not use the urbanization action.

The designer also created a club playlist to listen to while playing the map.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Lobo
description:
Lobo is a solitaire card game for Crab Fragment Labs' Vines (or Postas) deck. The Vines deck has eleven cards in five suits. Lobo uses 1 - 10 in all five suits.

In Lobo, the Player and the Wolf start with a face up hand of four cards each. Through a series of captures, the player is attempting to get rid of all of the Wolf’s cards.

Your goal is to empty the Wolf’s hand, by playing cards from your own hand. Even if you cannot defeat the Wolf, you are still trying to reduce its point value as far as you can. You will play several hands against the Wolf, racing to 100 points.

On each turn, you have the choice of several actions. The Wolf does not take turns.

Perfect - play one card from your hand to capture one card of the same rank from the Wolf’s hand, then draw a card.

Sum - play more than one card from your hand, which must add up exactly to one card in the Wolf’s hand, then draw a card.

Split - play one card, and capture more than one card adding up exactly to the value of the card you play, then draw a card into the Wolf's hand.

Over - play one card from your hand to capture one smaller card from the Wolf’s hand, then draw one card into the Wolf's hand for every point of difference.

Fold - If you feel you cannot safely make any more plays, you can stop.

If the Wolf's hand is empty, you score the points remaining in your hand.

If you Fold, the Wolf scores the points remaining in their hand.
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Spire's End: Hildegard ‚Äì Great Outdoors
description:
Great Outdoors is a small, non-essential pack of 12 extra Cards that provide a touch of variety to Spire's End: Hildegard, with 8 new illustrations by Diego Frias.


2 Instruction Cards
9 Story Cards for Chapter 2
1 Story Card for Chapter 4
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Ultimate Werewolf: Extreme ‚Äì Collector's Edition
description:
Your once-quiet village is infested with werewolves... Can you and the other villagers find them before they eliminate you?

Ultimate Werewolf Extreme is the best-selling party game where each player has a secret role: as a villager, hunt down and eliminate the werewolves; as a werewolf, convince the other players that you're innocent, while secretly eliminating them.

Choose from dozens of special roles each game for unlimited replayability!

This edition of Ultimate Werewolf includes:

Ultimate Werewolf Extreme
Ultimate Werewolf Bonus Roles
Ultimate Werewolf Pro
Name card pad
Portable deck box
"Got Villager?" bumper sticker
Moderator score pad
200 custom card sleeves
25 award certificates
4 Punchboard tokens: Ivory Tower, Charm, Sandwich, Gavel
GameTrayz Organizer

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition ‚Äì Supernatural: Join the Hunt ‚Äì Pack 1
description:
The Winchester brothers Sam and Dean were raised to hunt and kill all things that go "bump in the night". It is no surprise then that when the zombie apolcalypse broke loose, the brothers jumped into the opportunity of some good old Zombicide!

Pack #1 includes: Dean and Sam Winchester Survivors, Wendigo and Alpha Vampire Abominations, plus 2 ID Cards, 2 Equipment Cards, 2 Abomination Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Last Prey
description:
Summary: Richard Chalmers, an upstanding Valley Falls citizen and wealthy businessman, has passed away. He was a city favorite as Santa Claus and even won Valley Falls "Man of The Year." Yet, it appears he might've had a hidden hobby no one knew about. During an estate sale liquidating Chalmers' property, someone discovered his hunting journal. The contents are shocking to say the least. According to the entries, Chalmers has been stalking and killing people for the last few years. Based on discoveries found in the journal, he wasn't able to kill his final captured victim. The dates of those journal entries indicate there's a chance the final victim may still be alive. Journey into a serial killer's mind to discover where his last victim is before time runs out and help rescue The Last Prey!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Difficulty Rating – 8/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Thrashed
description:
You and 6 friends are trapped in a building while being hunted by a killer. Your goal is to move yourself and your friends from floor to floor to delivery supplies to the right players while trying to avoid the killer. If everybody survives long enough to collect their supplies you and your friends are able to defend yourself and escape.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team ‚Äì Annual 2022
description:
The war in the shadows escalates! Amidst ruined cityscapes, carnivorous jungles and hidden strongholds, new kill teams join the fray. From the gruesome Gellerpox Infected to the noble Elucidian Starstriders, each band of warriors brings their own method of war to every desperate battle – in struggles that seem more varied and deadly than ever. Expert assassins and saboteurs slip through patrols of enemy sentries, hoping to complete their bloody tasks and slip away before they are detected, while bands of grizzled warriors faced with impossible odds choose to make their last stand, taking as many of the foe as they can with them to the grave.

Kill Team: Annual 2022 offers new ways to enjoy the sci-fi skirmish game you know and love, with fresh missions and game modes, kill teams collected from the pages of White Dwarf like the Harlequin Void-dancer Troupes and the Hunter Clades of the Adeptus Mechanicus, and two classic kill teams returning to the game for the first time in its new edition. It's the perfect way to breathe new life into your games.

Inside this 152-page softcover book, you’ll find:

- Full rules and background information for six kill teams, including datacards, Strategic and Tactical Ploys, equipment, and complete Spec Ops rules:
– Elucidian Starstriders, the avaricious crew and coterie of Rogue Trader Elucia Vhane
– Gellerpox Infected, festering fanatics of Nurgle's warpborne sickness, led by Vulgrar Thrice-cursed
– Hunter Clade, disciplined cybernetic Skitarii who stalk the killzone for the Adeptus Mechanicus
– Warpcoven, mighty Sorcerers of the Thousand Sons and their gathered thralls, both mutant and Rubric
– Wyrmblade, cunning Neophytes of the Genestealer Cults, guided by elite cult agents
– Void-dancer Troupes, agile Aeldari Harlequins for whom every battle is a performance

- Three mission packs, each offering new ways to play in a total of 15 missions:
– 6 Sentries missions allow you to sneak closer to enemy lines, or guard against infiltrators
– 6 Multiplayer missions open up battle royale games featuring three or even four players
– 3 Last Stand missions make the perfect capstone to a hard-fought narrative campaign

- A stunning collection of model photography, hobby inspiration, and artwork featuring kill teams and their operatives
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Die of the Dead: The Xolo Expansion
description:
It's Dia de Muertos, along with dawn the spirits of the dead come out to pay a visit to their loved ones, party and eat and drink once again all their favorite dishes. But these souls are many and excited, they pass through the world in a hurry and sometimes even forget where their homes are, how come they don’t get lost? Luckily the xoloitzcuintles are here! The bonds with man’s best friend are so strong that they surpass life and death, and these loyal dogs are ready to help the dead find their way back home.

The Xolo Expansion introduces the xoloitzcuintle to Die of the Dead. These loyal dogs can be used to guide other players to caskets, encouraging them to pick ones which benefit you, for more dice manipulation options on the future. Featuring more ways to mainpulate dice and each other, tokens, casket boards and custom dice, The Xolo Expansion takes everything people love about Die of the Dead and makes more of it.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Amazon Pitch ‚Äì Double-sided Pitch and Dugouts
description:
Most of the land owned by the Amazons is located deep in the jungles of Lustria, hidden in secret clearings or groves. But the jungle climate is unpredictable at best, and the stifling heat can suddenly give way to torrential rains. When a downpour arrives, it can awaken various jungle creatures. These saurian spectators rarely pay for their tickets, and they tend to attack unsuspecting players who get too close to the edge.

One side of the field is a dense jungle floor, dotted with poisonous snakes and featuring a huge Team Amazon icon in the center. On the other side, torrential rains have flooded the field, attracting colorful birds and huge scaly beasts native to Lustria.

You'll also find two matching pits to complete the theme. Redesigned for the new edition of the game, each pit features score, turn, and re-roll counter tracks, as well as Reserve, Knocked Out Players, and Dead and Injured Players boxes.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Star Wars: Legion ‚Äì 501st Legion
description:
The vaunted 501st Legion joins Star Wars: Legion with this pack! Led by Jedi General Anakin Skywalker and known for its bravery and unorthodox tactics, the 501st is one of the most renowned units in the Grand Army of the Republic and this set puts an impressive fighting force at players’ command. In addition to Skywalker, players will find two units of Phase II Clone Troopers, a Republic AT-RT, and three units of ARC Troopers to build their Republic Battle Force. To ensure these units are operating at peak efficiency, this set also contains three new Command Cards for use by the 501st Legion as well as all of Anakin Skywalker’s Command Cards and copies of the four generic Command Cards. Finally, a set of 32 reprinted upgrade cards gives players everything they need to outfit their legion to fit their strategy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Farplace: The Game
description:
Animal rescuers gather objects and actions to rescue and release animals in need. Each animal needs a different combination of cards to secure a positive rescue or release, with others unable to be released scoring negative points. Each player has slightly different rules depending on their Meeple. Vet cards throw a random element in typical of what is faced in animal rescue.

In addition, there are a range of map type score tracks your Meeple moves along, with bonus points to be picked up.

The game is asymmetrical in 2 ways - when each player rehomes their own animal type, they receive a different bonus. Also, each animal player type moves differently -

- The dog player can take a shortcut through a dog agility tunnel
- The cat player can hop between adjacent cardboard boxes at no movement cost
- The rabbit player can move diagonally between obstacles as well as orthogonally
- The pigeon player can fly directly over and land on obstacles and fly over water

There will be 2 options for the board in the base game, additional Kickstart exclusive boards, and various expansions including a Horse Player (which can gallop on some moves), additional maps and different full versions of the game to come. Be ready for a lot of twists on the theme and unexpected variants.

Game is designed by the CEO of Farplace Animal Rescue, an avid board gamer, and 100% of the profits will support animal rescue via Farplace.
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Merit
description:
Merit is a fast-playing, no luck required, skirmish style game in a hex based arena!

Take turns maneuvering your heroes on the map, battle to control powerful Realm Stones to unlock devastating new abilities, and unleash brutal attacks on your opponents’ heroes!

To win, either defeat all of your opponents’ heroes, or control each Realm Stone on the map.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Wargaming in History: The American Civil War
description:
The purpose of this 'Wargaming in History' series is to offer, in detail, hints, tips, and advice on specific periods and wars that are wargaming favourites. All the necessary information, - campaigns, battles, weapons, tactics, etc - is included and the books are illustrated with tactical diagrams, maps, contemporary illustrations and photographs.

Brother against brother, family against family, in a long, drawn out, numbing, never-ending surge of battlefield drama - this was the American Civil War. At Gettysburg, "the enemy came on yelling and running with the fixed bayonet charge which few troops can withstand; but the patriots did not waver ... it was a melée, a carnival of death."

Now many carnivals of death spring to life in one of wargaming's greatest actions. Here is everything the warmer could possibly want: meticulous descriptions of Confederate and Union uniforms, artillery, cavalry units, rifles, and colorful battle flags, plus authentic terrain maps, combat photographs, rundowns on the strategies and tactics of such crucial battles as Vicksburg, Antietam, and Bull Run - even evaluations of army commanders for charisma, reliability, and aggression (Grant scored 22 out of a possible 30, Lee 28).

In a Union cavalry raid, see how campaigns are successful if objectives and aims are clearly defined and how the battles are won or lost by master manoueuvres or crucial failures.

The history, panoply, and roaring destruction of the Civil War, tabletop-style, are here. Charge!

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Line of Sight

name: Nimmerlichtern
description:
'Nimmerlichtern' is a cooperative board game for up to 4 players, throwing roleplay, area-control and fortress building mechanics into the mix. Each player takes over one kid out of a ragtag group of survivors and enters the world of a stodgy 90s suburb - where kids' dreams quite literally become reality. The goal is to fight back the monsters borne from the children's own subconsciousness, before the horde of evil dreams swallows the town completely.

To make matters worse, each kid is haunted by their very own primal fear, drafted randomly at the games' beginning out of a pool of six: The fears of loneliness, illness, pain, darkness, deceipt and decay. Starting as mere forebodings, these Grand Nightmares grow stronger and gain abilities at the end of each round, the pace heavily depends on the decisions of the players. At some point the primal fears manifest themselves and enter the game board to lead their minions against the last remaining refuge: the childrens' headquarters in the attic of an empty house. A game is lost once a Grand Nightmare and its pack reaches the headquarters and the subsequent battle is lost by the players.

To avoid that outcome, the players must use their rounds – each representing a day, from dawn to dusk - to break the curse cast upon their formerly cozy town. Gather resources, build weapons, craft fortifications and barricades and banish the monsters back to the realm of nightmares where they belong.

But foremost, they've got to learn to harness the force of dreams to their advantage: At the beginning of each round –in the morning – every player draws a card from their unique deck of dream cards, containing good dreams, bad dreams, dreams that affect the game board itself and also continuous dreams that can be collected in order to unleash unparalleled powers. Dream diaries, night time seances, REM manipulators and other bizarre objects can be used to get the decks under control – to a point, because, if Nimmerlichtern teaches you one thing, it's that the force of dreams is something to be reckoned with.

So be careful what you wish for: Your dreams just might come true.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Once-Per-Game Abilities

name: Banderis
description: Travel around the world guessing the flags of each country. Each flag has a different value, collect them as much as posible to win.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Gyve
description:
Gyve (pronounced like "jive") is a drawless unification game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons (board).

Black starts by making one move, then turns alternate with players making exactly two moves per turn, one move after the other. A move is placing a stone of your color on an empty cell adjacent to N groups of your color. N must be the same for the two moves of a turn.

If you cannot make two moves on your turn, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. When both players pass, the game ends and the player with fewer groups wins. A group is a stone along with all stones one can reach from it through a series of steps onto adjacent stones of the same color.



NotesThe game works best on boards with between 6 and 12 cells per side. For quick games on boards with fewer than 6 cells per side, the pie rule is recommended to prevent Black from easily connecting a central stone to multiple edges of the board. The pie rule gives White the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

Gyve was inspired by a conversation with Michael Amundsen about both designers' previous contributions to the fewest-groups-wins family of games, namely Bolaños' Yodd and Amundsen's Solder and Elea.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: A Wretched and Costly Fight: The Assault on Fort Erie, August 15, 1814
description:
A Wretched and Costly Fight is an introductory level wargame on the battle for Fort Erie. It is part of the Battles for Canada Series of games that portray famous battles fought for in Canada during the War of 1812.

Each hex is approximately 50 yards across, a regular or militia infantry unit is 250-350 men, First Nation and Dragoon units are 80 to 100 men, and artillery units represent 2 or 3 guns. A turn represents one hour of time.

Players use a standard deck of playing cards (a custom series card set is available from the publisher) to activate their units. A six-sided die is used to resolve combats (assault and fire) as well as other game events.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: El sitio de Logro√±o
description:
Each player must place their workers in different areas to get resources or new workers. They must catch fish, get bread and wine.
To gain new workers you have to deliver wine in exchange.
To gain victory points you must feed the citizens of Village over 11 turns.
mechanics: Auction: Dutch Priority, Programmed Movement, Resource to Move, Stacking and Balancing, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Poker Revolver
description:
Poker Revolver is a semi-abstract game where both players take the role of a gambler-duelist in the Wild West. You are minding your own business at the poker table and someone challenges you to a dicey duel.

Players roll their dice secretly and simultaneously (grabbing their bullets), and then they take turns placing a die one by one (loading) onto the board (in the shape of two revolver cylinders) to see who can make the better poker combination (e.g. a Pair, Straight, Full House). Knockout your opponent before he knocks you out. Only one person walks away as a winner from a poker table.

This game involves a balance of randomness (your initial dice roll) for variability, skill (placement of your dice), as well as bluffing (just like poker).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Zombicide: Warlords of the Rising Sun
description:
This legendary Kickstarter Exclusive character expansion brings many notable names from throughout Japanese history as playable Survivors and a new Necromancer to your Zombicide games!

This Kickstarter Exclusive pack contains:

8 Survivor Figures
1 Necromancer Figure
3 Necromancer Cards

name: Doodle Heist
description:
Doodle Heist is a fun and frantic team drawing game with a twist. No artistic skills needed, but you've got to be quick if you're going to win! Can you crack the code before the other team steals your chance at victory?

HOW TO PLAY

1. Get Ready!
Divide into teams, choose an artist, and set the board with clues. Each team's artist holds a secret key card with the correct answer for the round.

2. Draw & Guess
Both teams race to identify what their artist is drawing using clues on the board. Be careful, many clues are similar!

3. Steal & Win!
Win points for guessing your team's doodle correctly ... and if you do it fast enough, steal points from the other team by guessing their doodle, too!
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: And That's How I Died
description:
You are the world's mightiest heroes, but you are a little...dead. Sitting atop Valhalla, you tell each other stories of your epic lives. Who among you was the greatest? Combine cards to create "memories" from your past and "correct" the others by changing theirs! Collect Adventures to spin the tallest tales and score the most points.

CONTENTS:
• 90 Adventure Cards
• 5 Instruction Cards
• 10 Achievement Cards
• 1 Rule Book
• 27,000 possible combos!

KEY FEATURES:
• Ages 10+
• 2-5 Players
• 15-45 min
• New Stories Every Game
• Only 5 min. Per Player
• Different Paths to Victory
• Reverse Player Elimination
• You’re Trying to Kill… Yourself!
mechanics: Action/Event, Matching, Set Collection

name: Les Pattes √† Pouf
description:
The owners are out. The way is clear to try to snuggle down in the cosy Poof in the Lounge. Who will reach it and reign supreme? Here, you form your team before the others, and challenge your opponents. But watch out: just because you recruited your team first doesn't mean you'll win!
The game takes place in 2 phases: Building your team of Fluff Balls, then the assault on the Pouffe.

—description from the publisher

Les propriétaires sont de sortie. La voie est libre pour tenter de se blottir dans le douillet pouf du salon. Qui l’atteindra et régnera en maître ? Pour cela, formez votre équipe avant les autres et défiez vos adversaires. Mais attention, ce n’est pas parce que vous avez su recruter votre équipe le premier que vous serez gagnant !
Le jeu se déroule en 2 phases : la constitution de votre équipe de Boules de poils, puis l’assaut du Pouf.

—description from the publisher (French)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Meadow: Envelope O
description: Meadow: Envelope O is a set of 4 out-of-this-world creatures, objects and places cards to add to your Meadow. Shuffle cards from this set into corresponding decks and make your collection even more amazing.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Rebel Sp. z o.o., Rebel Studio

name: Schr√∂dinger
description:
In each round of Schrödinger, one of the player is the Austrian physicist and place inside the box 3 of the 5 components in the game: a wooden cat, two water token and two poison tokens. The other players are his assistants. On each turn, they will shake the game box and use audition and deduction to try to discover what happened to the Doctor's feline . Is it alive, dead or do we have a paradox?

Getting the cat's correct whereabouts give the players points and after every player acted as the doctor twice, whoever has the most points is the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Pattern Recognition

name: Puppy Pile
description:
The adorable puppies are piled up, and you want your puppy at the top!

Each player has a secret puppy. Over the course of the game, players will move various puppies up and down through the pile. Try to figure out your opponent's puppies and keep them lower in the pile while you try to move your secret puppy to the top.

When the PICK A WINNER card is drawn, the top dog wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Hidden Roles

name: Wild Twists
description:
Double the game-play opportunities and the fun with a two-pack of Wild Twists Playing Cards by UNO. A standard deck of 52 playing cards with the addition of eight special Wild Cards for optional crazy twists! Play all the classic card games, such as Poker, Go Fish, Gin Rummy and more, but take 'em to the next level with these special cards that include different Wild Card options. For example, the 'Red Wild Card' can represent any Heart or Diamond card a player may need, the 'Black Wild Card' can stand in for any Club or Spade and there are suit-specific Wild Cards for every individual suit. Also included are instructions on how to play 'Wild Race,' a fast-paced card game that uses an entire deck! Wild Twists makes a great gift for card game lovers ages 7 years and older. Colors and decorations may vary.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Agent Who
description:
1960, the height of the Cold War, agents from various countries are gathering valuable intelligence, and paranoia is gripping every corner. Your agent has been assigned to gather information from the field and expose foreign agents.
Will they succeed in completing the task before their identity is revealed?

In the game, each player represents an Agent with a secret identity.
The goal is to uncover the Agent Codes of other Agents.

The players can perform several actions such as trying to guess the secret identity of other players or collecting clues from the area zone or trying to confuse and deceive others by showing them false evidence.

The player who can reveal more identities than the others will win the game.

Agent Who was built as a didactic game where you have to gather intelligence and draw conclusions while attempting to uncover classified information and hidden identities of elusive agents.

Agent Who is a social and entertaining card game that is easy to learn!
Intended for ages 12 +. Takes between twenty minutes and an hour per game.

-description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Sailor Moon Card Game: Masquerade Battle
description:
„Çª„Éº„É©„Éº„É†„Éº„É≥„Ç´„Éº„Éâ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Éû„Çπ„Ç´„É¨„Ç§„Éâ„Éê„Éà„É´ (Sailor Moon Card Game: Masquerade Battle) is a must-follow trick-taking game with hidden teams and social deduction. The cards have five suits with one being a trump suit, and each card has two different values. The game allows 3 to 9 players. The rules state that playing with 3 to 7 players is recommended but 4 to 6 players is best.

Players each receive a Team Card that tells them whether they are secretly on the Dark Kingdom or Sailor Guardian team. During the initial bid, players may declare the number of Character Cards they will collect and for which team they will collect them. They are not required to declare they are collecting for their true team. The highest bidder becomes Queen Metalia (if they declare for the Dark Kingdom) or Princess Serenity (if they declare for the Sailor Guardians) and leads the first round.

During a round, each player plays one card. Players must play a card matching the suit of the first card if possible, but each card has one value for the Sailor Guardians and one for the Dark Kingdom. Players choose which value to use, and the winner of each round will keep cards won using the Sailor Guardian power separate from cards won using the Dark Kingdom power. The Moon suit is a trump, and there are other special cards that can affect who wins each round. The winner of a round plays the first card in the next round.

When a round ends and at least one player has no cards left in their hand, the game ends and points are scored. Each player only scores Character Cards won using the power matching their Team Card. In order for the team with the Queen or Princess to win, two conditions must be met: (1) a single player on that team must have collected at least as many Character Cards as the Queen or Princess declared and (2) that player must have collected more Character Cards than the person with the most Character Cards on the other team. If the Queen or Princess player's Team Card matches the team they declared in the bid, that player a bonus of 5 on their count of Character Cards. If either of those 2 conditions are not met, the other team wins.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Casting Shadows: The Molten Rock Expansion
description:
The Molten Rock Expansion introduces 2 new playable Characters and 3 new Hex tiles allowing you to play with up to 6 players on an expanded map. The expansion introduces new mechanics and effects that allow you to Fortify your defenses for extra protection or Scorch nearby locations to burn anyone who dares to cross your path.
The expansion contains 34 cards, 3 Hex tiles, 10 Status tokens, 2 double-sided Player Boards, and 2 meeples.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Through Ice and Snow: Myths & Legends
description:
This is the 1st expansion for the Arctic Epic Through Ice and Snow. This expansion requires the base game to play, and includes 3 new game modules:

- Walking on ice: Relive the anguish of the arctic expeditions that abandoned their ship and tried to survive on foot.

- Inuit Myths: Discover the Inuit mythology and feel the power of its legends.

- Legendary Expeditions Lead the great explorers with their ships and historical events.

Besides these modules, the expansion includes 2 new solo scenarios: The mysterious epidemic & The voyage of Amundsen.

CONTENTS:
- 61 cards
- 1 punchboard
- 5 boards
- 35 wooden pieces

-description from publisher

name: Heroes of Normandie: War Stories #01 ‚Äì Blue and Grey at Moon-sur-Elle
description:
Five days after D-Day, on June 11th, 1944, the men of the 29th Cavalry Reconnaissance Troop were ordered to maintain the liaison between the 101st U.S. Airborne and the 175th Infantry Regiment (29th Infantry Division) near Sainte-Marguerite-d’Elle.

They were then sent to scout the roads leading to Moon-sur-Elle. Strong opposition awaited them and the fighting was fierce. It was critical to current operations to establish an observation post in the village, so it had to be taken, regardless of the cost!

This War Story requires the Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Core Box + Battle Pack #01: Bloody Omaha.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Small City Deluxe: Spring Expansion
description:
This is the second seasonal expansion for Small City Deluxe Edition.

It contains several new concepts never seen in Small City:

Road tiles and Place tiles to connect your Residences to your Factories
Specialized Citizens (policemen, traders...)
Riots can happen depending on 2 New Action characters
8 New real cities in Europe with 8 new twists
2 New real buildings: Neuschwanstein Schloss and the Coloseum
New Terrain: Forests with more planks.
Build new Palaces and Statues


and of course more promise cards!

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Small City Deluxe: Summer Expansion
description:
This is the third seasonal expansion for the base game Small City Deluxe Edition.
It contains new concepts never seen in Small City:

Supply Water to your buildings with Water Pumps
2 New Action Characters Cards
New Specialized Citizens (The teachers, the Workers...)
New Real cities in North America with 8 new twists
New Terrain: The beach
New Real Buildings : the Golden Gate, the Statue of Liberty
A new Citizen variant with the 11 men and 11 women provided in the base game
3 New Leisure Buildings to make the game more complex


and of course, more promise cards

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Arkeis: Reset Kit
description:
The Reset Kit contains one additional copy of the Expedition Logbook and one additional copy of the Camp Archives.

There is one copy of each of these books in the base game; these additional books can be used when playing the campaign more than once, if a player doesn't want to re-use the stickers or they are no longer re-usable after wear and tear.

Approx. 17×22×0.7 cm, 220 g
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Legacy Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: My First Adventure: Tracking the Dahu
description:
Today, you’re setting off to find a legendary animal.
Today, you’re going to climb the mountain to photograph the Dahu.

Who do you want to be for this hike?
Aïvy, the sportive girl?
Will, the swiss-knife boy?
With ...
Barry, the mountain dog?
Peregrin, the tamed hawk?

Choose your duo and enter this exceptional story, where each of your choices will affect your chances of photographing the Dahu!

Tracking the Dahu is the 8th book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero. Choose your character and plunge in this rather unusual story, a story where each choice you make will change your adventure.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Book, Children's Game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Weltkrieg, 1914: Solitaire World War I Wargame
description:
Weltkrieg, 1914 is a solitaire game simulating the opening six weeks of World War I, at the grand strategic level. The player takes the German side in the game, and distributes his armies among the main theaters of the war to make attacks and advances to bring about the end of the war quickly, hopefully with favorable results. The object of the game is, through your application and manipulation of military assets, to get enough Victory Points to win the game, and the war. Setting: National armies are mobilizing across Europe. Britain stands ready to enter the war if Belgian neutrality is violated. You, in the role of Germany—you cannot rely too strongly on your Austrian friends—must put your war plans into action, in search of a quick victory “before the leaves fall.”

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Emerge: Promo 01 ‚Äì One Perfect Island Goal Card
description:
Contents: One Goal Card.
Requires Emerge base game to play.
One Perfect Island: Place a Seal, Bird, and 4 Plants on a large island.
categories: Animals, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) ‚Äì TIE/sa Bomber Expansion Pack
description:
The iconic TIE/sa Bomber returns to Star Wars: X-Wing in this pack! TIE/sa Bombers are capable of delivering an astonishing payload in Imperial squadrons, and this pack puts two of these at players' disposal. In addition to these two miniatures, this pack bolsters squadrons with 4 standard loadout cards that invite players to jump into the action right away as well as 8 ship cards and 14 upgrade cards that give players the freedom to fine-tune their TIE/bombers.

Contents:
2 Ships & Stands
8 Ship Cards
‚Ä£ 1 "Deathfire"
‚Ä£ 1 Captain Jonus
‚Ä£ 1 Tomax Bren

‚Ä£ 2 Scimitar Squadron Pilot

4 Standard Loadout Cards

categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: With Hot Lead and Cold Steel
description:
A set of wargaming rules for fighting large battles set during the American Civil War.

From the First Bull Run to Appomattox Court House, enter one of the defining conflicts of American history. With shot, shell, and sabre, guide the armies of the Blue and the Grey through this first modern war to determine the fate of a nation.

With Hot Lead and Cold Steel is a large-scale, mass-battle wargame for recreating the American Civil War. Designed to handle brigade and divisional level engagements while providing a balance between ease of play and period detail, With Hot Lead and Cold Steel is ideal for new gamers and wargaming veterans alike. It contains everything players need to raise armies and craft scenarios, whether based upon historical campaigns and orders of battle or those of their own devising.

-description from publisher's website
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Krimi Total: Hau den Michl
description:
A murder mystery dinner game for nine to ten players. Only the murder is allowed to lie. All others play their roles and answer questions to get hints to find the murderer.

--

Weit oben auf einer saftigen Alm freut sich ein kleines Dorf auf den jährlichen Höhepunkt: das Scheunenfest. Der ganze Ort ist auf den Beinen, um gemeinsam bei zünftiger Musik mit Bier und frischem Wein auf das in diesem Jahr Geleistete anzustoßen.
Kurz nach Mitternacht reißt die kreidebleiche Tochter des Ortsvorstehers die stimmungsvollen Gäste aus ihrer Feierlaune: Sie habe den Huber-Michl tot auf dem weitläufigen Gelände des Starnburg-Anwesens gefunden! Was ist passiert?
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Which Side: The Postcard Struggle
description:
The story of Which Side, The postal game struggle takes place in New York, during the winter of 1910-1911 and stages homes of workers who try to survive and organize themselves to take control of the means of production before the employers become too powerful.

Gameplay: Each turn, you'll have to deal with employer offensives that affect workplace hazards, housing insalubrity or police threats. It's up to you to counter them, while paying the cost of living in order to survive, and of course generating surplus resources (strikes, sabotage, etc.) to take control of the means of production.  Place the 5 workers in your Tenement wisely to strike the right balance between survival and struggle. But beware: illness, accident or prison are never far away.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Travelers: Tokyo
description:
In Travelers: Tokyo, 2-5 players will enjoy a weekend in Tokyo. Over the course of 3 days will they explore the city and use the existing metro and train network to travel to the most interesting places. They will gain souvenirs when they do, eat, see or buy something. To do this, players will have to manage their time, money and energy. Additionally, there are cultural experiences, events and missions.
When the weekend is over, the player with the most souvenirs, culture, missions and placed visited first will win the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, End Game Bonuses

name: The Hooded Magpie
description:
The Corsac Fox is trying to secure his throne in Plumeholm through fear and clout. You, The Hooded Magpie, will stand in his way.

You are alone, observing the Corsac Fox’ acts of cruelty, deception and corruption from the rooftops, aware of his devious schemes. You will not be able to stop every event, but you might be able to stop the right ones with the right means, even just to buy Plumeholm another day.

And, if you’re lucky, maybe you'll buy yourself a chance to confront the Corsac Fox himself.

The Hooded Magpie is a Solo 18-card puzzle adventure that utilizes mechanics of crisis mitigation, dice manipulation, and resource management and is rich in meaningful choices. In a span of two rounds, at every turn, you will choose which opponents to confront, which encounters to face, which tragedies you have to abandon, and which wins will contribute to the bigger picture. Choose your battles wisely and you may just be able to bring down the Corsac Fox and bring hope to Plumeholm.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: C&B: Civilizaci√≥n & Barbarie
description:
C&B is an abstract assymetrical game for two players. The Republic, in center of the board, is defended by the Oligarchy, while the People's insurrection arises with its militants from the Conurbans, on the periphery. The capabilities and mobility of the pieces of the Oligarchy far exceed those of the People, who on the other hand tend to be very numerous as the insurrection grows.

KOAN Juegos de Mesa, a young Argentine game developer and publisher, has launched its first game C&B - Civilization and Barbarity.

It is a strategy game that is defined by the absence of chance and where each of the opposing parties seeks to impose its hegemony. To prevail, the People must block and paralyze each of the oligarchs, or take the Republic by storm through an irruption of their Leader, making the Revolution possible. The Oligarchy, on the other hand, must seek the obstruction of the Conurbans to stop the insurrection, or, using its ability to capture People's pieces, remove the Leader from the board twice.

It is a game where the strategies are completely asymmetrical, and yet a balance is achieved between the two fields allowing for the development of very different situations from game to game, in which apparent advantages often crumble quickly leading to surprising setbacks.

—description from the publisher

Desde el principio de la historia la humanidad se ha debatido entre la civilización y la barbarie. En este juego asimétrico en el que las estrategias del pueblo y de la oligarquía son netamente diferentes, para conseguir la victoria la oligarquía buscará ahogar el levantamiento popular o suprimir su liderazgo con un magnicidio, mientras que el pueblo deberá crecer en número para bloquear a la oligarquía o irrumpir en la sagrada república y hacer la revolución.

—description from the back of the box (original)

Since the beginning of history, humanity has debated between civilization and barbarity. In this asymmetric game in which the strategies of the people and the oligarchy are completely different, to achieve victory the oligarchy will seek to drown out the popular insurrection or suppress its leadership with a magnicide, while the people must grow in numbers to block the oligarchy or break into the holy republic and make the revolution.

—description from the back of the jîbox (translated)
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture, Variable Player Powers

name: Reviving Kathmandu: Buddha Promo Pack
description:
These shiny holofoil Buddha cards give an exciting twist to the way players can collect points for building Buddhas during the game.

The expansion includes:

5 holofoil Buddha cards


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Chicago 1893: The City Beautiful Tile Game
description:
In Chicago 1893: The City Beautiful, you will compete with your rivals to help rebuild the city of Chicago in preparation for the World's Exposition in 1893! Place Workers to build Neighborhoods, Rails, Parks, Boulevards and Monuments, and try to install your Alderman in the most influential Ward in the City. Whoever can build the most impressive modern amenities and conveniences for a vibrant city will bask in the glory of establishing Chicago as the model for "The City Beautiful!"
In October of 1871, the Great Chicago Fire burned a path nearly four miles long through the heart of the City. The destruction was extensive, but it created an opportunity to rebuild Chicago as a modern city. When Chicago was chosen as the location for The World's Columbian Exposition to be held there was a surge of effort to beautify the city and improve its infrastructure in anticipation of hosting travelers from all over the world.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Royal Limited: Vintage Engines
description:
Historical cars, kept in pristine condition by teams of dedicated mechanics, give The Royal Limited its extravagant appearance. Only the most skilled engineers can drive these aging engines.

The Vintage Engines expansion features 5 new Engine cards, each requiring the train to include a specific color, number, or sequence. One of these is added randomly to the game at setup. If the Engine’s goal is not met at the end of the game, the player must add 2 points to their score, making it difficult to secure victory.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Poll & Write 2019
description:
Roll and (re)write the 2019 UK general election in the tense electoral strategy game for British politicos. A truly competitive roll & write – NOT your usual multiplayer solitaire!

Pick from six political parties contesting the 2019 general election with the aim of winning a majority of the battleground constituencies to enter government. The three 'main' parties (Labour, Conservative, and Liberal Democrats) aim to win a majority or failing that become a coalition, while the three minor' parties (Scottish National, Green, and Brexit Parties) are intensely thematic asymmetric factions with their own win condition.

Each turn the leading player rolls two dice. All players write these numbers on their party sheets, selecting leaders, hammering home slogans, and completing and promoting policies. Completed sections of the party sheet allow players to claim voters in battleground constituencies, until one party wins a plurality of voters in each constituency. Winning a majority of constituencies means you enter government and win the game. Available in 2024 as a print at home game – approx. 1 A4 sheet per player, plus 2 pages of rules. Grab a pair of dice and pencils, and the game is on!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Room 25 Double Rush
description:
Only one of the opponents can emerge victorious from the labyrinth. Explore rooms in the hopes of finding the key to access ROOM 25 and make your escape, but be cautious of the traps that await if you hurry. Victory can be achieved by either escaping or being the last one standing.

ROOM 25 Double Rush takes place in the futuristic game show universe known to ROOM 25 players. Conceived by François Rouzé, the designer of the ROOM 25 series, this microgame (wallet-sized game) from Matagot pits two players against each other as they explore a series of special-effect rooms from their (and their opponent's) decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Player Elimination, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Baseboard
description:
Live the experience of being on the pitching mound or in the batter's box.

Make a hit, double triple or home run, or strike out all three batters with the best strategy.

The best game to learn baseball and have fun. It is not a simulator, it´s baseboard.

Take the batter or pitcher cards depending on your turn.

On the count of three, choose the card to play and review the result.

If there is a combination of pitching in the strike zone and swinging, it is time to hit.

Use the bat to make your shot and avoid falling into the gloves of defensive players.

Play and have fun in this two-player game of 3, 6 or 9 innings.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Impulse Movement

name: Sky Team: LGA La Guardia
description:
A cold front has the Eastern Seaboard in its icy grip. Weather conditions are less than ideal and the runway is frozen. Brooklyn and Manhattan are glistening pillars of frost. It's up to you now.

An additional airport for Sky Team: La Guardia.

Contain one postcard with two additional missions (Yellow and Black).
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: World in Progress
description:
The world has shattered into many pieces. You have been chosen to rebuild it from scratch. You must gather territories and support them by the power of the Gods to make your world a better place. Whoever creates the most majestic land will be blessed forever.

World in Progress is a simply yet extremely entertaining family game. Rules are easy to learn for everyone, but the game will also enthral strategic players as the strive to make the perfect move. Thanks to a massive number of combinations possible, no two games are the same.

You will create your own land with the land tiles taken from the neutral map by the push of faith. Are you ready to plea the gods for their support and siphon their power? Will you find the most ingenious way to expand your territory and score the most points? Win the game and become the most divine builder of worlds.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Orcs VS Orcs
description:
You represent an Orc clan seeking prestige with the all-powerful Orc king. Your mission: to invade the VastLands, a decadent human territory. But you're not alone in this mission, and you'll have to be the best, even if it means destroying any other Orc tribe that stands in your way...
This game of conquest, with armies, fortresses, towns and villages to plunder, uses the deck-building system to manage combat. During each game turn, players are awarded action points that enable them to move their armies, generate troops, build fortresses and specialize their troops by adding more powerful cards (unique army corps) to their combat deck. Combat is fast-paced, brutal but tactical. At the end of each game turn, victory points are scored according to a objectives row of objectives that evolves over the course of the game, forcing players to adapt their strategy. With four players, the game switches to 2 teams of two, adding a cooperative dimension and a more frenzied atmosphere.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction

name: Cosmos: Empires ‚Äì Culture Clash
description:
Culture Clash is an expansion to the base game of Cosmos: Empires. It adds a second build pool and two new mechanics: Culture Cards and the Patrol ability. Cosmos: Empires is a 2-8 player, 15-45 minute engine building card game. Jump into the galaxy, choose your strategy and build your galactic empire. Race against your friends, exploiting their economy to your advantage!

The game is played with two decks, from which 6 cards each are drawn into the “pool” players can select and build cards from. Each card has a cost, roll value and production value. Players also get 3 "Culture Cards" and pick 2 to keep. They can be revealed any time during the game to activate their effects. These are a-symetrical effects which are passive abilities or one-time uses.

Each turn, the current player gets 2 actions and then rolls 2 D4 (4 sided dice). The current player can use one of their actions to increase or decrease the total of the two dice by one. Then, each player with a card with a Roll value equal to the new total gets Credits equal to the same cards production value.

Finally, the current player can use their remaining actions to build a card from the card pool (or “cycle” it and take 2 credits).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Automatic Resource Growth, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Kabaal
description:
There is something in the shadows. Ancient demons are about to enter our world. They just need a few more victims as tribute ...

Lead a cult and grant one of them demons entry into our world. Win tricks to place the members of your cult on the modular game board. If three of your cultists stand next to each other, you are gonna sacrifice one of them to the demon. But watch out, because your opponents can oust you from the altars! The first player to sacrifice three cultists summons the demon and wins the game!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Trick-taking

name: The Fog: Escape from Paradise ‚Äì Uncertainty Expansion
description:
This expansion to The FOG enhances the excitement even more when playing. It consists of 60 cards in 5 decks.
Guardians: You play one of the 6 available Guardians with a special ability (asynchronous)
FOG Uncertainty: While before the FOG consistently advanced by 1 it now advances between 0 and 2 steps
Unforeseen Events: In each round you will have to take into account an event happening when moving your islanders the best possible
2 Mission Decks: You will have to fulfill a mission to achieve additional Rescue Points

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) ‚Äì Battle Over Endor Scenario Pack
description:
Players can relive the iconic battle for Endor with this new scenario pack for Star Wars: X-Wing! The Battle Over Endor pack contains everything players need to recreate this decisive battle on the tabletop, including rules for playing out the Battle Over Endor scenario as well as new Standard Loadout cards representing iconic Rebel and Imperial pilots who participated in the battle.

A new Scenario Pack that includes Standard Loadout cards featuring iconic pilots that participated in the Battle of Endor
The Standard Loadouts included in this pack are fully outfitted X-Wing ship cards, perfect for new and existing players to dive right into games of X-Wing.
Includes a new narrative scenario that allows players to reenact their own assault on the second Death Star

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Line of Sight, Movement Template, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: „ÅÇ„Å§„Åæ„Çå„Éí„Éº„É≠„Éº„ÉØ„Éº„É´„Éâ (Atsumare Hero World)
description: Atsumare Hero World is a must-not-follow trick-taking game where you have to choose between the hero's side and the monster's side. Players choose which side to take for each trick and engage in team battles. Heroes become stronger when they gather together, and monsters become weaker when they gather together.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Baptism at Bull Run
description:
Baptism at Bull Run is a Block wargame recreating the battle of First Bull Run (or First Manassas). Fought on July 21, 1861, First Bull Run was the first major engagement of the American Civil War. Despite opening the engagement with a successful flank march against two smaller Confederate armies, which had only just combined, the Union army would end the day in a disastrous rout back to Washington, D.C.

The design of Baptism at Bull Run is based on the highly regarded Bonaparte at Marengo (Simmons Games). In addition to modifying elements of its Napoleonic predecessor to reflect the character of the Civil War battle, Baptism at Bull Run expands on the earlier game's command rules with the addition of a simple card play system that varies each player's command points from turn to turn.

The game is played on a large map of the battlefield. The military units that participated (or could have participated) in the actual battle are represented by 72 pieces, with many additional pieces provided to represent units reduced by casualties or reorganized into smaller or larger formations.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) ‚Äì Fugitives and Collaborators Squadron Pack
description:
Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Fugitives and Collaborators Squadron Pack for the "Scum and Villainy" faction includes wanted criminals such as Kanan Jarrus and Arliz Hadrassian, featuring new abilities and upgrades based on their appearances in The Last Padawan and Bloodline. These pilots are joined by one HWK-290 Light Freight miniature and two BTL-A4 Y-Wing miniatures featuring stunning paint schemes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Dice Throne Adventures: Four Horsemen Promo Pack
description:
Promo Pack for Man vs Meeple's 2020 Kickstarter.

Includes 4 Meeple Mercenary (one of each rarity) and one Four Horsemen stage IV minion.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dogs of War: Mother Apollonia
description:
A new playable dog of war that comes with its own busts and special ability.

Mother Apollonia, special ability: hand of god (when winning a tactic card, draw 3 and choose 1). Mother Apollonia was an optional buy on the kickstarter.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Monster Stomping: Heroes
description:
Monster Stomping: Heroes is a card game where you mashup crazy monsters and build epic heroes to battle for your city.

The theme is contemporary superheroes vs. mutant monsters, with a building phase that gradually becomes an attacking and defending phase. The goal is to place six city defense cards around your city for the win.

Players begin by choosing a monster body, and hero body and a city to defend. Then they are dealt five cards and play begins. On their turn players can place a monster power on a monster body, a hero power on a hero body, or a city defense card on a city card, and they can play one special card. When they have a few monster powers on their monster they can instead choose to attack another player's city. They can also take their turn to discard up to their whole hand and pick new cards.

Attacking another city is called "combat" and when that happens both the attacker and defender roll a die, then add the role to their either their monster score (for the attacker) or hero score (for the defender). Then both players can start throwing combat cards which modify the numerical results for either side making the fight go back-and-forth until one player comes out on top with the highest score. If the attacker wins they add the city defense card to their city. If the hero wins they get a bonus to their next defense. There are many combat cards and also special cards which add to the teeter-totter effect that keeps the game neck-and-neck to the end. The game ends when one player manages to place a 6th city defense card around their city, making it impregnable.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling
publishers: Castle Clark Games, Castle Clark, LLC.

name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Merville Gun Battery Normandy Expansion
description:
Merville Gun Battery expands SMG play with three structures from the battlefield including a Casemate, an MG Bunker and a set of Minefields.

6 new scenarios recreate the assault on a key objective during the opening hours of Operation Overlord as the lightly armed, scattered remnants of a British paratrooper battalion attack the hardened Merville bunker complex.

Contents:
X4A Casemate #1 - a 3-D concrete bunker
X4G MG Bunker - a 3-D concrete MG gunning position
3 pieces of minefield terrain
4 Terrains cards
6 Landmark cards
6 Order cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) ‚Äì TIE/sf Fighter Expansion Pack
description:
Development of the TIE/sf fighter required Sienar-Jaemus Fleet Systems to pioneer new energy-cell technology to power the advanced systems demanded by the First Order Special Forces. The resulting starfighter boasts a versatile array of weapons, shields, and sensors, suitable for any situation.

Equipped with a Heavy Weapon Turret that can be rotated between its front and rear arcs, the TIE/sf is a threat from multiple angles. On top of the TIE/sf miniature, the TIE/sf Fighter Expansion Pack also contains four TIE/sf ship cards identical to those in the First Order Conversion Kit, six upgrade cards, and two new Quick Build cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Armada ‚Äì Republic Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack
description:
Devastate your opponent's squadrons with the speed and power of the Galactic Republic's fighter squadrons! Harness the agility of Delta-7 Aethersprites, bombard enemy captial ships with BTL-B Y-wings, control the battlefield with heavy ARC-170 Starfighters, and escort your forces with versatile V-19 Torrents.

All together, this expansion adds eight Republic fighter squadrons to your fleets, including seven elite pilots. Defend the Republic with the Republic Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Wish
description:
In a land far, far away, where magic mystery lay, There lived a djinn of great might, Who granted wishes day & night. With a flick of his wrist, He would fulfill any wish, and bring to life the heart's desire, Setting your heart on fire! Welcome to the magical realm of Wish! In this captivating board game, you and your fellow players embody powerful Djinns, beings of ancient mystical energy, each with a unique purpose and destiny.

Your task is to traverse the enchanting land, fulfilling wishes that span the spectrum of human desires—from love to revenge, and from joyous cheer to boundless wealth. As you journey through this mesmerizing world, gathering mystical crystals, forging bonds with mortal beings, and honing your special abilities, you'll unlock hidden powers that lie dormant within you. But that's not all—your path to greatness involves erecting awe-inspiring monuments that showcase your immense power and might. Will you rise to fulfill your grandest desires, prove your prowess, and unveil your true destiny? Embark on this extraordinary quest of magic and wonder, and let the adventure of "Wish!" unveil the secrets that lie within you. May the journey be as enchanting as the dreams you make come true.

Goal of the game
In Wish, you aim to gather the most Victory Points. Accomplish this by fulfilling Wish cards using amassed Crystals, matching them with Wishing Person meeples of corresponding colors. Construct Monuments with the meeples you collected and fulfill your Destiny card. Navigate this enchanting world with precision, leveraging your mastery of Wish cards, Monuments, and Destiny objectives to claim victory as the most accomplished Djinn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Ownership, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Le Franc-Tireur #10: Division Azul
description:
This issue focuses on Division Azul, a division of Spanish volunteers which fought on the eastern front. As usual 10 scenarios printed on hard paper and featuring actions of Division Azul are included. Moreover, this issue includes a counter sheet.

80 pages - 90% is in English.

This is an expansion for Advanced Squad Leader, not a stand-alone game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: German Fleet Boats
description:
German Fleet Boats is an expansion game for Compass Game's Steel Wolves - the German Submarine Campaign against Allied Shipping 1939-1943. German Fleet Boats assumes that Germany never entered into the 1935 agreement, instead following OKM’s original view that aircraft and hydrophone technology will dramatically impact concentrated submarine operations around the British Isles and that the fleet boat concept of long range submarines are needed to operate outside areas of dense ASW coverage.

German Fleet Boats postulates a change in Uboat design strategy: instead of focusing on medium Type VII boats, the Germans turn to the larger U-cruiser with which they experimented with in World War I. German Fleet Boats assumes that early Type I, II, and VII submarines are built as historically occurred, but prior to starting a more extensive building program, OKM makes the decision to build cruiser/fleet type submarines starting with more Type Is and four of the even larger (projected) Type III, the designs for which were based on the IA.

German Fleet Boats contains a new opening campaign and introduces four additional types of U-cruisers, The Type III, VIII, XI, and XII. German Fleet Boats requires Steel Wolves to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement

name: Simply Adorable Slugfest
description:
From the game rules:

You are a trainer of the cutest, friendliest, and most vicious creatures in the land. A vibrant battling scene in the region gives you lots of opportunities to hone your skills, connect with your… let’s call them “pets,” and make some good cash along the way from the losers. It’s okay, the creatures don’t get hurt, and you buy them cookies afterwards! And sometimes even milkshakes! But anyways, in Simply Adorable Slugfest, you are leading your creature to victory in combat, as it learns and grows and mauls.
--
On each turn, both trainers will simultaneously and secretly choose what available skill their respective creature will use. After they’re selected, the trainers will reveal and resolve the skills. Based on how strong the skill they use is, the opposing creature will unlock or power up their skills for future use. Once a creature has lost all of its life points, it is unconscious and the other creature wins the battle!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: ËΩü„ÅÆËø∑ÂÆÆ (Howling Labyrinth)
description:
+•.*• Infinite Reflection-Puzzle •*.+*


A compact and hot puzzle-abstract game has arrived.
The purpose of this game is simple, to reflect your spells on the walls and hit hostile monster.

This game is for two people. Each has a priest and a monster on the board with square glids. They can act 3times consequently in a turn. Actions contain placing, sliding and rotating tiles, which have walls. In the end of turn, the actor’s priest spell out into 4 ways. They reflect on the wall. If none of them doesn’t hit enemy monster, the actor will be defeated immediately.

For detailed rules, please see "Manual_EN"s below.
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Star Wars: Armada ‚Äì Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter
description:
War! Commanded by the sinister Count Dooku, the Separatist Alliance has drawn numerous worlds into open insurrection against the Galactic Republic, spreading chaos and tyranny in the name of greed. With its powerful warships and vast reserves of droid forces, the Separatist fleet seems an insurmountable threat to peace and freedom in the galaxy.

This Fleet Starter provides the building blocks for your own Separatist fleet, starting with a Munificent-class Frigate miniature and two Hardcell-class Transport miniatures. These ships are supplemented by four squadrons of Vulture-class Droid Fighters ready to swarm their enemies. In addition to these miniatures, six ship cards give you the power to choose the exact models that make up your fleet and 20 upgrade cards invite you to fine-tune each ship with iconic officers, powerful weapons, and more.

No matter how you decide to outfit your fleet, the Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter is an excellent place to begin building your Star Wars: Armada collection. You’ll find all the components necessary to begin playing within this set, including nine attack dice, 10 command dials, eight speed dials, 12 objective cards, six obstacle tokens, a range ruler, and a maneuver tool. Assemble your fleet and destroy the enemy!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tally-Ho!
description:
Defending England during the Battle of Britain.

Tally-Ho! is a book-based solitaire air war game that puts you into the role of a Sector Controller during the Battle of Britain in the Summer of 1940. You direct Royal Air Force (RAF) fighter squadrons as you struggle to protect England from attack by incoming raids by the Luftwaffe – and in one mission, by the Italians. There are too many raiders, however, and too few RAF aircraft, yet you have one major advantage – England’s “Chain Home” radar network.

Fifteen individual missions are included in this book-based game. Each mission relates to one of the key aerial engagements of the Battle of Britain. Most missions can be completed in less than thirty minutes. This is not a simulation of air-to-air combat between individual fighter planes, nor is it intended to be a realistic depiction of the air war, but rather an entertaining educational tool that allows you to experience the story of the conflict through strategic decision-making set against a backdrop of the real history of the Battle of Britain – as if you were there.

Tally-Ho! is designed for experienced and novice war gamers alike. It is quick and easy to play yet deeply challenging. Though dice do play a role, the outcome of each mission rests on your shoulders. Where you deploy your fighters, what orders you give, and what tactics you employ are the critical factors that determine the outcome of each mission. You decide which enemy squadrons to engage and how to prioritize each as you struggle with radio communications and the fog of war.

Most of the time, you cannot stop the Luftwaffe. Bombs will fall. Airfields will be strafed. Convoys at sea will suffer. Your performance in each mission will affect the setup of subsequent missions by reducing or increasing the number of aircraft available to fly on each side. If you direct your squadrons skillfully, you might prevail and save England.

The game is available on Amazon at: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BMSP4MXM/?tag=article-boardgameg...

A boxed set of game assets is available through Blue Panther, which includes an add-on EXPANSION GAME called Operation Seelöwe, is at:
https://www.bluepantherllc.com/products/tallyho

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Political, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Valda: Rise of the Giants
description:
SUMMARY
Valda: Rise of the Giants is a an expansion to Valda. As in the base game, it is a power-building strategy game where you as a viking warchief use divine powers, manage a village and resources, play powerful spells and build temples. You gather followers, fight off enemies and climb the steps to divinity.

This expansion gives you the chance to discover the power of the Giants. 15 new cards for the base deck and 68 new Giant cards that offer you brand new powers with never before-seen graphics. A new powerful resource, 7 Giant powers, double sided action tokens and 5 new player boards complete this expansion.

STORY
All was peace and quiet in Asgard. The Gods continued being worshipped and led their easy immortal life. Until Hel, Queen of the Underworld wanted to broaden her empire. She seduces Surtur to form a powerful alliance. Thirsty for destruction Surtur calls his fellow brethren to reclaim their territory. After decades of hiding the Giants rise again. War is among us.

HOW TO PLAY (AND WIN)
In Valda: the Rise of the Giants, you now have a choice between Gods and Giants and their powers to use to your advantage.
Now every player finishes 4 phases during their turn. The player starts with the Valda phase where he/she scavenge and explore the newly formed world by drafting and playing cards and actions. Building temples in the different God or Giant domains is an important way to gain divine abilities, and get access to more powerful spells. The attack phase is played similar to the base game.
