Meanwhile, Flesh Golems have long been, ahem, a ‘staple’ of Necromantic teams, adding their custom-built combination of strength and unnatural resilience to the team’s line of scrimmage. That’s not all – Necromancers have begun to call not just upon the bodies of the dead, but the spirits of the damned too! We’re not sure about the skills of the new Wraiths, but they definitely look like they’ll have some sneaky tricks up their sleeves.

Necromancers are notoriously anti-social, so you’ll just have to wait a little longer to learn more about the Wolfenburg Crypt-Stealers. But rest assured, this won’t be the last you’ll hear of these Necromantic Horror teams! Keep a watchful vigil for these creatures that go bump in the night, lest they catch you unawares.

- description from publisher

Necromantic Horror teams are compatible with the 2016 Edition of Blood Bowl using the "Teams of Legend" optional rules published by Games-Workshop.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: DiceWar: Knights of Steel
description:
Expansion Nr. 4 for DiceWars. This new expansion introduce new movement and battle formation abilities. The new faction, "Knights of Steel", has a special dangerous defense.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms ‚Äì Flames & Frost: Kickstarter Edition
description:
The Kickstarter editions comes packaged with Expansion Pack #03: Agents, Expansion Pack #04: Peasants & Knights, Duke Mico and 10 Alternate Art Starter Cards, which are not contained in the retail edition.

New threats have reared their monstrous heads in the land of Valeria! Scouts have reported seeing fiery hounds to the South and beasts that bring with them winter's deathly bite to the North. The King's heralds have been dispatched to all of the corners of Valeria to call upon new Adventurers for you to recruit while the workers lay the foundation of new Domains.

Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames and Frost adds two new powerful Monster stacks, a new set of Citizens to recruit, and new Domains for you to purchase.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt ‚Äì Jazza Ward Character Expansion
description:
This Expansion was created in collaboration with a highly popular Youtuber - Jazza. In the Jazza Ward, creative minds and artists are being exploited under the cover of personalized care. Use their talents to bring imaginative payback!

What's in the expansion box:
3 Patients (Character) Miniatures
3 Character Cards
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sleeping Gods: Lightning Staff Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Cost: 4
Type: Equipment
Effect: 1 command token to do 1 damage
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game ‚Äì Cave Dweller Savages
description:
The Free Folk are often framed as simple savages by those that live further south. In many instances, that evaluation is wrong. While the Free Folk don't harbor the trapping of much of civilization, they are not simply savages. The Cave Dwellers, though... they are simply savages.

The Cave Dweller Savages unit box for A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders a new option on the battlefield. While the unit is armed simply with scavenged weapons they've found along the way to the battle and are clothed in not much more than ratty old skins, they are still fearsome on the field, wading into combat with wild abandon. To further their fury, there is the Cave Dweller Alpha Unit Attachment, who can enhance the combat prowess of any unit they join.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Perch
description:
In Perch, players fight for control of locations by commanding birds of their own and other players' flocks. Earn points and command woodland creatures by having the most birds on a location, pushing your foes off the perch, and breaking ties to take the lead.

Each round, players add their birds into a shared bag. Players then draw birds of their own, and other players take turns stacking birds on location tiles. Each location tile will award variable points for majorities and sometimes grant players a unique ability. The game ends after five rounds, and the player who has earned the most points wins.

With a modular tile configuration and a variety of woodland creatures to control, each game will present a new tactical challenge.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, King of the Hill, Modular Board, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Set-up
publishers: Inside Up Games, Maldito Games, Skellig Games, Tabletop KZ

name: The Colonists: The Imperial Post
description: Solo scenario provided for free by Mayfair Games on their website that involves establishing relationships with the Envoy Colony.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement
publishers: Alliance Game Distributors, Lookout Games, Mayfair Games

name: Small City: The Big Tiles Expansion #1
description:
Small City: The Big Tiles Expansion #1, the first big expansion for the Small City base game, consists of 54 new building tiles:


9 palaces
12 Leisure tiles : 4 Stadiums, 4 Cinemas, 4 Swimming pools
12 Statues
4 Tramway Stations
4 Airports size 9 and size 8
4 Banks
4 Residence of Level 6
4 Recycling Centers
5 Promise cards
Rules
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: M134 Gatling Promo Card
description: This is a promotional card given away at Cool Mini Or Not's 2016 CMON Expo. This card is an ultrared weapon that takes two combat actions to use.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: It's Just A Theory
description:
Have you noticed patterns that conventional media does not explain? Do you want to know who is pulling the strings behind global decisions? Then It's Just A Theory is the game for you. In this fast-paced, storytelling card game players take on the role of conspiracy theorists competing against each other to come up with the greatest and most entertaining conspiracy theories.

During the game players create a conspiracy theory together, using ‘fact’ cards that show concepts or objects which can be used to form conspiracy theories. One player is the lead conspiracy theorist who will start creating a theory using their cards. The lead conspiracy theorist will try to guide the theory towards an ending on one of their propaganda cards. However to do this they will have to compete against every other conspiracy theorist at the table, who wishes to highjack their theory and explain their own deluded ideas. Other players hijack a theory by trying to use their cards to interrupt and successfully challenge the theory. The winner of a round is the player who plays their propaganda card ending the theory. Points are scored by finishing theories and more points are awarded by playing more cards. The winner is the conspiracy theorist who has the most points at the end of the game.

So don your tinfoil hat, open your third eye and prepare to discover truths you did not know about the world, and remember; It’s Just A Theory.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Hand Management, Storytelling, Voting

name: Trappist One: Promo
description:
Given out at Spiel 2018 with purchase of the base game

Set of eight additional investment cards for Trappist One.

These cards are simply shuffled into the existing decks of cards of the same type.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Type 7
description:
Solitaire and 2 Player Submarine Warfare.
It´s 1939. You possess authentic weapons and technology in a thrilling fog of war where every decicion you take may be your last.
A system of rotatable discs defines your encounters with the enemy by storing all the data and reactions.

You fight to stay alive and to fulfill your secret missions. A 63 cm long wooden U-boat is used to store wooden torpedoes and fuel during the game. The deck’s gun ammo is represented by wooden shells of different kinds and stored in a 20-round wooden magazine. All game tokens are made of wood and engraved as well. Burnt wood sets you back in time and deep under the surface of the ocean. You can call a wolfpack to support you or dive deep to avoid attacks while risking that the pressure may crack your hull every second.

You play multiple missions in every chapter and have unique targets each time. Move your ship above a overworld map and choose your path there. Fuel is used to keep on moving or follow your targets and alter the weather and daytime conditions. Support tickets allows you to refill your ammo and fuel or order combat support via radio. If you encounter enemies at the overworld map you start a combat loop which will be ended after you defeated your enemies or managed to escape. After each mission you will update your crew or even buy new technology for your submarine.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol ‚Äì Punisher & Taskmaster
description:
Frank Castle was a former Marine just trying to pick up a normal life with the family he loved. But when that family was murdered, Frank swore to avenge them by punishing those who hurt the innocent. Proficient in close quarters combat, a trained marksman, and an explosives expert, Frank now stalks the mean streets delivering his own brand of personal justice as the Punisher.

When Anthony Masters injected himself with an experimental serum designed to unlock the brain’s procedural memory potential, he gained the ability to instantly replicate the physical movement of anyone he saw. Using these photographic reflexes, Masters took on the name Taskmaster and became a mercenary, selling his skills to the highest bidder. Thanks to his Mnemonic Memory, Taskmaster is able to memorize, utilize, and predict the attacks of any opponent, turning their own physical abilities against them.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: The Arena of Baradum
description:
The Arena of Baradum is an easy-to-play tactical fantasy arena brawler, for 2-6 players, 30-60 min. play time. The goal is to win Victory Points, which can be either collected by winning in Battle or gathering the mysterious Orbs. The game features 8 fantastic characters by 5 amazing artists, all completely in their own art style. Each character has their own unique deck and playstyle, which makes for a different experience each time you play the game. This makes it amazingly fun for both hardcore and casual gamers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, King of the Hill, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Blitz Bowl: Undead Team
description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Undead Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 7 Undead figures in bone colored plastic, all with unique sculpts:

1x Mummy
1x Wight Blitzer
1x Ghoul
2x Skeleton
2x Zombie

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hour of Glory: Bunkerstorm
description:
From the publisher's website...

Command the world's elite in this close-quarter battle expansion. In Hour of Glory: Stronghold Kit, you learned the craft of stealth and guile. Now in Bunkerstorm you must prove your skills as a leader and take the stronghold by storm.

Control a team of 5 soldiers in a desperate mission to capture and hold the objective.

This expansion contains:
• Bunkerstorm Battle Manual
• 5 white metal 28mm Fallschirmjäger miniatures
• 5 white metal 28mm British Paratrooper miniatures
• 1 deck of playing cards
• 2 play sheets
• 5 dice

Expands

Hour of Glory: Stronghold Kit
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Skirmish Sangin
description:
Skimish Sangin is a new set of skirmish rules designed specifically for the Afghan conflict. Playing at an individual figure level, players get to feel the intenseness of adrenaline fuelled modern warfare, while still dealing with the responsibility of command.

From a game preview;

"Skirmish Sangin isn’t an IGO UGO game; characters are activated in combat phases based on their BODY attribute. The BODY attribute of the character dictates which of the ten phases of a combat round a character is active in – the higher their BODY (BDY) attribute, the earlier a character’s combat phases occur."

The game is designed as a realistic narrative miniature conflict game based on a modern theatre of war.

As such weapons are realistic, wounds have consequences, and players are left with a realistic story to tell.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Pocket Landship: The Second Front
description:
An expansion for Pocket Landship: Free Trial Version.

The war continues. Battles open on a second front. Both sides throw more iron and fire into the conflict. But, there is hope.

Take your landship into battle once again, this time against 9 enemy units. But, you’ve got resources behind you that you can call into action: an artillery strike, bomber strike, air recon, and more.

Pocket Landship: The Second Front expands the original Pocket Landship: Free Trial Version by adding more enemies and 2 additional assets that the player can call on during the game to help defeat the onslaught of 9 enemies.

Each turn, the player will roll 3 6-sided dice and assign each die to each of their cards to attack the enemies. Then, for the enemy turn, roll the 3 dice and assign them low to high left to right across the front enemy line, then take the assigned actions.

Cover art and card background images are public domain art from WWI artist Muirhead Bone.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #37 ‚Äì Vehicle Pack #2
description:
Warfighter WWII - Vehicle Pack #2 - Expansion #37 - Adds 112 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Vehicle Soldier and Hostile pack with new Hostiles Vehicles and Soldiers Vehicles to play as. (German, Finnish and Russian)

Cards included are:
12x Finland Vehicle Cards
15x Poland Vehicle Cards
15x Germany Vehicle Cards
7x Action Cards
21x Finland Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
20x Poland Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
22x Germany Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Royal George 1788 / HMS Hibernia 1804
description: An additional British flagged, Umpire class Ship-of-the-Line for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'H' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Wars: Legion ‚Äì BX-series Droid Commandos Unit Expansion
description:
Take your droid army to the next level with the BX-series Droid Commandos Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! The Separatist Alliance's first special forces unit, BX-series represent a major step forward from their B1 battle droid cousins. Cunning, stealthy, and deadly in close quarters, these lethal droids can operate in squads or independently in pairs.

Whether you use them to target key enemy personnel or plant deadly dioxis mines, the seven BX-series droid commando miniatures you find in this expansion are highly customizable. Several weapons options— including blasters, vibroswords, and a dioxis charge—as well as deflector shields give you the freedom to build the unit of commando droids you've always wanted, while eight upgrade cards invite you to out t them to fit your particular strategy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Friendly Fire Pack 4
description:
Friendly Fire Pack 4 contains ten scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2008 ASL tournament held in Linköping, Sweden.

Scenarios included:

FrF25 - Yasuoka's Tank Experience
FrF26 - A Polish Requiem
FrF27 - Cocktails for Molotov
FrF28 - Luftlandekommando Hedderich
FrF29 - Sting of the Italian Hornet
FrF30 - Bidermann's Escape
FrF31 - Pursuing Frank
FrF32 - The Hellenic Expedition
FrF33 - Under the Northern Light
FrF34 - The Jagdtiger Theory
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: 1871:  More Grand Tactical Rules for the Franco-Prussian War
description:
1871 fast-play rules for the Franco-Prussian War-- the latest in Bruce Weigle’s popular “1870” series of rules for the mid-19th century European wars of transition.

While 1871 features the same tried-and-true game mechanics as his earlier 1870-1859-1864-1866 rules, the fire combat, charge/melee, and morale sections have been radically streamlined – effectively halving the time it takes to play each turn. 1871 is completely compatible with the earlier rules, and includes ample designer’s notes, color illustrations, examples of play, and twelve new historical battle scenarios (from both the Imperial and Republican phases of the war). It does not repeat the extensive historical or bibliographic information already found in 1870, however.

Each well-researched scenario includes complete orders of battle, historical notes, map, and alternative scenarios; they range in size from relatively modest battles of a couple of divisions to multi-corps debacles. Well-illustrated with contemporary artwork and terrain board pictures; a one page color quick reference sheet is included. Approximately 65 pages, spiral-bound, full color.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Boutwood: Cooperative Boss Battler
description:
Boutwood is a cooperative boss battler for 1-4 players. Take on the role of various animal characters with different playstyles. Coordinate your actions, defend the forest core and defeat the attacking boss as a team.

There are currently 6 playable animal Survivors and 1 Boss-AI.

Survivors:

Bear wants to be in the middle of the fight, getting stronger as he takes damage.
Frog plans his actions in advance, placing deadly poison around the board.
Crow moves quickly, giving her allies the opportunity to attack or helps them escape from danger.
Squirrel shoots his acorns from afar, attacking from a safe position before running in to get his acorns back.
Deer and her bird familiar coordinate together in order to attack monsters and help their allies.
Fox jumps into fights to chain her attacks, just to get out of danger in the right moment.


Boss:

The Spider Queen traps her victims in deadly webs and sends her spiderlings to attack the forest core.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Drackua
description:
A card game with the objective being to eliminate the opposing clans or to eliminate the fortress. In order to play you will need the cards, 1 12-sided die, and 1 6-sided die.

The deck of cards consists of 4 clans with 12 characters plus dragons and special cards. 120 cards in total, 30 for each clan, with a design of thematic fantastic images based on colors. The colors include, Yellow-Earth, Blue-Water, Green-Air and Red-Fire.

The rules are available in both English and Spanish.

Juego de cartas fantástico con 4 clanes de 12 personajes más sus dragones y cartas especiales. 120 cartas en total, 30 de cada clan, con un diseño de imágenes de temática fantástica basado en colores, Amarillo-Tierra, Azul-Agua, Verde-Aire y Rojo-Fuego. Cada clan tiene su color y significado e imágenes de la tonalidad de su color.
Reglas en 2 idiomas, Inglés y Español. Números y símbolos, sin más texto, 1 dado de 12 caras y otro de 6 necesarios. Objetivo del juego: eliminar a los clanes opuestos o la fortaleza.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Firestorm Planetfall: Battle for Proteus Prime
description: Battle for Proteus Prime is an action-packed two player game set in the exciting Firestorm Planetfall Galaxy. Discovery of a hidden technology has turned the surface of the long-abandoned world of Proteus Prime into a deadly warzone as the Aquan Prime and Directorate battle for victory.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game ‚Äì Nightmare Deck: Temple of the Deceived
description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from Temple of the Deceived Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 18Rhl
description:
The games are based on Francis Treshams 18xx railway game system. Both games, 18Rhl-Rhineland (18Rhl) and 18LRA-Lower Rhine Area (18LRA) set in the western part of Germany. Most of the rules are the same for both games but they have different elements and therefore, provide different challenges. In 18Rhl, the crossing of the Rhine and running the Rheingold Express is important for successful play. It is suitable for 3 to 5 players and last between 3 and 4 hours. In 18LRA, the Rhine harbours are a key factor to victory. 2 to 4 player compete in a game that offers a shorter playing time than 18Rhl. Each game has a different map as well as a different set of private companies. The features of the latter give each game its special flavour. There are also rules for a ‘Short Game’ that can be played within one hour and a 2-player variant.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement
publishers: Fox in the Box, Marflow Games

name: D&D Icons: Gargantuan Black Dragon
description:
This debut Gargantuan product contains not only a black dragon, but extensive stats for the figure as well. There is also a full-color map and a playable game scenario, as all the figures in the D&D Icons line are playable in both the D&D Miniatures skirmish game and any roleplaying campaign.

Components:
One pre-painted Gargantuan black dragon (4”x4” base)
Double-sided stat card
Playable encounter
Full-color poster map
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: That's My Throne
description:
“The King Lorenzo XIV of Bastardoom has been kept captive by “Lizardzilla”, a humongous creature that inhabits in the periphery of the realm, and since all of his sons are adopted, he did not choose an inheritor. What a problem. The king’s council decided that the one which is most suitable among them shall obtain the throne of the realm, but how do they to be worthy? A challenge said the eldest and wisest of the council. Let the boys show their abilities to rule. All their desitions will be evaluated. Will you be able to demonstrate that you are a worthy successor of your father?”

Welcome to That’s My Throne, a Roll & Write boardgame, in which you take the role of one of the inheritors of the realm of Bastardoom, and in order to gain Glory points, you must develop community work. Be the one who obtains more Glory Points and, places the crown of victory on your head!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game ‚Äì Free Folk Raiders
description:
The bulk of the Free Folk forces are made up of the everyday people of the various tribes. They don’t have fancy metal armor. They don't relentlessly train and drill maneuvers. They barely have weapons, just scavenging a bit of bone or old swords from the battlefield. But what they lack in military tactics, they more than make up for in one thing: numbers. When the raiders come down from the north, they’re like a tidal wave, overwhelming enemy defenses as they go.

The Free Folk Raiders unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders a new option for the battlefield. The unit may not have the best stats in the game, but that means their low cost makes them very easy to combine with any force. The Raid Leader Unit Attachment adds to their deadliness, allowing another Fee Folk unit to activate directly after the Raiders do.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Global War 1936-1945 (Second Edition)
description:
Global War 1936-1945 Second Edition is the re-implementation of Global War 1939, which is its First Edition iteration. This Second Edition is a remastered version of Global 1939, with the scope of the game greatly expanded. Here are some of the key points:

There are a lot of rules in Global War -2nd edition but do not be intimidated! Many of them are optional and you are encouraged to select rules that suit the type of play you enjoy. New rules in this expansion include:

Multi-stage ship and facility production
Advanced research development system with 13 technologies.
Nation-specific victory objectives
New Lend-lease system where players can lend money or units.
Soviet Union as a third alliance
Spanish Civil War
Chinese Civil War
Advanced convoy raiding system with world-wide convoy routes and escorts
New units including airborne infantry, militia, cavalry, mountain infantry, marines, medium bombers, coastal submarines (and more)
Carpet Bombing
Combat Air Patrol
Diplomatic Pacts
Strategic Rail Movement
New facilities: Shipyards, coastal artillery, fortifications (and more)


The new map is completely redone with more territories and land features than ever. These include;

Mountains
Rivers
Baltic-White Sea Canal
Minor power colonies
New nations
Chinese Warlord Regions


Global War-2nd Edition is already the most expanded game of its genre. Expansions include:
• Fighting Railways
• U.S. & German Ordnance
• Amerika Companion
• United States Unit Set #3
• The Few the Proud, The Marines
• Alaskan Warriors
• Over 30 3D Printed Game Units
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: 7 de Table
description:
It's hard to describe this kind of flicking game, because the description of the game has a great chance of being longer than a single play. 7 de Table is made in Lyon (France) and has reached it's final version with engraved boxwood counters and a triangular leather bag to carry them.

There are 3 principles:

The first player who reaches 7 points or more wins the game
The points are easy to take by launching one of your "Centaur" pawns bumping into opposite pawns showing some points (one or two).
There is no board, and at extreme limits... there are no rules either, the players have to define what is correct or not to block the enemy fire !


It seems to be a dexterity game like Carom's or Pool, but it can be played in 5 minutes and everywhere if there is a table or some kind of surface. In fact, it's a true politically incorrect game, that can be played according to its rules or... not ! The rules are a bit complex and explain the multiple combination between counters and action pawns, but this complexity is more valuable for the trickiness !!!

The game is short enough so that it can be re-played thus avoiding silly quarrels, so let's play !
mechanics: Modular Board

name: BrickQuest
description:
BrickQuest is a game of small-scale fantasy combat similar to HeroQuest, Warhammer Quest, or MageKnight Dungeons. It requires at least two players to play and can be played easily by four to six players.

One player takes on the role of the BrickMaster. His job is to create, using construction blocks, a variety of dungeon rooms in which the game will take place, and creatures to inhabit them. Ideally these rooms will be modular so they can be added to the table one at a time as players enter them or get sight of them.

The remaining players will play heroic characters who enter the dungeon in pursuit of gold and glory.

Since BrickQuest is a boardgame, it uses a higher level of abstraction than roleplaying games. Rather than trying to capture all the nuances of fantasy combat, it uses simplified rules for quick and balanced play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: No Middle Ground: The Battle for the Golan Heights, October 6 to 10, 1973
description:
No Middle Ground' is a simulation of the Syrian Offensive (Operation Badr) at the beginning of the Yom Kippur War. The Syrians were attempting to breakthrough to the highly populated Israeli territories to the west, as well as drawing Israeli air and ground forces from their Egyptian allies offensive in the Sinai. The game is intended to be an easy-to-learn game suitable for novices, as well as a challenging and fun contest for veteran grognards.

The 11 x 17 map depicts the Golan Heights at 4 km per hex.
The 168 counters represent Israeli battalions and Syrian and Arab-allied units brigades.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Death Ride: Mars la Tour
description: Tactical simulation of the Franco-Prussian War battle of Mars la Tour/Vionville, August 1870.
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse

name: Arclight
description:
From the publisher:

Premiering at the Origins Game Fair, Arclight is a fast playing spaceship combat game. This new release from Second Rat Games captures all the fury and chaos that dogfighting in space promises. With a one roll resolution system, an evolving setting, and the ability to add your own empire to the official universe, Arclight promises to be an excellent addition to any fighter jocks collection. Everyone wants to blow stuff up, and Arclight satisfies in style.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ski Gammon
description: Players try to earn a set amount of Groschen (money/VP) which is awarded by completing ski runs.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pro Wrestler
description:
Detailed Wrestling sports simulation.

Contains 16 fictional wrestlers all with differing abilities. Create your own match-ups, even create your own wrestlers!. Play tag-team matches, battle royals, cage matches etc. Develop skills and wrestler histories. Fun for tournament play.
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Le Jeu de la Guerre
description:
A game that attracted little attention when it was published in the eighties, despite the reputation of its designer. The concept was developed by French essayist Guy Debord (1931-1994) in 1965, but not published for many years. Debord described himself as a filmmaker, but he is known as the founder and one of the most important members of the Situationist International, a small band of avant-garde artists and revolutionaries. One key concept of their theory is the spectacle: the image replaces substance and modern capitalist society is a society of "spectacular" commodity consumption. Having long been treated as a producer, the worker is now courted and seduced as a consumer.

In 1977, Debord created a small publishing company named "Les Jeux Stratégiques et Historiques" with French movie producer Gérard Lebovici. The first game was Debord's "Le Jeu de la Guerre", but only 4 prototypes are produced. The game was published as a book, with a map, rules and detailed descriptions in 1987. (Lebovici had been mysteriously shot in a parking lot in Paris by this time). In 1991, Guy Debord decides to insist that all his movies & books be destroyed. It is also the fate of his book/game. Debord committed suicide in 1994. Nevertheless during the '90s, his work gains more and more influence. The book/game is published again in 2006 by French publisher Gallimard (price: 18 €), but it's only a book (in French), co-signed by Debord's lifetime partner Alice Becker-Ho.

The game uses a mapboard containing 500 squares (25 x 20) divided in two by a border line. Each territory has 2 arsenal squares, 3 fortress squares, and 9 mountain squares (blocking movement,shooting and communication lines). Setup of units (infantry, cavalry, artillery, horse artillery) is free and secret. At his turn, each player may move up to 5 units and/or attack. Aim of the game is to completely destroy the enemy or conquer his 2 arsenals. No dice: combats are resolved taking into account the attack/defense ratios of the opponents (unit retreats from -1, and is destroyed from -2) Communication lines are critical.

The English translation published by Atlas has a faulty translation of the rules, making it more or less unplayable.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Age of Reason, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Atlas Press, Editions G√©rard Lebovici, Gallimard

name: From the Cellar: Pack 1
description:
This scenario pack contains ten color scenarios designed by the publishers at La Franc-Tireur. Scenario #49 may be combined with #47 & #48 from Le Franc-Tireur Issue #8 to form a campaign game.

Also included with the pack is a small overlay sheet containing 2 overlays. The overlays are FT4 and FT5.

These scenarios are compatible with Avalon Hill's / MMP’s ASL System.

The scenarios are:

FT #49: Lingevres - Aftermath: Lingevres, France, 16 June 1944
FT #50: Meeting on the Summit: Mont Froid, France, 6th April 1945
FT #51: Harmless Steel: Raseinai, Russia, 24 June 1941
FT #52: Bouchon A Bouchon: Bouchain, France, 25 May 1940
FT #53: First Drop: Gorki (North West of Mogilev), 14 July 1941
FT #54: The Wisps Come and Go: Menil 3 Fetus Farm, France, 4 June 1940
FT #55: Finnish Blitzkrieg: Near Alakurtti, Finland, 24 August 1941
FT #56: Primo Contatto: Pokrovskoje, Russia, 11 August 1941
FT #57: Wysoka Mountain: Wyoka, Poland, 2nd Sept 1939
FT #58: Dream is Over: Le Mesnil Adelee, France, 7 August 1944

See Also:

From the Cellar: Pack 2
From the Cellar: Pack 3
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: K√°osz Galaktika K√°rtyaj√°t√©k
description:
This Hungarian ccg is based on the play-by-e-mail rpg Káisz Galaktika. The weak galactic empire of seven different races is attacked by aliens. Millions try to escape and build colonies on the other end of the known world. Players are leaders of colonies, trying to destroy each other in order to occupy a planet.

The decks represent colonies, a playes loses if (and only if) no card remains in the colony. Cards represent spaceships, crow, weapons, events, and so on.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Micro Machines Racing Board Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Micro Machines Racing Board Game
Featuring Actino Speed Shifter Spinner

Ages: 5 and up
Players: 1 to 6

Object of the Game: Be the first player over the finish line or the player to finish 3 laps around the track.

Equipment:
2 Micro Machines
4 Game Movers
4 Game Mover stands
24 pieces of game track
1 Speed Shifter Spinner
12 Lap Tokens
Instructions

Summary: Each player in turn shifts the Speed Shifter and moves the number of spaces as indicated by the spinner dial.

Manufactured and distributed by International Games, Inc. Joliet, IL 60435
(c) 1989 Lewis Galoob Toys, Inc. All Rights Reserved
mechanics: Modular Board

name: Guided Lands
description:
Guided Lands - Tabletop battles for all fantasy miniatures

Guided Lands is a new tabletop game for two players, ages 14 and up. The game has an universal approach to tabletop gaming, where almost all fantasy miniatures with a scale around 28mm can be fielded in battle. Players take on the role of two mighty warlords, who muster their troops to claim the throne and be crowned king of the Guided Lands. Doing so players will use a unique step-by-step approach to create different races and equip their soldiers with weapons, armor and special abilities, thus making nearly all of your fantasy miniatures you have lying around somewhere ready to be used as heroes or units in Guided Lands. The scale ranges from small skirmishes to epic battles including monsters, magic and powerful artillery. An easy and streamlined ruleset as well as a card-driven initiative system keeps gameplay fast, while also engaging for seasoned tabletop generals. So dust of your old miniatures and start playing!

Guided Lands is the first game of the new publisher Smiling Monster Games and will be released in a limited first edition of 500 copies at Essen Spiel 2010 in German language (Hall 6, booth 6-808), estimated price € 20 (softcover book).

More information at www.smiling-monster.de
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: BattleTech: Cranston Snord's Irregulars
description:
From the back cover
“ Cranston Snord's Irregulars have widely different reputations, depending on who you ask. Katrina Steiner thinks of the unit as one of the most effective, if unorthodox, units in her employ. House Marik would like to rid the Inner Sphere of the unit and has been trying for many years. Jaime Wolf sees the unit as a band of looters who have made good. One way or the other, the Irregulars are probably best known for their ability to get into and out of tight spots created by their never-ending quest for the lost artifacts and/or treasures of Mankind's past. Whether called looters or not, they are still a unit to be reckoned with.

This scenario set details the history of Snord's Irregulars, profiles the statistics and conditions of it members and the company 'Mechs, and includes 14 scenarios pitting the Irregulars against the wide variety of opponents they have fought throughout their colorful past. Also described are some of their more memorable treasure hunting expeditions.”
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module C3A ‚Äì Andromedan Threat File
description:
From the back cover:

Everyone in Star Fleet knew what a Klingon was - and Romulans and Tholians too, for that matter. They had met them in peacetime, had seen their ships. Star Fleet had fought them in wars detailed in a thousand history books. But Andromedans were, when they first appeared, new. No one knew what they looked like or what they wanted or how their technology worked, but everyone knew three things: They were here, they were dangerous, and they neer negotiated. Everything else was a guess.

This product adds hypothetical units for the Andromedans, fighters, bombers, gunboats, refits of phaser 1s and Heavy Tractor Repulsor Beams for sat ships, new weapons include plasma pods, spatial distorters, and the fearsome dissection beam. Includes scenarios to show the destruction of the Lyran Democratic Republic by the Andromedans.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Teampower
description:
This is a team trivia game with a betting element (guessing how many answers your own teammates or the other team will get right).

The game is played in two teams, team white and team black. Team white starts by drawing a card. Each card contains one general question or overall topic (e.g. "Which of these fungi are edible?) and 6 specific questions (in the example above: names of different fungi). The first player of team white announces the general question for the first player of team black to answer. Before the specific questions are read, a die is thrown to determine which of the two teams (the active player's own team or the opponents) has to guess how many correct answers the active player will be able to give. The number of points gained by the active player's team is determined by both the number of correct answers and by how close the team's guess were. (The system for point allocation is a bit complicated; the game comes with a cardboard dial for determining the number of points.) Then the next player in team white has to answer questions and so on, until one of the tams reaches a previously established numbers of points (40, 50 or 60 points).

Question cards come in three different types: "for all ages", "young players usually have an advantage", and "more experienced players usually have an advantage", which allows the players to adjust the level of difficulty. Each player also randomly draws two joker cards, which can be played after the general question has been announced (but before the specific questions are asked) and is then discarded. Joker cards also come in three different types: one allows you to pass on your question to a different member of your team (the "I'd rather you answer" joker), one allows you to take over a question from a member of your team ("I'm an expert in this area, I want to answer this"), and one allows all the team members to answer a question together.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing

name: Starfire
description:
The original Starfire, obscurely published in 1975, was the prototype for the later Task Force Games series. The presentation is minimalist: a mostly blank hex sheet and one page of rules. Players must improvise their own counters!

Like its successor, the game depicts combat between spaceships. Each ship is represented by a series of letters,with each letter representing a system (shields, engines, several types of beam weapon, torpedoes, guns, etc.). In each turn, ships fire their weapons, then move. The probability of a hit depends upon range. A hit destroys one of the target's systems, gradually reducing its firepower, defenses and speed. Movement is simply a number of hexes equal to the number of engine systems - no momentum or other complications of physics.

There are three scenarios: "Main Battle Fleet", "Convoy Action" and "Planet Assault". Terrain, in the form of radiation belts or asteroids, may be added in the players' discretion.

Re-implemented by:

Starfire
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Anima Tactics: Azur Agent
description:
In the Supreme Archon’s crusade to gain complete control over Gaïa, he has surrounded himself with the most unusual of players and servants. These people, endowed with exceptional abilities and powers, make up his private army, the forces with which he plans to extend his power beyond the limits of man’s understanding.

Dark Azur Alliance Prowler - Lv. 20+

At 4 | Dm 4 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 11 | Re 8 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4

Agent: Azur Agents are not unique characters and you may include 1 for every 150 Levels in an Azur Alliance Party. For example, a party of 300 levels could include up to two Azur Agents.

oo - Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
The Azur Agent becomes Hidden. Upkeep: o

oo - Murder Attack (Subterfuge, Attack)

+ 3 Attack / +2 Damage. The Azur Agent must be Hidden to perform this attack.

AZUR AGENT Skill Card

An Azur Agent can possess any combination of the following options, as long the added levels do not take their total level above 40. Any option cannot be chosen more than once.

The Agent's Speed is increased to 12/16. Lv: +10
The Agent recovers one more Action point per turn. Lv: +10
The Agent's Speed is increased to 8/12. Lv: +5
The Agent gets Infiltration and Open Movement. Lv: +5
The Agent gets the Innate Ability Ranged Attack, Distance (12 inch). Lv: +5
Murder Attack is increased to +4 Attack / +4 Damage. Lv: +5
If the Agent deals damage with a normal attack or a special attack, he causes Poison Lv: 2 Effect 14. Lv +5
The Agent gets +1 Attack. Lv: +5
The Agent gets +1 Defense. Lv: +5
The Agent gets +4 Life Points. Lv: +5
The Agent gets the following ability: Lv: +5
ooo - Kaiser (Ki, Attack)

+ 4 Attack.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Exobiology
description:
You're exobilogist!
Space university of unknown life forms (SUULF) gave you task to find new, unique animals, plants and humanoids from outer space.

During game players collect cards (which reflect information about some species) from 4 decks (1deck=1planet) for making up encyclopedies, articles and guides or they just can deliver some exponates to museum of SUULF :)

During each turn players can do 1 action, which are:
Explore planet- (take a card from planet decks)
Write text- place 2 cards from your hand facedown
Publish text- get VP for text you've written
Give exponates to SUULF museum- discard cards which are not useful (for VP)

Game ends when there is no unrevealed cards in the planet decks.

The one who manages the best sets of cards will get more VP and become GREATEST EXOBIOLOGIST.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Elemental Clash: Spellforce
description:
Buried deep within the soil lies an ancient tomb. But this tomb is more than a mere resting place. It's a library of spells lost over time and secrets meant to be forgotten. Spells and summons controllable by only the strongest of Sorcerers. Down in the eternal darkness these ancient tomes and scrolls have lived on throughout the turmoils above ground. Now that's all about to change, as a group of adventurers has broken the seals of the Spellforce and by doing so, they unleashed the single greatest terror known to man... Dragons.

The aim of the game is to reduce the cards in your opponent’s card-deck (or Spellbook) to zero by using the Spells and Creatures in your Spellbook. Players take turns that always follow the same structure. For each point of damage a Player receives through Creatures or Spells, he or she puts the top card of his or her deck on his or her Discard Pile (or Archive). Is a player unable to draw a card, he or she loses immediately.

The Second Expansion to Elemental Clash focusses heavily on Spell cards and introduces a whole new card type - Equip Spells - which can be attached to Creatures in order to strengthen them or give them certain abilities. Furthermore, an exciting new ability is introduced: Salvage. Cards with Salvage can be played for free if discarded from you hand. Also, Dragons make their debut in Elemental Clash: Spellforce...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Foosball
description:
In Foosball players are players of two football teams and their goal is to win the game. This game is inspired by the classic foosball.

Foosball is a game for 8-22 players, aged eight years, with a variable playing time depending on what players want. It's a typical convention game for a large number of players that have a long table to sit comfortably face to face.

In each team one player will be the goalkeeper, another player will be the striker and the others will be field players. The game is divided into rounds, which end when a team scores a goal. Each round begins with a goal kick. Goalkeeper places the ball in front of him and then the goalkeeper rolls ball (rolls die). When player rolls the ball, any other player of the same team can claim the ball and the opposing team can attempt to steal the ball. If the player that has received the ball is a striker, he can shot at goal. The team that has received fewer goals is the winner


En Futbolín los jugadores forman parte de dos equipos de fútbol que se enfrentan en un partido, y su objetivo es
ganar dicho partido. Este juego está inspirado en el clásico futbolín.

Futbolín es un juego para 8-22 jugadores, mayores de ocho años, con una duración variable determinada en función de lo que los jugadores deseen. Es un típico juego de convención para un número alto de jugadores que deben disponer de una mesa larga para sentarse cómodamente frente a frente.

En cada equipo un jugador será el portero, otro el delantero y el resto jugadores de campo. El juego se divide en rondas, que concluyen cuando un equipo marca gol. En cada ronda el juego comienza con un saque de puerta. Le entregamos el dado que hace de balón al portero, que comienza el juego lanzando el dado. Una vez el dado se ha lanzado, cualquier compañero del jugador que ha lanzado puede reclamarlo, y cualquier contrario entre ambos jugadores puede robarlo. El delantero, cuando recibe el balón, puede lanzar a puerta. Gana el equipo que logra más goles.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Noah, My Poor Dad
description:
Noah, My Poor Dad is a free print & play game for 2 - 4 players. Player chooses to play as one of Noah’s son who has unique ability each. The goal is to help Noah to complete the ark & collect as many animals & food as you can before the flood come.

In each turn, a player assigns three workers to collect resources to build ark or gather animals. Beware! There are Nephilim everywhere who may kidnap your workers & raid your camp. Players may also assign workers to build up walls vs Nephilim attacks or research metal-working skill to get more resources. Besides, workers may be assigned to vineyard to produce wines. In each turn, Noah will make a worship to God & gets a blessing card. Players may use wines to bid this blessing card & control Noah. Player controlling Noah always moves first in each phase & may use Noah to get a privilege. Player who got most animal pairs at game end (when flood comes) wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Worker Placement

name: Touhou Shisouroku: Eiyashou-hen
description:
User summary

The fourth "Shrine Maiden Dominion" box, this box being based on the characters in the 8th Shrine Maiden game: "Toho Eiyasho" or "Imperishable Night".

Contains all base cards, 25 action cards, separators, 10 blank cards and five unique Reward cards
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: BattleTech: Mercenary's Handbook
description:
From the publisher: The Mercenary's Handbook is a BattleTech and MechWarrior supplement describing the mercenary way of life. It details everything from troop capabilities to a mercenary unit's expenses, and from the ins and outs of contract negotiations to the nature of 31st century warfare. Commentary and views on the Succession Wars mercenary provide a solid background for gamers who need to learn the basics of the business of war, while game rules translate these ideas into simple systems for creating a merc outfit, finding and signing with employers, and resolving an entire military campaign.

This 104-page book contains more than 50 full-color illustrations and mercenary crests. The complete history and operating procedures of three example mercenary companies are also included, the Eridani Light Horse, the Waco Rangers, and Wilson's Hussars.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Gladiatori: the Dog
description: Gladiatori: The Dog is a new miniature for the Gladiatori board game. This miniature allows Animal variant in the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Gladiatori: the Bear
description: Gladiatori: The Bear is a new miniature for the Gladiatori board game. This miniature allows Animal variant in the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game ‚Äì Game Night Kit 2013 Season One
description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game - Game Night Kit 2013 Season One includes the following Nightmare Decks:

The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game ‚Äì Nightmare Deck: Passage Through Mirkwood
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game ‚Äì Nightmare Deck: Journey Along the Anduin
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game ‚Äì Nightmare Deck: Escape from Dol Guldur

and a deck box. The artwork depicted is Khazad-dûm.

Game Night Kits are technically only available to retailers and not for general purchase. Game Night Kits contain 3 Nightmare Decks, Tournament rules, a Poster and a Goodie (Playmat, Deck box). It is a limited release, which is meant to support FFG's Game Night program. Later on, only the Nightmare Decks are released as Print on Demand to the general public. Those decks are sold individually.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Choose Your Crew: Rockband
description:
Battle it out with a rival to become the greatest Rock Band in the world!

Choose Your Crew: Rockband is a 2 player card game designed to Rock! Gather your crew of roadies and techies for support before battling it out with screaming guitars and pounding drums on stage. Each band member must prove his worth with Skill and Popularity to avoid the dreaded Magazine Headlines. Hair spray catches fire, feedback deafens the crowd, stage props fall and equipment gets stolen but gather the right support crew and you will thrash and mosh your way to the top!

Along the way earn Gold Albums and steal support crew from a rival. Then use those dedicated crew members and outstanding stage performances to boost your band members' attributes before challenging a rival to a Battle of the Bands! It's a card game. Play it loud!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kingdom Death: Monster ‚Äì Survivor Kara Black Challenge Scenario
description:
Survivor Kara Black! This is a special promotional miniature that is a collaboration between Kingdom Death & The Legendary Studio McVey!

She was supposed to come with:


KD:M one shot challenge scenario
Promo giant stone face gear card
A painting guide that will have a special highlight on painting skin tones!


Survivor Kara Black was shipped in Wave 1 of Kickstarter fulfillment, but the game content mentioned in the campaign was not included. Game creator Adam Poots mentioned that the content would be printed and released on their website eventually. For now, it is available in PDF format on the Kingdom Death website.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: The Duke: Lancer Promo Tile
description: The Lancer promo tile was given out as a participation reward to those to entered the Gen Con 2014 tournament for The Duke.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory

name: Pool Checkers
description:
A member of the Checkers Family also known as "American Pool Checkers"

Very popular in the south of the United States, particularly with the African American community, this game differs from Checkers due to its "flying kings" and men capturing backwards (while still moving only forward).

The most similar game in the family is Brazilian Checkers from which Pool Checkers differs only in the capture rule (maximum number of captures is not compulsory).
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Wuxing
description:
Not playable on their own as you need two starter decks to play the game.

Battleground Fantasy Warfare is a point-based tabletop tactical wargame in which units are represented by cards.

A new faction for Battleground, inspired by the terracotta warriors of Ancient China.
Includes both the base and reinforcement decks in a single package, as well as the basic and advanced rules.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Death Ride Kursk: IISS Enhancement
description:
DRK-IISS is the Enhancement package for the DRK-IISS game set. This package provides the charts and counters necessary to play the detailed, or enhanced, rules for Air, Maintenance, and Logistics, for the IISS Panzer Korps area of the battle.

The Air Enhancement provides the Air units and supporting charts and tables to recreate the air war in a more detailed manner. Air units can conduct Close Air Support (CAS), Combat Air Patrol (CAP), Escort, Interception, Airfield Ground Attack, Ground Attack (GA), and Interdiction missions.
The Maintenance Enhancement provides units that represent the Recovery units for recovering wrecks on the battlefield. Battlefield recovery can be tricky when the enemy is nearby. This is just one of the many issues you will need to consider when planning to recover wrecked units. And if you lose these units then your ability to get replacements is seriously hampered.
The Logistics Enhancement provides supply convoy units that are required to move supplies to units and around the battlefield and has a more natural use of supplies in the structure of unit organizations.

IISS Enhancement comes with (in Full Color):

Air Operations Charts
Logistics Charts
Maintenance Charts
600 Unit Counters and Markers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 ‚Äì Reggiane Re.2001 Falco II
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Reggiane Re.2001 Falco II was an Italian fighter aircraft. With its flexible design, it proved to be able to undertake a number of roles, from convoy escort to night fighter. Thanks to its maneuverability, it could dogfight with more powerful opponents like the British Supermarine Spitfire. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards. This is not a complete game. You must own a WW2 Wings of Glory - Starter Set to play.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: City of Ideologies
description:
City of Ideologies is a strategic board game in a futuristic setting for two up to four players.

Humanity had to leave Earth centuries ago and travels in search of a new home in a huge city by the vastness of space. Players assume the role of leaders who are trying to reshape the city after their vision in an erupting revolution against the old system. For this they must legislate, kindle demonstration, gain influence over the districts of the city and always keep an eye on the mood of the people and the changing game board.

Both the game board, as well as the laws are constantly changing, it is important to keep a cool head, gain advantage through agreements with other players or through own concepts or intrigue to weaken the position of the other players.

City of Ideologies combines different game mechanics: You move protesters across the board, which turns around three times each round, role dice and push your luck, gain influence in districts, use different cards to perform unique actions and at the end of each round, one person is chosen by election of all players who is allowed to change a paragraph / rule mechanism.

Each action may be carried out in various ways. In most cases, they are paid with influence points, which vary from faction to faction depending on their main focus. If a player can not muster enough points for an action, then he can trade with his fellow players. Or he activates a district, which lets him perform the action or pulls a card that allows him to perform the action or uses a person of his faction. Or he changes a paragraph, so that the action costs less points.

The player who collects the most victory-points will win the game after five rounds. The way you collect victory points depends on the one hand on your ideology, which you choose at the beginning of the game. So every player gains victory points in different ways. For example, one player gets a victory point every time he prevents other players actions. Another player collects victory points if the other players give him voluntarily cards or influence points. On the other hand players can gain victory points on certain districts, by cards and paragraphs.

At the end the player will be victorious, who is both the most accurate follower of his ideology, as has also been successful in competitive areas.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Monsters & Mercenaries Reinforcements
description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Monsters & Mercenaries faction. It includes new types of cards.
mechanics: Variable Phase Order

name: Rise and Fall of the Roman Empire: Strategic Decision Series
description:
From the publisher:

This is another of our historical games of skill - no dice are used.
It covers the period from Julius Caesar through 476 AD, the date most often given for the fall of the Western Empire. That's 536 years, which is a LOT of history! Our system uses 10 year turns for a total of 54 turns. During these turns, the Romans (and Parthians/Sassanids) will create their empire, try to maintain it, and then finally defend it against many incursions.

The game covers not just the Roman Empire, but the Parthian/Sassanid (Persian) Empire as well, and even one you've probably not heard of: the Kushan Empire. The map covers from Ireland (Hibernia) to India and from Tingis (Morocco) to the lands of the Huns (Kazakhstan) on the 37" by 18.5" vinyl-covered map.

Units are included for all the peoples of Europe and Asia that were involved in the conflicts: the Celts (over 30 tribes), the Germans (tribes, migratory tribes, and Germanic Kingdoms), and over 35 other native peoples. Not only are the Huns included, but the less well-known Hunae (Hephthalites) that moved against the Sassanid Empire are as well. Two complete Roman armies are included on the four 88-counter sheets: the legions and the reformed Roman Army of the later Empire. There's even a counter for the "Walls of Constantinople" and counters for the numerous Civil Wars that Rome had. Leadership was important, and the best of the Roman Emperors are included, as well as the best of the Parthian and Sassanid "King of Kings."
Production is key to success, and the primary economic centers of Europe, Africa, and Asia are shown on the map. Gaining control of these is key to replacing your losses. The Parthians even get a boost for the profits from the Silk Road.
Game Rules will be posted on-line and you can take a look at them before buying!
"Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori." -Horace
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle ‚Äì Lords of the Night
description: Lords of the Night is an expansion set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle, published by White Wolf in 2008. This set focuses on the independent clans, revisiting them for the new Vampire: The Eternal Struggle Third Edition set. Each of the four preconstructed decks for this set spotlighted one of the independent clans: the Assamites, Followers of Set, Giovanni and Ravnos.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Senatus
description:
It is 100 A.D. The present emperor is Trajan; one of Rome's greatest generals, leading Rome's greatest military expansion. He has ruled for two glorious years. The senate is largely perfunctory, but those in power still seek the Emperor's ear in order to push their own agendas. This game is about trying to gain Trajan's favor and rule Rome from the shadows.

In Senatus players are members of a secret cabal attempting to control the Senate from behind the scenes. By manipulating the system, passing Bills that improve their status, and gaining influence over the city's factions, the players gain control over various aspects of Rome. Victory points are earned by having influence over the Senate, factions, Senators, and Emperor's Favor. At the end of the game, the player with the most extensive power structure (i.e. victory points) wins.

Be warned, Politics is a bloody endeavor! You will work to usurp the control of others in factions, pass bills to help your allies and punch your foes and all the while your robe is more and more stained with the stench of corruption. Can you navigate these treacherous waters and emerge the hero of the senate?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement

name: Kampfgruppe Commander III
description:
Kampfgruppe Commander is the winner of the prestigious Origins Award. This updates third edition adds two scenarios, a template for vehicle cards, and makes many small tweaks to the system --incorporating ten years of player feedback.

A poorly led Soviet tank brigade uses its entire turn simply to move and fire at an enemy held town. The German commander now seizes his chance. With superior command quality, his Panzers move twice to come out of seemingly nowhere to strike at the Soviet’s flank. An exchange fire leaves one Soviet unit broken and other shaken. The Panzers then move out of harms way. The mobile defense prevails!

Most WWII rules leave you wondering how the Germans ever won a battle. Usually they fought outnumbered and against opponents with equal or superior equipment. So how did they ever win? The answer lays in their outstanding unit level leadership. Kampfgruppe Commander III places leadership quality at the forefront. Using the game’s unique and fast-paced leader activation system, German units simply fight with more options and capabilities than their opponents. And each allied army fights differently with its unique command abilities that develop as the war progresses.

Kampfgruppe Commander III recreates all aspects of grand tactical mobile warfare using a scale of Company sized, multi-stand units. Infantry battles are as fast-playing and interesting as tank duels. The game’s mechanics are fast and simple, yet full of historical flavor. Small to medium sized games can be played in under two hours, or larger battles involving whole divisions in an evening.

Included in the 136-page book:

Complete Rules.
Eight scenarios introduce players to the simple, yet unique game mechanics and illustrate basic battle tactics.
Complete Tables of Organization and Unit Data for Germans, Italians, Americans, British, French, Soviets, and Polish.
Player Aid Cards and Unit Information Sheets
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Hoplite: The Great Battles of Sparta's Persian Expedition
description:
Two scenarios and 26 counters included in C3i Magazine, Issue #29.

The Battle of Meander 397 BC.
Designer Notes. The Spartan army has just halted and faced the rear to deploy. The Persians have also hastily deployed from column. As the battle is about begin, Xenocles' ambush force has just emerged from hiding in the off-map woods to appear in the rear of the Persian Army.

The Battle of Sardis, 395 BC.
The Persians are favored. The Spartan army withdraws when unit with Route Points totaling at least 70 have been eliminated. The Persian Army withdraws when units with Rout Points totaling at least 85 have been eliminated.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Dust Tactics: NDAK Tank-Hunter Grenadier Squad ‚Äì "African Lions"
description:
While the vipers lay in the shade and wait for their prey, the lions roam and hunt for theirs. Generalfeldmarschall Rommel himself started calling the tank-hunter Grenadiers of the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps the 'African Lions'.

Throughout the history of the Axis presence in Northern Africa, these men have fought isolated, without any support from tanks, walkers or artillery, more often than any other Axis unit. With only an automatic weapon and a trusty Panzerfaust, they have repeatedly defended desperate positions against all the might of the Allied army.

More men coming from the ‘African Lions’ have been awarded the Iron Cross (often posthumously) than from any other formation in the Afrikakorps. Brave and fierce, they surely deserve their nickname.

Many “African Lions” are veterans of the first Deutsches Afrikakorps. They have already been through the worst this war can offer, and many have chosen to join these specialist tank-hunters squads, were you need nerves of steel. Attacking an armoured vehicle at close range is not for the faint of heart, and veterans are more comfortable alongside others equally prepared to tackle the job, leaving younger recruits in the Grenadier Battle Squads, providing covering fire.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Yard of the Month
description:
Version 2.0 coming 2023-2024.

In the pristine little neighborhood of Gnome Crossing, the competition for the highly coveted award of “Yard of the Month” is fierce. The residents will stop at nothing to win, including sabotage. While some gnomes will beautify and protect a garden, some gnomes will curse it, resulting in quite the eye sore.

Will you be the first to fill your garden with 10 flowers and be crowned “Yard of the Month,” or will you be the laughing stock of the neighborhood.

Yard of the Month is a family-friendly card game for 2 - 6 players. In the game, each player (neighbor) is competing to have the best flower garden. You have access to resources to either help or hinder a garden, including the garden gnomes Gnick and Gnack. While Gnick will keep your garden safe, Gnack's goal is to curse it, but that isn't anything a hammer can't handle.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hot Blood, Cold Steel: The Battle of Chawinda, September 15-16, 1965
description:
Description from the publisher:

Hot Blood, Cold Steel is a war game simulation of the climactic battle fought near Chawinda, India. On September 1st, 1965 Pakistani forces launched Operation Grand Slam, an offensive intended to secure approaches to Jammu and Kashmir provinces from India.

Outnumbered Indian frontier forces fought desperate holding actions that successfully held the Pakistanis to limited gains that brought them to the outskirts of their objective, the town of Phillora. On September 15th Indian forces launched their counter-attack,

Operation Riddle, that sought to throw back the Pakistanis and take back the crucial crossroads town of Chawinda. What ensued was the largest tank battle of the post-WWII era to that date, one that would only be eclipsed by the 1973 Yom Kippur War.

Each copy of Hot Blood, Cold Steel is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
One sheet of 180 single-sided, un-mounted counters (mounted counters can be had for an additional $5.00).
One Players' aid sheet
7 pages of rules

The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh with graphics by Ilya Kudriashov. Hot Blood, Cold Steel uses the Blood and Steel design. Players draw formation chits to activate their formations and units, and play is very interactive. A complete game takes about 2 to 3 hours to complete. Although designed for two players, Hot Blood, Cold Steel is well suited to solitaire play.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Vs System 2PCG: SHIELD vs Hydra
description:
In Vs System 2PCG, players choose a main character, build a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempt to KO the other player's main character in a game of superhero battles.

Vs System 2PCG is superficially similar to the original Vs. System collectible card game, but is a completely rebuilt game that takes some inspiration from the original. Combat has been streamlined, the turn structure is different, the resource system has been revamped, and the game is no longer collectible, with cards instead being released in a non-random format. A single box contains a full play-set of all cards.

Vs System 2PCG: SHIELD vs Hydra pits these two organizations against each other with 200 new cards including Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and Locations. Vs System 2PCG: SHIELD vs Hydra can be combined with any other Vs System 2PCG sets.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game ‚Äì US Soldiers Flatbed
description:
This expansion contains:
1 Plastic truck that includes: Civil model, Military model.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: SOS Gal√°pagos
description:
The Galápagos Islands are known worldwide as "The Enchanted Islands", a paradise of wildlife inhabited by species unique in the world, the same paradise that inspired Charles Darwin in his formulation of the Theory of Evolution — but any environmental change may disturb the delicate balance of the ecosystem that shelters these wonderful animals, putting their lives at risk!

S.O.S. Galápagos is a board game in which players take on the role of ecological activists whose mission is to rescue animals whose lives are threatened by irresponsible human activity. In order to rescue animals at risk, players must make the best possible use of their resources, which are represented by action dice and helper tokens.

The game lasts exactly twelve rounds, each of which is divided into five phases in this order:

Phase A) Threat
Phase B) Throwing the dice
Phase C) Player actions
Phase D) Resolving actions
Phase E) Preparing the next round

During a turn, a player can perform all the actions that their action dice and helper tokens allow. Through the use of both kinds of actions, players attempt to rescue animals at risk and to fight against environmental threats. At the end of the game, whoever has collected the highest number of rescue points will be declared chief rescuer and win.

The future of the Galápagos Islands is in our hands: To work, rescuers!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War ‚Äì Ezekiel Booster
description: This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Ezekiel and Shiva to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Land of Confusion: The Battle of Fulda Gap, 1985
description:
“As long as capitalism and socialism exist, we cannot live in peace. In the end, one or the other will triumph—a funeral dirge will be sung over the Soviet Republic or over world capitalism.” –V.I. Lenin.

If the “balloon had gone up” in Cold War Europe during the 1980s, one of the hotter spots of that hell would have been the Fulda Gap. Communist East Germany’s western border projected a salient that was pointed directly at this key geographic feature of West Germany. If offered the Soviet and Warsaw Pact forces the shortest and most direct route through West Germany and the Rhine River. Defending here were the bulk of the US forces committed to NATO. How much of a fight that could be waged here would in large measure determine whether the Communist of Free World would prevail in this very hot and dangerous war.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination ‚Äì Hamburg
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: 100 Swords: Season 2 Promo Pack
description:
Promotional cards given with the Season 2 Kickstarter.

Fluffy Doppelganger: Until end of turn, ignore the effect of a monster in the dungeon. You may pass that monster.

Inconceivable Singularity: When revealed, find and roll a die. This monster's defear cost and gold values equal the die's value.

Dungeon Press: When encountered, draw a card.

Warrior's Sword: "She let nothing hinder her pursuit of The Great Swords." Book of Forgeborn.
(Warrior's Sword is also used for the solo Weary Warrior variant)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Danmaku!!: Lunatic Extra
description:
Lunatic Extra is an expansion that focuses on power. It’s loaded with cards like Full Power, Occult Balls, and Lunar War, as well an emphasis on late-game Touhou bosses such as the much awaited Flandre Scarlet!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Party Game, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Master Detective
description:
"Another body appears on a river bank. The marks of shooting denounce another murder in the once calm city. Police alone cannot handle the investigation of all crimes, while the population and the press are demanding energetic action from the authorities. With police under pressure, authorities decide to hire private investigators in the hope of helping police unravel the recent wave of crimes plaguing the city. Players represent these investigators, and they must seek the clues hidden around the city and use all their acuteness to solve these mysteries".

Master Detective is a game of medium complexity, suitable for casual and experienced players. Its main mechanics are deckbuilding and deduction.

In each game, one crime card is randomly chosen and secretly put face down. This card contains the description of one murderer, one accomplice and one witness. The first player to discover the identity of these three characters is the winner.

During the game, the players will use their cards to walk around the city, buy stronger new cards to improve their decks and check the hidden clues, in order to solve that crime.

Take your magnifying glass and start unraveling crimes!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: OrcQuest: Monster Slayers
description:
