Inside the box you can find new player cards for existing factions, a new Region deck for the Hinterlands that include the new Viratis faction, and special map Regions that contain powerful Megaliths instead of towers as well as 16 stretch goal cards from the Kickstarter Campaign. The KS campaign also included a URL to a free mini-solo mode: Faraway Invaders.

Stretch goal cards:

6 New Advisors: Heretic, Informant, Nomad, Proxy, Spirit, Warlord

4 New Numerai: Dreadbanner, Fearbender, Palestar, Shatteredmask

4 New Relics: Eye of the Prophetess, Forbidden Gate, Gift of the Ancients, Sojourner's Blessing

2 New Titles: The Arcane, The Mad
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Racing 1
description:
Racing 1 is a racing game for 2-6 players with a high level of strategy and resource management. You will be able to play stand-alone races or the campaign mode that will take you through a World Championship where you will develop your team throughout the 6-race season.

At the beginning of the game, each player must choose a team and driver and will receive a team log (paper booklet) where they will record the results of the race and the development of their team throughout the season.

Before each race, each player will have a double-sided board (steering wheel) to manage their resources during the race, such as energy, tires and fuel. In addition to a card deck of each type of tire you have chosen for that race (soft, medium or hard).

The objective of each race will be to finish in the first position efficiently using all your resources to earn the most points and profits possible to improve your team for the next race.
While the objective of the career mode will be to get the most points at the end of the season to win the drivers' world championship or the teams' championship.

On your turn you must:
Take 5 cards from your tire deck and play a minimum of 2 or up to 5 cards.
Advance your car the spaces corresponding to the total value of your played cards
Advance o move back the corresponding spaces for your chosen car configuration for that race.
Use your resources; energy, fuel or driver skills.

Also at the start of each race you can use your earnings to upgrade your car by purchasing new tech part cards that will give you an upgrade in the Curve or Straight sectors in the race. So the mix of tech pieces you choose for your car's race setup is crucial.

On the other hand, during the race you will earn experience points that you can use between races to improve your driver's skills or that you can use during the race to develop the skills that your driver currently has.

Each Race ends when all players have reached the finish line and points and winnings are distributed to each player depending on their finishing position. While the season ends when 6 races are completed and a winning driver and team are defined.

Of course there will be some other cool racing features like DRS system, Safety Car, weather changes that will affect the performance of your tires, dice mechanics for the Pit stops, and much more.

You will be able to play a new season with the same races or adding new ones and maintain the development of your team and driver for the new season. So, you will start as a rookie, but how far can you get?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Events, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Track Movement

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Gwaka'moli Crater Gators ‚Äì Lizardmen Blood Bowl Team
description:
If rumours are to be believed, the origins of Blood Bowl lay in Lustria, home of the ancient and powerful Slann, and their Lizardmen servants, at the very dawn of time. Though the game has moved on and evolved in the Old World, the Lustrian League is working with the NAF to bring the old and new closer together. The Gwaka'moli Crater Gators have made the leap across the world-pond to match their skills against some of the biggest names in the sport, and their natural talent and unconventional playing style have proven to be a massive hit with fans.

If you're looking for a funky and fresh new twist to the game, Lizardmen teams are where it's at. They have access to the best of both worlds: with players that are strong and tough, plus fast and agile ones. Once you get the hang of using your Saurus Blockers (not to mention Kroxigors if you really want to make an impact) to protect the nimble Skinks long enough to perform some slick plays, you'll find yourself scoring again and again. Add their unconventional aesthetic to the mix, and you've got a team that looks great, plays well and scores big.

This multipart plastic kit contains all the components you need to assemble the Gwaka'moli Crater Gators, a Lizardmen team for use in games of Blood Bowl, containing 6 Saurus Blockers, 4 Skink Runners, and 2 Chameleon Skinks, plus a roster sheet. Also includes a transfer sheet, 2 Slann-statue turn markers, egg-themed balls, and 12x 32mm Citadel round bases which feature holes to place the ball.

The rules to use Lizardmen teams in your games of Blood Bowl can be found in Spike! Journal 7.

description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Khan Queso Promo Card
description:
A new mercenary card.

Special ability: Plagoue and Spread
Khan Queso comes bearing the Plague ability, spreading danger across the battlefield as he advances. It is possible to even chain Plague across multiple units with clever positioning, causing all sorts of mayhem around the battlefield!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: G√©m Klub Kft., Plaid Hat Games

name: Star Wars: Legion ‚Äì Dewback Rider Unit Expansion
description:
The Empire often uses local creatures for its patrols, and in desert environments, Imperial troopers rely on dewbacks, mighty reptilian creatures that can survive extreme temperatures. Between the Sandtrooper rider's array of weapons and the powerful claws of their mount, this duo is a force to be reckoned with.

Within Star Wars: Legion – Dewback Rider Unit Expansion, you'll find an unpainted, beautifully-detailed Dewback miniature featuring a Sandtrooper rider with four distinct customization options: Your Dewback Rider can be built carrying their standard shock prod, or you can equip them with three different weapons. On top of the ability to customize the look of your Dewback Rider, this Unit Expansion gives you plenty of ways to tweak how this unit operates in the thick of battle. Six upgrade cards accompany the miniature, letting you modify its armament, training, or the comms systems it carries into battle. Rounding out this expansion are a unit card and all the tokens you need to deploy it as a support unit for your Imperial armies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Aromat
description:
Aromat is an abstract strategy game that uses a mobile app for score calculation and score keeping. The heart of the game is the hexagonal game tile, consisting of shapes, numbers, dots and a player Emblem Sign.

You can play Aromat by placing the Game Tiles next to each other. Each special calculation created by the two adjacent sides of the Tiles following the gameplay rules either adds or subtracts a certain amount of points to your Game Score. The mobile app does the score calculation and score keeping for you.

Aromat can be played using Play Field Elements by constructing these elements before the game starts. It can also be played without, which requires more thinking because of the many possibilities present in any given moment during gameplay. Therefore it is recommended to use the Play Field Elements until a player becomes strategically aware of the many possibilities the game has to offer.

Research in neuroscience, human behavior and interaction and music didactics has been conducted in order to construct the methods and mechanisms behind Aromat. It contains beneficial aspects in terms of brain training and musicality training, which are achieved in a fun and engaging way.

Aromat is a collectible game that starts out with the "Basic Set" and expands through a system of "Extension Sets"'

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Heroes of Normandie: Miller's Rangers
description:
Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exlusive promo.

From the publisher:

With this elite unit, the US army is able to face any SS group, or any other bad encounters. Ambush Specialists, these soldiers are also heavily equiped with BAR rifles that provide them with a high suppressive fire power.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Open Combat
description:
From the publisher's website:

Create the heroes, adventures and battles of your imagination.

The Open Combat tabletop miniature wargame skirmish rules are suitable for any pre-gunpowder historical period or fantasy setting.

Use any miniatures & terrain you have
Only a small area required (24"x24")
Suitable for pre-gunpowder historical periods and fantasy settings
Customize the characteristics of your fighters, ‘stat’ them any way you like.
Fast setup and play time (30-40mins)
Open Combat puts you in command of a warband of fighters led by their charismatic (or frightening) leader as they match themselves against their foes.

Who the combatants are and what they are fighting about is down to you, your miniature collection and what you have the 'itch' to play.

The 100 page full colour hardback book includes rules for building and customising your warbands along with a range of weapons, skills & abilities (including Influence abilities where your warriors can make psychological attacks against the enemy).

You'll find rules for movement, combat, terrain and additional rules for hiding, climbing and jumping.

Scenarios include 'Open Combat' with three optional deployments including 'confrontation' where your warbands could begin the game intermingled even before the fighting starts! Additional scenarios set the warbands the task of capturing prey or discovering prizes hidden on the battlefield.

Two roster sheet approaches are included: A 'single page' for players that like all of the information in one place; A sheet of character cards for players that like to have separate information for each model.

Also included are guides to creating your first profile, terrain set-ups Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) and a Quick Reference Sheet.
categories: Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: World Conquest
description:
World Conquest is a board game which simulates the struggle of major world powers for global dominance in the nuclear free future. Each game turn, an event card is drawn and played which alters the course of history and fate of empires.

World Conquest is similar to Risk but has air superiority and naval units. There are also independent units, generals, and carrier task forces.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Kanchis Arena
description:
Kanchis Arena is a self-production effort from designer Matias Michelan of Argentina who reached us in the last Giochi Sforzeschi 2004, where a Self-production Area was coordinated by Angelo Porazzi.
The game is a battle among two-six fighters on an hexed arena, they can get points both conquering the treasures hold in the towers or fighting the other players.
Balancing these two choices, brings you to victory.
See this game on 2004 section and on Kanchis Arena section on the website www.warangel.it
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: John Campbell's Classic Harness Racing
description:
From the tube...
".. a game which truly simulates real harness racing. You control your horse's speed, decide when to make your move and make all of the other decisions. Your driving skill - not just luck - determines the outcome." The object is to drive your horse the farthest twice around the track.

Yes the game is packaged in a tube. The "board" is a piece of fabric backed printed vinyl, similar to a place mat. Players are assigned or pick a horse from a choice of 200 in the Stable book. Each horse has a movement number that is broken down into quarters (4 numbers), one for each quarter mile (track is a half mile). These quarter mile numbers are then reduced to 6 numbers, from 1 to 9. These 6 numbers are printed on cards. On his turn the player uses one card to move his horse. The move is modified by: spaces that count as two, variable length lanes in the curves, swaping cards with the draw pile without changing the movement #, holding back a card till the next quarter mile, blocking another from holding back a card, chance cards at the start and on the home stretch, chance dice roll is required to pass thru a space directly in front of another horse. It is recommended to have a race secretary. This person should be a fair minded person who will set up and referee the race.

The players try to use all of their movement while causing others to waste movement. This player has observed that it is easy for all of the players to use all of their movement with only 6 horses in the race. All of the movement robbing mechanisms are easily avoided with 6 horses. The race is then determined by the movement number combined with the Start and Stretch chance cards. The use of 12 horses makes a much more interesting game. With 12 horses the movement robbing mechanisms can not be totally avoided.

John Campbell is a Hall of Fame driver (not rider) that holds many of the sport's records. John Campbell did not design the game but has endorsed it. The 1989 instructions invite players to a yearly tournament where the championship is decided by playing against John Campbell.

The instructions promote another game, "Classic Thoroughbred Racing" which is not currently in the BGG database.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Old Macdonald: The Farmyard Round-up Game
description:
Intro from the rulebook. The playing board represents a farmyard. It is playtime in the farmyard for the animals and they are all coming in from the fields to play together. The hens only want to play with the other hens, the ducks with the other ducks and so on. But Old Macdonald is busy working in the farmyard and keeps leaving his buckets in the way.

Summary. The object of the game is to be the first player to gather his or her 4 animals to play together in a square formation. Each animal starts on a separate side of the board and is moved across the farmyard (in the form of a grid) by rolling the dice. When a six is rolled, Old Macdonald and his buckets can be placed in the way of the other players' animals.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Fleet Battles: Omega Master Rulebook
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

As described by ADB, the original 2007 release of the Omega Master Rulebook contained over 320 pages (bagged, loose leaf, with a black-and-white cover) and contained every rule, chart, scenario, and ship description from the first four Omega modules; Omega tactics; updated sequence of play listing, including the entire Alpha Octant, the simulator empires, and the Lesser Magellanic Cloud; completely updated Annex #7E, Damage Conversion Chart; all ship descriptions and scenarios for the Omega Octant that were published in Captain's Log; and the "lost" history section originally written for Module Omega 4.

ADB presented this as the relaunch of the Omega Octant setting, with future Omega modules in development.

In 2011, a revised edition of the Omega Master Rulebook was released in print and on e23. With its page count brought up to 422 pages, this update integrates additional rules and R-section information (most notably those from SFB Module Omega 5), as well as scenarios and tactical primers published in issues of Captain's Log between the original 2007 edition of the OMRB and this update.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Last Gamble
description: The Third Reich's desperate Ardennes offensive of Christmas '44: The Battle of the Bulge.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Beyond Chess
description:
Beyond Chess is a chess variant that uses a modular gameboard that actually shifts during play. Rather than playing on an 8×8 grid, the game is played on 64 movable squares.

Players can move pieces as well as game squares, causing an ever changing landscape of movement possibilities. Furthermore, it is possible to entirely isolate an opponent's playing piece, thus rendering it immobile.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Long March
description:
The Long March contains 17 tactical scenarios covering the Communist Chinese fight with Nationalist Forces between 1931 and 1937. Also included is a campaign game linking 14 of the included scenarios to represent the entire struggle of preservation and revolution. Most but not all of scenarios focus on the Long March of 1934-1935, when the Communists relocated their base from southern China to northern China. Designed by Jay Long.

These scenarios require counters and maps from other Heat of Battle offerings such as High Ground.

The Long March is for use with Tactical Wargaming Systems. If used with Hasbro products, be advised this is not a Hasbro or Affiliate product and there is no claim as such.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Le Franc Tireur #8: Normandy June ‚Äì August 1944
description:
This issue is focused on the Normandy campaign. The magazine is about 50% French, and about 50% English. It has the standard 10 scenarios in English. The scenarios are printed on A4 glossy paper.

An expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) game system.

Scenarios:
FT 39: Stutzpunkt Riva Billa
FT 40: Ready to Sting
FT 41: Greyhound at Bay
FT 42: No Luck
FT 43: Infantry Probe at Argentan
FT 44: The Liberation of May
FT 45: A bridge too Near...
FT 46: Lingevres - Preparation
FT 47: Lingevres - Execution
FT 48: On the Swedish Border
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: NUTS! War Against Japan
description:
NUTS! - War Against Japan is a supplement to the NUTS! World War 2 tabletop miniatures wargame describing forces and rules specific to the Pacific Theater of Operations.

From the publisher's website:
For the Allies, the war in the Pacific Theater of Operations (PTO) was fought under conditions unlike any found in Europe or North Africa. Fought against an enemy unlike any they had ever faced before.

For the Japanese, the war was about proving that their cause was just: the liberation of Asia from the yoke of Western oppression.

Welcome to the world of NUTS! - War Against Japan. NUTS - War Against Japan includes American, Australian, British, Chinese, and Japanese armies, all the major players in the Pacific from 1941 to 1945..

WAJ portrays actions at the "tip of the spear", the area of combat where small arms dominate the field. This is that deadly space where you can look your enemy in the eye while driving a knife into his heart; where the foxhole next to you may just as easily have the enemy in it as one of your buddies.

Are you ready for it? Come experience PTO combat in a way that no other game can. Come experience War Against Japan.

NUTS! - War Against Japan is not a stand-alone game. You must have the core rules, NUTS! Second Edition, to play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Enlightened Warlords: A Player's Guide to Soldier Kings
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

"Enlightened Warlords is a 64-page book supplement for Soldier Kings, our multi-player game of the Seven Years’ War. It includes game strategy for all eight Major Powers, a history of the Seven Years’ War, and a number of new variants to spice up your game:


National Aspirations. Austria can win the game by capturing Martinique — but Maria Theresa wanted Silesia, not some Caribbean island, no matter how valuable it might be. Each Major Power receives a new set of national objectives unique to itself and usually conflicting with someone else’s goals.



Special Powers. Prussian counterfeiting, France’s free press, Austria’s Military Border and much more. Each Major Power becomes even more unique in play.



Pre-War Options: Habsburg Spain, the Maratha Empire, Bonnie Price Charlie. How would each of these unusual events have impacted the next generation?



And Lots More Options: Tropical diseases, national finance limits, supply, capital cities and on and on."
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Appian Way Cafe
description:
The Empire lives and works on its stomach, and when it's lunchtime in Ancient Rome, hungry patrons come to the Appian Way Cafe. As waitstaff, you are working hard to fill your orders before the other players so that you can score the most tips. The kitchen is too busy cooking to pay attention so you have to be lucky and clever to get your orders filled!

Fast paced and fun, Appian Way Cafe is beautifully illustrated and designed to be quick to learn and play. Lighthearted fun for everyone!

Appian Way Cafe is a matching game based on the theme of Roman Fast Food. Game play is simple but fun. Each player is dealt three orders they are trying to fill by matching them to cards in their hand. Each turn you draw and try to play something. Every round, tips for filled orders are given and at the end, the player with the most tips wins. Various special cards spice up gameplay and competition.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Don't Play With Drugs: The Game
description:
Too many people treat drugs like a game, well say hi to a game you can treat like drugs.

Don't play with Drugs is a card game on crack; it's addictively fun and a good time with friends. Players will take turns trying to push drugs on each other while trying to keep themselves clean.

Players take turns Playing "clean" cards and " drug cards" on each other. Clean cards will help you get rid of drug cards or do other interesting things. Drug cards are bad, if you have too many drug cards on you, you will "Black out" and someone else must point at you and say "That could never happen to me!" putting you out of the game. The game keeps going until nobody is left (you can always call the last person out the "winner"). Thats right kids, nobody wins.

Don't play with drugs, play with Don't Play With Drugs . . . the game.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Ascendance: Call of Thuria
description:
Ascendance is a sci-fi game set in a grim future, where mankind has discovered a new resource: the Divine Power. Using this newfound power, they gained the ability to control and reshape everything around them. On earth lies the only way to reach Thuria, the place where this power lies. Several alien, or former human, races have come to earth to reach this place and claim the Divine Power for themselves.

The Ascendance - Call of Thuria board game is designed for 2-4 players of ages 12 and above. It is played with decks of cards which the players customize for themselves through the extra cards available on the game box, or future expansions. Players deploy Units, Structures and play cards from their hands, reserving Divine Abilities for when things get tough. The Game Board is used to play Events which harass or assist the players and also to help players choose Advantages, special situations that may turn the tide of battle.

The game is won via one of two ways. You can either destroy your opponent's Fortress by reducing its Hit Points to 0, or gather enough Divine Power to use your Ultimatum and completely annihilate your opponent.

GAMEPLAY
Once players have chosen the cards to use in their Decks, they must choose 5 Divine Abilities for the current match and then the game can begin. The game is separated into Phases, with each player completing their own Phase separately, unless another player intervenes. Players use Production Credits (usually called just Credits) to deploy Armies, play Commands from their hand and any other costs necessary. These Credits can be acquired by the Fortress, or other Structures. Players may also purchase Enhancements on their Structures or Units to make them better or change their use. Divine Power Points are also acquired every turn and the players use them to perform their Divine Abilities, powerful cards that may, if played at the right moment, judge the outcome of a battle.

Each turn, the chaotic landscape of Thuria or the monstrous Zordath pose a threat to the players. Events are drawn every turn and usually harass the players by forcing them to attack the Zordath or face a natural hazard. However, sometimes one can take advantage of these Events and gain the upper hand. Once in a while, an Artifact or a Power Source may surface on the world of Thuria. Claiming these may also grant a bonus.

Finally, each player at every turn chooses an Advantage on the Game Board. Choosing one locks it from the other players, so sometimes it may be preferrable that your opponent does not have a certain Advantage than you having one.

Phases are summarized below:
Event Phase - An Event is drawn and resolves.
Advantage Phase - Players choose their Advantage on the Game Board.
Draw Phase - Players draw Cards, gain Divine Power and pay any costs.
Support Phase - Armies are deployed and any purchases are made.
Assault Phase - Units are sent to deal damage to the opponent's Fortress.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Battle for York
description:
Battle for York is an area control/battle game set in a fictional world inspired by the Napoleonic Wars of the 19th century. The Empire of York has fallen apart after centuries of misrule. Now, many factions have formed, each with a different idea for how the next Empire should be run. The game plays with 2-4 players in an hour or less.

In this low-luck game, players carefully manage their hands of cards for one of two purposes: adding reinforcements or activating powerful tactics which may aid them in battle. There are no dice in Battle for York, so victory in battle is the result of player decision, planning, and sometimes, a careful bluff.

The game features 4 unique factions, each with unique tactics and abilities to gain the upper hand in the conflict. Every faction plays differently, which provides a deep and varied strategy game in a short amount of time. For first time players, a generic shared faction is provided to help you learn the game and the mechanics before diving into the complexities of factions.

Players take one action at a time, so there is little down time in this fast-paced game. Battle for York is a great light to medium game for game night.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Gladiatori: The Wolf
description:
Gladiatori: The Wolf miniature allows animal variant in the Gladiatori game.

With animals it's possible to play alone, or players against animals, or players against players with animals against all.
Many other player variants are allowed.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Gladiatori: The Lion
description: Gladiatori: The Lion is a new miniature for the Gladiatori board game. This miniature allows Animal variant in the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Captains Bold
description:
Captains Bold is a game in which the players take the part of a frigate Captain involved in ship-to-ship combat during the height of the Age of Fighting Sail. In the process of playing the game, the players consider the types of tactical decisions made by their historical counterparts and explore the ways in which those decisions may have affected the outcome of single ship combats of that time.

The movement and combat systems in the game have been deliberately kept simple and somewhat stylized, in order not to distract the player from the commander's decision-making process with details and decisions that would typically have fallen within the purview of his
subordinates. Likewise, the specifications of the vessels themselves have been abstracted to avoid making the game too much about the hardware.

The game takes place on a playing area consisting of hexagonal tiles which have a triangular grid superimposed upon them, with lighter colored dots at the vertices. The ships are represented on the playing area by counters, flats or miniatures, and move from dot to dot (referred to in the rules as "points") along the gray lines of the grid.

Most of the components of the game are included in the files which comprise the game.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Mage Wars: Minor Heal Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Allegiance in Blood story arc.

Minor Heal

Incantation, Healing
Cost 5 Mana

Heal target creature the amount rolled on 5 attack dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Death Ride Kursk: Das Reich
description:
DRK-Das Reich is the capstone game for the DRK-IISS game set. That is the final game in the 3 game set. This game builds on the first 2 in the set, DRK-Totenkopf and DRK-Leibstandarte. This game focuses on the Das Reich sector of the southern part of the salient. After a good start and rapid movement this sector of the front became quiet. Das Reich, from 8 July, did little in the way of attacking. DRK-Totenkopf, at a minimum (and DRK-Leibstandarte is recommended), is required to play this game. The game system features the representation of units at Platoon and Battery level for the Germans and Company and Battery level for the Red Army. The Command and Control and Fire Support Enhancements are built into this game, just as they are for DRK-Totenkopf and DRK-Leibstandarte. The Command and Control Enhancement provides Company sized replacement units for the Germans and the representation of communications between HQ (the concept of Radio Line of Sight is used) and the HQ ability to respond on its own initiative when commo is bad. The Fire Support Enhancement provides for artillery unit missions of Direct Support, General Support, and Reinforcing fires. This helps to restrict the fire of artillery in the game to something more like what happens in real life. Artillery cannot be gathered from around the map to support attacks or defense engagements. It must be planned.
Both of the previous 2 games start the battle from 9 July. This game does that and also provides a battle start, along the entire IISS front, from 4 July. The same game design features, from DRK-Totenkopf and DRK-Leibstandarte, are included in this game.
There are 22 scenarios included. These include the Das Reich scenarios for 9-13 July plus a couple of smaller regimental scenarios, and daily scenarios for each day from 4-8 July for all 3 divisions. A real action packed monster.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Yaoguai
description:
Evil has returned to the land. The malevolent Yaoguai, a demon of great power, has escaped its celestial prison. Returned to the world, it sets its sights on its true enemy: Sun Wukong, the immortal Monkey King.

As the Yaoguai makes its way down the mountain, Xuanzang spurs his disciple to action: he must set a trap for the fiend and seal it back within its prison, for if the beast can manage to defeat and consume the Monkey King, then it will steal immortality for itself. The Monkey King gathers the fiercest heroes and monks and awaits the demon at the foot of the mountain. He installs seers of great power to seek for the beast, and surrounds the camp with guardians to protect both him and his master. As Xuanzang prays to the goddess Guanyin for guidance and blesses powerful talismans with the mantra to bind the creature back to its mountain, the Monkey King’s generals sit and wait in anticipation of the coming conflict.

But, the Yaoguai brings a corruption that runs deep. It whispers dark, honey-sweet words of glory and promised enlightenment to those in the Monkey King’s camp, threatening to turn many who reside there into traitors. In its wake follows the shapeshifting Mo Shadow, seeking the flesh of Xuanzang to achieve its own sinister purpose. Fox spirits emerge to dart about, bringing their assistance to those they choose. And deep beneath the waters of a nearby lake, unbeknownst to all, a fish begins to quiver and sprout wings, and should this Peng burst forth, it will force an end to any fighting with its brilliance.

You are the Monkey King’s generals. Will you find and seal away the Yaoguai, or turn the power of the Talisman on the Monkey King himself? Will you weed out the traitors in the camp, or will you be the traitor, sending your men to capture their allies and make way for the demon? The deeds of this day will be forever recorded and you shall live within them, with either honor or infamy. The choices are yours.

In Yaoguai, take the role of one of the Monkey King's generals. Players draw and play cards from hand, simulating the conflict between the various entities in the game. The goal is to capture the correct combination of cards, or the highest overall point value, while attempting to maintain some degree of secrecy.

Yaoguai is a game for 2-4 people that is playable in 5-10 minutes, and is highly influenced by Chinese literature and mythology.

This game was a finalist in the Geekway to the West and BGG Micro game contest! Thank you to all who voted for it. It was a wonderful experience and I learned a lot. -Eric
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory

name: Invasion: Malta
description:
Invasion: Malta uses many familiar game mechanics found in similar scale wargames. Featured here are chit draws for activation of formations and individual unit efficiency ratings. The Axis player uses amphibious landings and airdrops to bring his units into the battle while the Allied player defends with artillery bombardment from behind heavy fortifications. Special rules include heavy tanks and dummy airdrops, and more, as found in a group of random events that players draw in order to obtain special capabilities, such as Deception Measures, Gas, Anti-tank guns, Transport, Smoke Screen, and much more. As you might expect, the game includes the highest quality OoB for both sides for each scenarios; we really dug into various national archives for this game. All scenarios stop after only a few days of campaigning as it is during this time that the battle would be decided.

Our hobby has perhaps a unique ability to explore the great questions of events in history. Here, what if during WWII the Axis actually invaded Malta. Who would win? The answer turns on many additional questions and circumstances. This two-player game explores several of these in three scenarios plus the bonus game covering the historical invasion of Leros.

Fall 1940: The Italians had big talk and many objectives during the war but not enough realistic plans. Perhaps the best time for their invasion would be in the fall, and perhaps timed along with the German invasion of Britain; or, if the Germans do not invade, then perhaps in place of the actual Italian invasion of Greece. Operational plans for Malta were poor but British defenses are weak. Perhaps the Italians could catch the British not reacting in time.

Spring 1941: In April 1941 the Axis had a choice, either occupy Crete or attack Malta. On April 21st Gen. Student, chief of the paratroopers, overcame opposition from the Wehrmacht Operations Staff, and others, in Berlin and persuaded Hitler to attack Crete. But, what if Hitler accepted the alternative recommendation to attack Malta? The Germans and Italians would now have to prepare for a combined operation, air, land, and sea, and do this quickly. The forces arrayed against Malta would have been huge, but the British were far better prepared than a year before and well fortified. The bloody issue would have been in doubt from the start.

Summer 1942: After a over year of preparation and study and agreement on the need to invade, the combined German and Italian staffs had put together an extensive and complex plan for invasion. Its success depended on many factors and lessons had been learned from the battle for Crete the year before had been put into effect. All was as ready as it could be, yet they did not invade. The British were stronger in numbers and weapons but their efficiency was down due to the long siege. Was it just Hitler’s nervousness about such an unusual Axis operation, or was it the allure of bigger victories elsewhere?

November 1943, Leros: The possibility of invading Malta had passed but the British had put themselves out on a small island in the Aegean, Leros. Incredibly, a large part of the British garrison consisted of the former Malta garrison, now well rested. In effect, it was a miniature Malta. This time the Germans did not hesitate, they invaded by sea and air. This tough little infantry fight shows just what grit was involved and how the experience of fighting on Malta would have been. The British lost, but the battle was close. All the flavor of the Malta battle is here but at only one-third of the size.

TIME SCALE: 8 hours per turn
MAP SCALE: 600 yards per hex
UNIT SCALE: Battalions and companies
mechanics: Chit-Pull System

name: Krosmaster: Arena ‚Äì Darkli Moon
description:
A promo figure and card for Krosmaster: Arena.

Darkli Moon has the Wild and Shadow Traits.

His attack is "Hammer Launch" for 5 action points dealing 2 damage in a hammer area of effect, then retreats 1 cell.

He has the power of "Shadow of the Jungle" which activates the first time a level 2 or higher "Wild" ally is KOed, he treats that Krosmaster as if it were 2 levels lower to a minimum of 1.

Flavor:
"That's no moon...
Every moon has a dark side. Even the cutie, hammer-wielding money god! Being a divine shadow has it's perks, like being able to wander on it's own and receive copious amounts of bananas in sacrifice. Kanniballs even worship him as the dark, fury protector of the island. Yet he is cursed to forever be overshadowed by another more famous monkey..."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest ‚Äì The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies
description:
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest is a non-collectible expansion to the Ophidian 2350 CCG arena combat game as well as a standalone game that pits futuristic gladiators against each other using unique and thematic mechanisms.

In the game, each player brings a team of up to four gladiators to the table, along with a customized deck that's driven by the selected gladiators. Gameplay revolves around a momentum-based system that allows the player with the momentum to continue to take actions until they lose momentum, at which point their opponent picks up and continues.

Players use resources to supply their gladiators with equipment and minions (support characters). The crowd gets involved through cheer and also provides an alternate victory condition. Win the crowd, and you win the game!

Mix and match cards from any Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest decks:

Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest ‚Äì Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest ‚Äì War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest ‚Äì The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies


Playing with four players will require a total of four playable decks.

Many character options, 4 different win conditions, and a large number of in-game choices/options makes this a truly unique and engaging game!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Baby Blues: Little Angels
description:
6 promo cards for the Baby Blues game.

Every player gets one card, devil side up.

When you trade a card with another player you have an opportunity to flip your card to the angel side when you make an honest trade. Though this is only possible outside your turn (so you need to help the active player to become an angel).

When the angel side is visible the player receives a few benefits:


At the end of your turn you can draw up to 6 cards if the angel side is still visible.
During your turn you are allowed to play 2 negative cards instead of 1.


But you don't stay an angel forever...


When you lie about the card you trade when the angel is visible you must immediately flip your card to the devil side.
Also when you decide to play 2 two negative cards in one turn, you must immediately flip your card to the devil side. At the end of this turn, you only draw up to five cards again.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Naval Battle in Archipelago
description:
Description from the publisher:

A realistic tactical simulation of naval combat in the 1970s, for two players.

This game represents a combat between two fleets in a group of small islands. It can be treated as a real battle, or as an exercise where opposing sides (Blue and Red) fight for supremacy.

This is one of our games with our original Triangle system. Each piece represent one ship, boat, helicopter... The movement mechanic is simple and very realistic for various types of vehicles, vessels, crafts and different kinds of weapons (guns, missiles, torpedoes...). The system is flexible and allows easy and precise positioning and determination of distance. The board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. The vertices are points where pieces are positioned, while lines determine direction of the piece or marker.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Bahama 1805 / HMS San Juan 1805
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Bahama was a Spanish ship of the line, built in Havana in 1780. Originally designed as 64–gun by Ignacio Mullan, she left Havana for Cadiz on 1785. Here she was rebuilt and completed as a 74–gun, following the project of Francisco Gautier, the designer of Nepomuceno class. As a 74–gun ship of the line, she was armed with 74 cannons and a designed crew of 640. They were armed with 28 32–Pounder guns in the lower deck, 30 18–Pounder guns in the upperdeck, 8 32–Pounder guns and 6 12–Pounder guns in the quarterdeck, and 2 12–Pounder guns in the forecastle.

The ship was part of the Spanish fleet that participated in the Battle of Trafalgar, where she was hit by the intense fire of British ships, with 75 killed and 65 wounded. Her commander, Commodore Galiano, died after being struck by a cannonball. After capture by the British fleet, Bahama became HMS Bahama, following repairs in Gibraltar. She sailed to England and was used as a prison ship.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Nepomuceno class “HMS San Juan 1805.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mojo Samurai
description:
In Mojo Samurai, your clan will have to use the ressources that destiny gives it to lead its samurais to victory.
Each player will fight enemy clans in a war without mercy for the control of the territory. This games plays in 3 rounds, and each rounds ends with a moment of truth that is brutal and short lasted. Mojo Samurai is inspired of the classic Koi-Koi (or Hanafuda).

At the begining of a round, Players deploy their samurais on deployement locations. (either their HQ, or an encampment that was built in a previous round)
Then, they draw 8 cards, the cards ranges from number 1 to three, in 4 different colors, and they contain one of 4 symbols)

8 more cards are placed face up on the table.
The players turn by turn associate card from their hand with a card on the table forming a pair (with matching number and color) If the color they associated is their clan color, they get a free deployment (placing one samurai in a deployment location) and they can make a number of movement with their samurais equal to the number on the cards they associated. For example, the red player associate a card with number 2 red from his hand, and 2 red from the table, he picks those cards up and places them in front of him. He then moves either 1 samurai of 2 spaces, or 2 samurais of 1 space. Since he associated a card of his color, he also gets to deploy (before or after movement) a samurai on the battlefield.

After associating a card, the player can spend the cards he accumulated by association using the various symbols on the cards to either destroy the content of a tile, build a fortress, build an encampment, get more movements, or deploy more samurais.

The battles on the field is one for one. Meaning that if a samurai attacks a space with one enemy samurai, both are destroyed, and the tile becomes free.

If the content of a tile is destroyed with the use of card symbols, a fortress (if present) on the targeted tile is sacrificed instead, saving the units present.

Once a round is finished, (with no associations possible, or no card symbols can be spend anymore) 2 victory points are allowed for the players controlling most tiles, the player with the most samurai on the battlefield, the player with most fortress on the field, the player with most encampments on the field, tied players get 1 points. and 1 point for each controlled special locations, and 3 point for controling the center tile.

After three rounds, the winner is the player with the most victory points.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Take That

name: Lobotomy: Three Little Pigs Expansion
description:
This expansion introduces the Three Little Pigs monsters, and includes three miniatures and rules.

The Three Little Pigs expansion was initially available through the Kickstarter, and was available individually, as well as part of the "Monster Bundle II" and the "Monster Bundle III".

The Three Little Pigs expansion was not a Kickstarter Exclusive.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Order of vampire Hunters: Shadroe 'Rat' Decatur Expansion
description:
An optional Kickstarter exclusive crossover character from the Fireteam Zero board game which comes with the following that can be used with the Order of Vampire Hunters game:

1 highly detailed plastic miniature
1 Hunter ID card
1 Basic Weapon card
Downloadable Hunt
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Mahonesa 1789 / Ninfa 1795
description:
The Santa Monica – aka Mahonesa – was the first of a series of 6 frigates of 34 guns, built in the Minorcan port of Mahón, and had as her first service the transport of troops of Mallorca. This ship performed various services along the Mediterranean sea, and took part to French Revolutionary Wars until she was captured by the HMS Terpsichore on October 13, 1796 on the Cape of Gata, after a fight of three hours with 21 dead crewmen.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Mahonesa class frigate “Ninfa 1795”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Unicorns & Zombies
description:
In the bleak, war-torn landscape of the not-too-distant future, a battle rages on. On one side, an army of the undead: former friends and family members who have succumbed to the zombie virus — decaying flesh and an insatiable appetite for destruction are all that remain. On the other side, a magic squad of unicorns: pixie dust and rainbow farts, their mythical horns as deadly as their enchanting glare. Which side will you fight for? Which will fight against you?

Unicorns & Zombies is a turn-based card game for 2-4 players which pits — you guessed it —unicorns against zombies. Players draw a trio of cards — weapons, gear, or action — and equip their fighter in the hopes of taking out the opposing teammate(s). Some cards can make your fighter nearly invincible. Others can make you want to flip the table over and rage-quit. You won’t though, because winning is more important than keeping friends. In groups of 3 or more, the fighter you pull is completely random, so your love of unicorns could be totally useless when you’re forced to fight as a zombie. And sometimes, you’re the only fighter of your kind on the table, so you’ll need to be strategic AF to win the round.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Coop Da Chickens
description:
A chicken dropping, wild game to cluck about!

The chickens have escaped their coops and its your duty to help return them to their homes but you’re not the only one the farmer asked for assistance. Its a race against time to collect and coop the most chickens, with help from your trusty dog and some other tricky tactics. In this fun and lighthearted game for the whole family.

Collect and coop same color chickens to earn points. Strategically time the placement of your chickens to maximize your coops value. Different chickens do different things when played. Some may steal other players chickens or even randomly redistribute all chickens in play.

With many different kinds of chickens including; Raging Chickens, Wild Chickens, Fat Chickens, and Roosters. You'll be feeling like a real chicken farmer in no time.

Easy to learn and fun for any age group, a great game for casual players and families.

Game Play:
Players start with a hand of 5 chickens and one dog per player.

On a players turn they will play a chicken into their yard face up and draw a card or coop chickens that are already in their yard which is done by turning the cards over and putting them in a separate pile. Once a chicken is cooped it is safe and cannot be stolen by a raging chicken or rooster. Most of the time you will only be able to coop chickens of the same color but using the dog card once per game, a player can ignore the same color rule. This comes in handy when you want to save a fat chicken. The game will continue until the deck is gone and all cards are out of player's hands. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Second Great War at Sea: The Cruel Sea
description:
Our Second Great War alternative history story arc posits a world in which Woodrow Wilson’s attempts to forge a compromise peace in late 1916 succeeded. Millions of lives were saved and vast destruction averted, while the great empires of Eastern Europe – Germany, Austria, Russia and Turkey – survived for another generation. But not all accepted this new world order, and in August 1940 war returned to Europe.

The Cruel Sea is a truly massive expansion set for Second Great War at Sea. It features the ships, airships, helicopters and airplanes of Imperial Germany, Republican France and Imperial Russia.

There are 740 brand-new die-cut (and silky-smooth) pieces: 380 double-sized "long" pieces and 360 square ones.

The Cruel Sea is intended as the foundation of the Second Great War at Sea; other supplements, like Sword of the Sea, will draw on this set for playing pieces (which lets us put even more new toys in those sets rather than repeating the same pieces).

There are also thirty new scenarios based on the battles waged during the first eight months of this war that never happened, in our popular story-arc format. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Bismarck and Arctic Convoy to enjoy all of the scenarios.

Our Second Great War background book describes the alternative history behind these scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Master of Orion: The Board Game ‚Äì Pollution Processor Promo Card
description:
Originally available at Dice Tower Con

Activation:
Reveal 5 cards from the top of the deck. Discard one of these cards, gain its exploitation effect, and shuffle the rest of the cards to the deck.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: BATTALIA NCBC: Rammoth Deleo-Arx
description:
Ready for defense! The rampaging Rammoth called Deleo-Arx is about to smash your city gates and bombard with ballista arrows the city walls at the same time. You will need special support of defensive weapons in order to hold the city level status.


NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basic competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replay ability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Warfighter: Expansion #24 ‚Äì Chinese Adversaries
description:
This expansion gives you the Soldiers, Weapons, Skills, and Gear to combat Chinese Adversaries! This expansion offers 56 cards including:


26 Hostiles
3 Events
5 Missions
5 Objectives
5 Objective Hostiles
12 Locations


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Crooked Kingdom
description:
In Crooked Kingdom, you are one out of six different characters trying to get ahead in a kingdom where everybody lies. But in order to advance and beat your friends you must use trickery and deceit to convince them that you are something else so that you can gain all the riches and win the game!

You can not let everyone get away with lying right to your face. During the game, you will have a chance to judge the other players when you become the Judge. You will have the power to challenge their claims and reap the sweet, sweet reward as they curl up in shame and the other players marvel at your ability to spot the lies (unless, of course, you are wrong and have to pay the penalty).

The first person to get enough points will win the game, it's up to you how to play. Will you be honest and take it slow and let the others be caught by the Judge or will you keep up the poker face while you lie through your teeth? Do you have what it takes to spot the liars of the group or will you be stuck paying coin after coin when you challenge someone who told the truth?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Auction/Bidding

name: Kordran Conflict
description:
On the distant planet of Kordra, a giant pageant continent is being reshaped as tectonic shifts tear the land apart, forcing each nation into war.

Kordran Conflict is a game that simulates combat operations in a sci-fi setting. It's unique gameplay blends elements of CCGs with a streamlined turn-based battle system that's best described as "a miniatures game for a chess player"

The Nations of the Kordran continent include:

New Halfox - Once mighty empire, torn apart by disinformation and civil war, now humble agriculturalists.
Temla - A nomadic tribe led by vicious warlords. Their devout religion has them chase radioactive meteorites, fallen across the continent.
Captious - A smart and cunning nation, their integration with technology has to lead them down a path like no other.
Shik'aree - The silent Shik'aree tribes dwell in the forests, rarely seen or heard, their greatest asset is their anonymity.
Hesperian - Traders and industrialists, this nation has long been the cog turning at the heart of Kordra's economy.

Kordran Conflict game system is fast and dynamic, players must combine unit's actions and abilities efficiently to win objective-based scenarios.
The board is made up of modular barriers that shape the map, these barriers can be build, destroyed, pushed around and more by specific units, making an ever-changing environment that is always in flux. Each scenario varies wildly in its objectives, challenging players to approach the game with new ideas and strategies.

Choose from a large selection of units across 5 Classes:
Trooper, Assault, Sniper, Heavy and Artillery.

Use their unique abilities and strategy in 5 battle modes:
Secure, Cargo, Bomb, Control & Bounty

Kordran Conflict is the first of its kind, a unique product that combines traditional boxed game components with .stl files to 3D print at home.
It's a miniatures game designed to grow and expand with new cards that include miniatures and playing pieces to download and then 3D print!
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Adeptus Titanicus: Titandeath
description:
This Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy expansion introduces the background of the Beta-Garmon campaign. It also provides a wealth of new rules and missions to use in your campaigns, including new maniples, Legion rules and a complete campaign system based on the events at Beta-Garmon.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: ¬°Misiles, Ahora! Pol√≠ticas Internacionales
description:
International Policies is a mini expansion of Missiles, Fire!, which modifies the gaming experience with cards that change the interaction with other players.

Now they can play up to 6 players, making them live the tension of the Cold War in a more intense way. This fight will cause more extensive games, with only the inclusion of 5 new cards and an additional copy of the Missile card.

Note: After the change to the second edition, this expansion became part of the base game, making the whole set a single game and causing it to stop publishing.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Warhammer 40,000: Shadowspear
description:
Shadowspear recreates the vicious fighting that took place across the corrupted wastes of Nemendghast, as Vanguard Space Marines of the Ultramarines 2nd Company clashed with the Master of Possession Vorash and his Daemonkin warband of the Black Legion.

Vanguard Space Marines are elite reconnaissance troops, trained to operate without support across the deadliest frontiers of the galaxy. Ranging far ahead of the main battle line, they prosecute full-spectrum campaigns of domination against the enemy by sabotaging communications, demolishing supply caches, and draining morale with terror strikes. Meanwhile, the devoted warriors of the Daemonkin believe that true ascension is only possible through the willing sacrifice of their living flesh. Led by Masters of Possession, they enact blasphemous rituals and commit increasingly terrible acts of slaughter, breaking the thin veil between realities and welcoming the raging spirits of the warp into their souls.

Shadowspear is a boxed set containing two armies split across the forces of the Vanguard Space Marines and Daemonkin Chaos Space Marines. You can use these miniatures to act out the scenarios described in the Shadowspear campaign book – six Crucible of War missions that can be played to recreate their bloody clashes on Nemendghast – and use them to expand your Heretic and Adeptus Astartes collections.

Included in the box:

Shadowspear campaign book
A 24-page softback book containing:

- War Zone Vigilus: a brief history of this embattled sentinel world and the events leading up to the arrival of Abaddon’s infamous Black Legion
- Into the Void: introduces the Vanguard Space Marines and the forces of the Black Legion that they uncovered on Nemendghast
- War for Nemendghast – describes the war fought between Strike Force Shadowspear and the Daemonkin warband led by Master of Possession Vorash
- Game Rules & Missions: this section includes a tree campaign consisting of six Crucible of War missions inspired by the story explored earlier in this book

Codex: Vanguard Space Marines
A 24-page softback book containing:

- Vanguard forces: a detailed background section on the Vanguard Space Marines, their bespoke wargear, heraldry and military role
- Datasheets: for the six new characters and units in the set
- Obscuration Discipline: a new psychic discipline unique to Vanguard Librarians
- Sons of the Primarch: Chapter Tactics, Warlord Traits and points values for the Vanguard Space Marine models, weapons and wargear

Codex: Daemonkin
A 24-page softback book containing:

- Daemonkin: a detailed background section on the Daemonkin, their bespoke wargear, heraldry and military role
- Datasheets: for the five new characters and units in the set
- Malefic Discipline: a new psychic discipline unique to Chaos Space Marines
- The Lost and the Damned: Legion Traits, Warlord Traits and points values for the Daemonkin models, weapons and wargear

Citadel Miniatures
35 single-pose plastic miniatures:

Vanguard Space Marines
- 1 Captain in Phobos armour, equipped with a master-crafted instigator bolt carbine and a camo cloak
- 1 Librarian in Phobos armour, equipped with a force sword, holstered bolt pistol, camo cloak and psychic hood
- 1 Lieutenant in Phobos armour equipped with a master-crafted occulus bolt carbine, grav-chute and pair of combat knives
- 3 Suppressors (including a Suppressor Sergeant) equipped with accelerator autocannons and a grav-chutes
- 3 Eliminators (including an Eliminator Sergeant) equipped with bolt sniper rifles and camo cloaks
- 10 Infiltrators (including an Infiltrator Sergeant and Infiltrator Helix Adept) equipped with bolt carbines

Daemonkin Chaos Space Marines
- 1 Master of Possession equipped with force stave and holstered bolt pistol
- 1 Venomcrawler equipped with a soulflayer, two excruciator cannons, tendrils and eviscerating claws
- 2 Obliterators equipped with fleshmetal guns and crushing fists
- 2 Greater Possessed equipped with a variety of daemonic mutations
- 10 Chaos Space Marines (including an Aspiring Champion with chainaxe and plasma pistol), 3 with boltguns, 4 with bolt pistol and chainsword, 1 with plasma gun, and 1 with autocannon

Extras
Also included are 2 transfer sheets – 1 Ultramarines Vanguard Space Marines sheet and 1 Black Legion icons sheet – and a fold-out Warhammer 40,000 Core Rules sheet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Toy story 4
description:
In Toy Story 4 you take turns picking cards from a common storage and immediately place them in front of you. The way the storage works is central to the game and where the real interaction takes place.

The cards show shelves with toys. The background behind the shelves is either green, yellow or blue. When you place the cards in front of you, i e build the shelves, you may have a shelf of each of the 3 colors.

Some toys get an extra bonus for being placed next to each other, other toys cannot be placed next to each other.
Usually you may only have one toy of each sort on a shelf so you will have to finish shelves during the game. When you finish a shelf you put it to your scoring pile and may start a new shelf of that color.

When the game ends you add up all points shown on the cards you in your scoring pile. Most Points win.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Connections, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles ‚Äì The Reaper
description:
Judson Caspian is a socialite by day, and a vigilante by night. After losing his wife to a robber in the streets, he becomes The Reaper, who prowled Gotham City during the 1950s, murdering juvenile delinquents by impaling them with a scythe.

This expansion adds The Reaper to the game.

Season 2 expansion.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Rabbi & Golem Character Pack
description:
Nathan ben Moses Hannover is in his seventies and very proficient in the kabbalah lore. A few years ago he went to Prague, seeing in his prophecies that hard times were coming back for his people. He managed to decipher Rabbi Loew’s notes and find out the secret of creating the golem—a mighty guardian. The old man and his silent companion went to Vienna to discover source of approaching darkness.

Warning: this is not a standalone product. You will need a copy of Anno Domini 1666 Base Game to use the contents of this box.

Contents:
• 2 Highly detailed plastic miniatures
• 2 Character cards
• 9 Item cards
• 1 Rulesheet
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Silver: Marauder Promo Pack
description:
A promo pack for Silver. This was available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

The card has a value of 12, and says, "Replace each faceup card of a specific value with a card from the deck, placing each faceup card on the bottom of the discard pile."

When you draw this card, you may replace each faceup card of a value you choose with a facedown card drawn from the deck. Those faceup cards are placed on the bottom of the discard pile.

All faceup cards from all villages with the chosen value must be replaced. Begin replacements to the active player's left. If the deck runs out before replacing all cards, the round ends normally.
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: The Grumpy Nisse
description:
Violet is a young girl who is nothing but trouble to her parents. Being adventurous and ignoring her parents' warnings about the dangers in the forest, she decides one night to climb out her bedroom window and wander into the forest, hoping to discover hidden treasures to be found only under the moonlight. What she doesn't know is that she is fated to become best friends (the greatest of treasures) with a kind Troll... if she bumps into him before the sun rises. For when the sunlight hits a troll, they transform into a rock for the day. And if this was to happen, Violet would never again have the chance to meet this particular troll.

The grumpy Nisse Torech though, will have no such thing! Aware of what fate has reserved for Violet, and opposing such nonsense as trolls befriending humans, he will do all in his power, to prevent Violet from meeting this troll.

The Grumpy Nisse, is a 2-player card game where one player is Violet and the other is Torech. Torech tries to prevent Violet from reaching the end of the forest before sunrise, in which case he will win the game. Players will play out one card each and compare their strengths to determine who wins the round, if Violet, then she will progress, otherwise she'll have to try again. Some of the spots in the forest will trigger events that can make the game harder for either one or the other player, so players need to be careful in how they play out their cards.

At the start of the game, players will draft cards to build the decks that they will play with for the duration of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Track Movement, Trick-taking

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Treeman
description:
Treemen in Blood Bowl aren’t so much players as defensive emplacements. In a Wood Elf team, they’re a vital strongpoint, helping to shore up your team’s shortcomings by punching them incredibly hard. For Halflings – whose shortcomings are perhaps too substantial for a whole team of Treemen to overcome – you can throw any underperforming players directly into the End Zone, should the occasion call for it. A multitude of build options for this plastic kit allow you to customise your Treeman (or Treemen!), and it even includes the Blood Bowl debut of a fan-favourite character – Akhorne the Squirrel!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex ‚Äì Imperial Guard
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Death Ride Normandy: Point du Hoc
description:
Death Ride Normandy series covers the entire Normandy campaign from 6 June 1944 up to Cobra. It will be as grand a game as Death Ride Kursk and have all the richness of that game series. This series will be broken down into many smaller games. The Base Game focuses on the operation at Point* du Hoc conducted by elements of the 2nd Ranger Battalion.

Component Lists:

Pt du Hoc Map
1x Counter Sheet
1x Scenario Card
DRN Common Charts and Tables (Losses, Air, DRMs, Firepower, Game Turn Track, Battle Board, Examples, Terrain, Shore Fire, Air/Naval Bombardment, Call for Fire, Fire and Assault Tables, Paradrop Tables, C2, and Logistics Tables...) bound into a spiral book
29ID Order of Battle
352ID Order of Battle


—description from the publisher

* should be spelled "Pointe", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pointe_du_Hoc
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Poule Poule: Oka Luda Goose Card
description:
Add the card to the animal deck.
When the Oka Luda Goose card comes into play, the foxes brood the eggs and the chicken hunt the foxes. All other animals actions remain the same.

Promo card found in Plato Magzine 129
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Memory

name: Deranged: Monstrumologist & Expurgation Promo Cards
description:
2 new Promo cards:

1 new Role card (Monstrumologist): "Defeat a Deranged. Reward: Expurgation"

1 new Reward card (Expurgation): "Spend 3 [Health value] and discard a Deranged Token from any Character."

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #60 ‚Äì Attu #1
description:
“I have always considered the landing of the Seventh in the fog of Attu, on May 11, 1943 an
amphibious landing without Parallel…” Maj. Gen. Holland M. “Howling Mad” Smith USMC.

On May 11 th , 1943, 16000 soldiers of the United States 7 th Infantry Division made amphibious landings on Attu, a remote and windswept Island in the Aleutians. The 7th Division had spent eighteen months preparing to fight in North Africa – training as a tank division for hot desert conditions, not as a light infantry amphibious force for arctic island warfare. The commanding General De Witt assured the high command that the Island defences would crumble in three days. It took 19 days of battle and over 500 U.S. Soldiers killed in action with more than 1200 injured. The Battle of Attu, which began with an unopposed landing, would end with unrestrained violence. The battle ended with a Japanese banzai counterattack that left almost all of the Japanese dead. It was one of the deadliest fights in the Pacific during WW2.

Warfighter: WWII Expansion #60 – Attu #1 adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions, including new Japanese Hostiles, US Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, and Skills:

4 x Player Soldiers
4 x Non-Player Soldiers
4 x Squad Soldiers
2 x Weapons and Equipment
1 x Skill
4 x Missions
4 x Objectives
11 x Locations
17 x Hostiles
5 x Events

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #61 ‚Äì Attu #2
description:
“We will carry out a charge with the heroic spirits of those killed in battle.” Col. Yamasaki Yasuyo.

On June 7th, 1942, Soldiers of the Imperial Japanese invaded Attu in the Aleutians Islands. After the landing the Japanese soldiers began constructing fortifications and an airfield. Realising the need to hold Attu, the garrison was increased to a 2500-man force under the command of Colonel Yasuyo Yamasaki. The Japanese were acclimated to the harsh weather conditions, they had prepared their defences, they were utterly devoted to their Emperor and prepared to sell their lives dearly. The US Forces landed 11000 Soldiers on May 11th , 1943 expecting to secure the Island in "three days". Over the next 19 days the US forces gradually gained the upper hand. Realising that there would be no help or reinforcements coming to help in an increasingly hopeless situation, on May 29th , Colonel Yamasaki, sword in hand, led a massive Banzai charge against the Americans. The Japanese military used the term Gyokusai or “Shattering like a Jewel” to describe the self-annihilation of the defending force, of which only 29 Japanese survived the battle. This was the only instance of a banzai charge on American soil.

Warfighter: WWII Expansion #61 – Attu #2 adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions, including new US Hostiles, Japanese Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, and Skills:

4 x Player Soldiers
4 x Non-Player Soldiers
4 x Squad Soldiers
9 x Weapons and Equipment
1 x Service Record Card
4 x Missions
4 x Objectives
10 x Locations
16 x Hostiles

—description from the designer

Errata: There are typos on card 61-22 (Arctic Trained SRC), which does not affect gameplay. This will be fixed in the next update kit.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Completionist Guise Promo Card
description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the of the Multiverse. It was available with Ultimate Collector's Case and is also included in Complete Hero Variant Collection.

Completionist Guise

Innate Power: "Impressive Collection" - Replace a hero character cards in play with a variant of that hero. Put the replaced cards safely under this card. Either use the power on the replaced card (treating any hero names on that card as "Guise") or Guise deals 1 target 2 psychic damage.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Black Rose Wars: Ordeal Promo Cards
description:
A promo-expansion included in LMS' Ashes Magazine (Essen Special 3), consisting of 12 cards providing potential bonuses in end-game scoring if conditions are met.

In game setup, each mage will get 2 Ordeal Cards of which 1 must be kept. The Ordeal Card will show 2 objectives that can each provide additional points for the mage in end-game scoring when met. However, if none of the objectives are met then the Black Rose will receive a significant amount of points.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses

name: Lost Empires: Solo Mode
description:
The war for the new sun has only just begun! Reap the most alien artifacts to build your worm gate and crush the enemy factions in this solitaire expansion for the asymmetric area control card game, Lost Empires!

This expansion for Lost Empires: War for the New Sun, provides players with all the content required to play the game solo. Compete against 4 different AI opponents with variable difficulty modes.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck Construction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: TLNB Universal (Common) Card Decks
description:
A simple, optional "Card Enhanced" mechanic that impacts on reinforcements and movement in games in The Library of Napoleonic Battles series.

There are separate decks for the Coalition and French player.

Specific decks were originally included in each game of the series but from Napoleon's Wheel onwards a common deck will be used together with instructions in each game on how to customise the deck.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dawning Horror
description:
Dawning Horror is an expansion for Four against the Great Old Ones. It contains 5 programmed adventures, each featuring an Investigator and a team of three Helpers. The adventures are:

The Horror of the Mine
Howl of the Mutated
Night Tour
Return to Antarctica
The Inheritance


This expansion is a prequel to Four against the Great Old ones, since the heroes are peeking beyond the veil of sanity and normality for the first time, and advantages gained in Dawning Horror can be transferred to the main game in the form of Upgraded Investigators. It can be played with Investigators from the base game, Carcosa Rising, or from two brand new classes: the Archaeologist and the Redeemed Cultist.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game ‚Äì Shadow Tower Spearmen
description:
The Shadow Tower Spearmen Protect the Wall’s Flanks From Attack

Everyone in Westeros knows of The Wall and the stalwart Night’s Watch that mans it. Slightly less well-known is what are on the flanks of the towering edifice. To the West, there’s the Shadow Tower. There, the brothers in black specialize in wielding spears, making them masters at defending against flanking maneuvers of enemy fast-attack.

The Shadow Tower Spearmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Night’s Watch players a new melee unit with which to protect their flanks. These troops train ceaselessly with their long spears, making them capable of inflicting severe damage on anyone foolish enough to try and charge them. They also know that their duty is to never break and run, standing unyielding against any enemy.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: –ò–º–∞–¥–∂–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–∏—É–º –î–æ–±—Ä–æ
description:
Before you is not quite a classic "Imaginarium". Each card in the "Kind" deck is the fruit of the joint creativity of a child and a professional illustrator. The children — pupils of orphanages and patients of hospices — put all their unbridled imagination into sketches, which were then worked on by the best Russian artists, trying to bring the clarity of lines and images to perfection, while retaining the idea and mood of a child’s drawing. This is a world of children's fantasy without limits and restrictions. And most importantly, these are stories that children can tell us. In the box you will find a brochure with original drawings and the names of their authors.

You can play Imaginarium Dobro even with preschoolers: the illustrations here are bright, and the images are understandable.
Finally, another feature of the game is that we created it together with the Civic Chamber of the Russian Federation and the charitable foundations "LIVE", "Ship", "House of Ronald McDonald", "Vera", "Sheredar", "Nastenka", "Creation" , "Rusfond". 100 rubles from the sale of each box of "Imaginarium Dobro" are transferred to these organizations to help children.

Want to see what cards are in the deck? You are welcome!

The updated version of the Imaginarium Dobro has a convenient plastic lodgement with storerooms for decks and a special closable compartment for chips. We've made the board removable and added scoring tips to make the game even more enjoyable. Also in the new version, numerators appeared - special tokens that help put the cards in order and make it easier to vote. Winged elephants, however, remained the same: bright, cheerful and transparent, like candy.
mechanics: Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Targeted Clues, Voting
